translated: Thus, by giving away the body, the perfection of generosity, which is called the ultimate perfection, arose.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / tsam po spyi'i klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / sa sbyin klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / mche ba drug ba'i glang po'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / rgyal ba dang mtshungs pa'i rgyal po'i bu zhum pa med pa'i dgra gzhon nu'i dus su ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par skyes pa la tshad med do; ;mtha' gcig tu gzhan yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / tsam po spyi'i klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / sa sbyin klu'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / mche ba drug ba'i glang po'i rgyal po'i dus su dang / rgyal ba dang mtshungs pa'i rgyal po'i bu zhum pa med pa'i dgra gzhon nu'i dus su ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par skyes pa la tshad med do; ;mtha' gcig tu gzhan yang /
translated: Similarly, when he was the nāga king Virūḍhaka, when he was the nāga king Sāgara, when he was the nāga king Bhūteśvara, when he was the elephant king Ṣaṇṇāga, when he was the prince Ajitasena, the son of King Jinarṣabha, he perfected the perfection of morality.

original: de yi dung skyong skyes rabs las //
analyzed: de yi dung skyong skyes rabs las //
translated: In his Jātakamālā,

original: gsal shing gis ni phug nas ni //
analyzed: gsal shing gis ni phug nas ni //
translated: he was impaled on a stake,

original: mtshon cha blangs nas dge pa dang // grong dpon bu la khro mi byed //
analyzed: mtshon cha blangs nas dge pa dang // grong dpon bu la khro mi byed //
translated: but he did not get angry with the weapon, the virtuous man, or the son of the village headman.

original: tshul khrims phar phyin bdag gi 'di //
analyzed: tshul khrims phar phyin bdag gi 'di //
translated: The perfection of morality is mine.

original: de bzhin du lus yongs su gtong bar byed pa ni /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus yongs su gtong bar byed pa ni / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality is the giving away of one’s body.

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: The perfection of morality is the perfection of renunciation.

original: de bzhin du yid bzang gzhon nu'i dus su dang / glang chen nor skyong gzhon nu'i dus su dang / lcags khyim mkhas pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid bzang gzhon nu'i dus su dang / glang chen nor skyong gzhon nu'i dus su dang / lcags khyim mkhas pa'i dus su ni /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of renunciation arose in the youth Sudatta, in the youth Hastivāraṇarakṣita, and in the wise Acyuta.

original: rgyal @329a *// srid chen po spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bdag nyid la skyes ba ni tshad med do //
analyzed: rgyal @329a *// srid chen po spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bdag nyid la skyes ba ni tshad med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang / mtha' gcig tu de'i bu zhi ba chung ngu'i skyes rabs las /

original: rgyal po chen po lag tu thob //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po lag tu thob //
translated: “The great king obtained it in his hand.

original: mchil ma'i sbu ba bzhin du spangs //
analyzed: mchil ma'i sbu ba bzhin du spangs //

original: rgyal srid spangs kyang zhen pa med //
analyzed: rgyal srid spangs kyang zhen pa med //
translated: He renounced his kingdom without attachment.

original: bdag gi nges 'byung phar phyin 'di //
analyzed: bdag gi nges 'byung phar phyin 'di //
translated: This perfection of renunciation is mine.

original: de bzhin du nges par bdag gi rgyal srid spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par bdag gi rgyal srid spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Likewise, I have definitely renounced my kingdom and have gone forth to the perfection of definite emergence.

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: This is called the ultimate perfection.

original: de bzhin du mkhas pa bi dhu ra'i dus su dang / mkhas pa khyab 'jug chen po'i dus su dang / mkhas pa tog rtse ba'i dus su dang / mkhas pa aa ra'i dus su dang / kun tu rgyu byang chub kyi dus su dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhas pa bi dhu ra'i dus su dang / mkhas pa khyab 'jug chen po'i dus su dang / mkhas pa tog rtse ba'i dus su dang / mkhas pa aa ra'i dus su dang / kun tu rgyu byang chub kyi dus su dang /
translated: Likewise, in the time of the scholar Vidura, in the time of the scholar Viṣṇu, in the time of the scholar Keturāja, in the time of the scholar Āra, in the time of the wandering mendicant Bodhi,

analyzed: mkhas pa sman chen po'i dus su ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par bdag skye skyes pa la tshad med do //
translated: in the time of the scholar Mahāvaidya, I was born and perfected the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / mtha' gcig tu de'i sde snod kyi skyes rabs las /
analyzed: gzhan yang / mtha' gcig tu de'i sde snod kyi skyes rabs las /
translated: Moreover, in the Jātaka Piṭaka of his canon,

original: mkhas pa sde can gyi dus su //
analyzed: mkhas pa sde can gyi dus su //
translated: in the time of the scholar Saṃgītiparyāya,

original: bdag gi shes rab tshol ba na //
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab tshol ba na //
translated: when I was seeking wisdom,

original: bram ze'i sdug bsngal grol ba dang // bdag gi shes rab mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: bram ze'i sdug bsngal grol ba dang // bdag gi shes rab mtshungs pa med //
translated: I liberated the suffering brahmin and my wisdom became unsurpassed.

original: bdag gi shes rab phar phyin 'di //
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab phar phyin 'di //
translated: This perfection of wisdom of mine

original: pha tshi'i nang gi sbrul bdag gis blta ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: pha tshi'i nang gi sbrul bdag gis blta ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like the snake in the father's story.

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: The perfection of the ultimate has arisen.

original: @329b de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par bdag la skyes ba tshad med do //
analyzed: @329b de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par bdag la skyes ba tshad med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang mtha' gcig tu de'i skye bo chen po can gyi skyes rabs las /

analyzed: ngogs ma mthong ba'i rgya mtsho'i dbus //
translated: In the middle of the ocean, without seeing land,

original: mi rnams thams cad shi bar gyur //
analyzed: mi rnams thams cad shi bar gyur //
translated: all the people were dying.

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind free from suffering,

original: bdag gi brtson 'grus phar phyin 'di //
analyzed: bdag gi brtson 'grus phar phyin 'di //
translated: this perfection of effort of mine

analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po las sgrol bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //

original: bzod par smra ba'i skyes rabs las /
analyzed: bzod par smra ba'i skyes rabs las /

original: sems med pa la gcod pa bzhin //🔽bdag la rno ba'i dgra sta yis //
analyzed: sems med pa la gcod pa bzhin // bdag la rno ba'i dgra sta yis //

original: gsal ldan rgyal po la mi khro //
analyzed: gsal ldan rgyal po la mi khro //

original: bdag gi bzod pa'i phar phyin 'di //
analyzed: bdag gi bzod pa'i phar phyin 'di //
translated: This is my perfection of patience.

original: de ltar sems med pa'i dngos po bzhin du bdag sdug bsngal chen po la lhag par gnas pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems med pa'i dngos po bzhin du bdag sdug bsngal chen po la lhag par gnas pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Thus, like an inanimate object, I remained in great suffering. This is the perfection of patience.

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: This is called the ultimate perfection.

original: bu zhi ba chen po'i skyes rabs las /
analyzed: bu zhi ba chen po'i skyes rabs las /
translated: In the Jātakamālā of Śāntideva,🔽it says:

analyzed: bden pa'i tshig ni rjes su bsrung //

original: bdag gi srog ni spangs nas su //
analyzed: bdag gi srog ni spangs nas su //

analyzed: rgyal rigs brgya phrag grol bar byas //

original: bdag gi bden pa'i phar phyin 'di //
analyzed: bdag gi bden pa'i phar phyin 'di //

analyzed: de ltar srog spangs nas bden pa rjes su bsrung ba de ni bden pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: This is called the ultimate perfection.

analyzed: lkugs pa dang / gzhogs phyed na ba'i tshul gyi skyes @330a *//
translated: In the Jātakamālā of Śāntideva,🔽it says:

analyzed: rabs las / pha ma bdag la mi dgos shing //

analyzed: nor dang grags pa'ang dgos pa med //
translated: nor do I need wealth or fame.

analyzed: bdag ni thams cad mkhyen la dga'//

analyzed: de ltar srog gi 'dod pa yongs su btang nas brtul zhugs la lhag par gnas pa ni lhag par gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin ba zhes bya ba skyes so //

analyzed: rgyal po gcig gis skyes rabs las / gang zhig bdag la skrag phyed med //

analyzed: bdag gis gang la'ang 'jigs ma byas //
translated: I do not frighten anyone.

original: byams pa'i stobs kyi steng gnas shing //
analyzed: byams pa'i stobs kyi steng gnas shing //
translated: Abiding in the power of love,

original: de tshe stong pa nyid la dga'//
analyzed: de tshe stong pa nyid la dga'//
translated: at that time I delight in emptiness.

analyzed: de ltar srog yongs su gtong ba la mi lta zhing byams par byed pa de'i byams pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: The ultimate perfection is born.

original: dang pa'i spu'i skyes rabs las /
analyzed: dang pa'i spu'i skyes rabs las /

analyzed: dur khrod du ni gnas par sems //

analyzed: rus gong la ni brten byas nas //
translated: relying on a skeleton,

original: bdag gi gnas su nye bar 'ongs //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas su nye bar 'ongs //
translated: And came to my abode.

original: gzugs la blta ba nyung ba med //
analyzed: gzugs la blta ba nyung ba med //
translated: There is no lack of forms to see.

original: de ltar grong gi khye'u la rdo la sogs pa blangs nas rdung ba nyid dang / me tog phreng ba dang / spos kyis nye bar spyod pa la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bskyed kyang btang snyoms su 'dor ba de ni btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar grong gi khye'u la rdo la sogs pa blangs nas rdung ba nyid dang / me tog phreng ba dang / spos kyis nye bar spyod pa la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bskyed kyang btang snyoms su 'dor ba de ni btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Thus, the perfection of equanimity is when, having taken up stones and so forth from the village children, one remains indifferent to the pain and pleasure of beating and the enjoyment of garlands and incense and so forth.

original: don dam pa'i pha @330b rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i pha @330b rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: The ultimate perfection is born.

original: de rnams 'dir mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'dir mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are summarized here.

analyzed: rgya chen yang slar 'di'i don spyod pa'i sde snod las blang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs nas thams cad sgrol gyi bdag nyid du gnas so //
translated: Thus, having completed the perfections, one abides as the very essence of Sarvanivaranavishkambhin.

original: sems med pa yi sa gzhi yi //
analyzed: sems med pa yi sa gzhi yi //
translated: The ground, which is without mind,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal mi shes kyang //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal mi shes kyang //
translated: Does not know happiness or suffering.

original: bdag gi sbyin ba'i stobs de yis //
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin ba'i stobs de yis //
translated: But by the power of my generosity,

original: lan bdun du ni rab tu g-yos //
analyzed: lan bdun du ni rab tu g-yos //
translated: It shook seven times.

original: de ltar sa gzhi chen po g-yo ba la sogs pa bsod nams chen po byed cing tshe'i mthar shi 'phos te dga' ldan du skyes so zhes pa mar me mdzad kyi zhabs drung nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa gzhi chen po g-yo ba la sogs pa bsod nams chen po byed cing tshe'i mthar shi 'phos te dga' ldan du skyes so zhes pa mar me mdzad kyi zhabs drung nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, he performed great merit, such as causing the great earth to tremble, and at the end of his life, he died and was reborn in Tushita.

analyzed: ji srid dga' ldan du skyes pa de rnams kyi bar ni ring po'i gzhi zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: From the time of his service to Dipankara up to his birth in Tushita, this period is known as the ground of far-reaching.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan du bzhugs pa nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs ba zhes bya ba skyes pa na 'jig rten 'dir sgra cher sgrogs pa gsum byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan du bzhugs pa nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs ba zhes bya ba skyes pa na 'jig rten 'dir sgra cher sgrogs pa gsum byung ste /
translated: Moreover, while the Bodhisattva was dwelling in Tushita, three sounds of great proclamation arose in this world:

original: bskal pa'i sgra cher sgrogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sgra cher sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i sgra cher sgrogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sgra cher sgrogs pa'o //
translated: the sound of the great proclamation of the eon, the sound of the great proclamation of the Buddha, and the sound of the great proclamation of the universal monarch.

original: de la lo 'bum phrag gcig gi mthar bskal pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'jig rten gyi ming du brjod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha mgo g-yogs kyis ma bsgribs pa dang / skra grol ba dang / du ba'i kha can lag pas mig gi mchi ma 'phyi ba gos dmar po gyon @331a *//
analyzed: de la lo 'bum phrag gcig gi mthar bskal pa 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'jig rten gyi ming du brjod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha mgo g-yogs kyis ma bsgribs pa dang / skra grol ba dang / du ba'i kha can lag pas mig gi mchi ma 'phyi ba gos dmar po gyon @331a *//
translated: The people of the world, who are not covered by the gods of the desire realm, who have loose hair, who are smoky, who wipe their eyes with their hands, who wear red clothes,

original: pa; lhag par gzugs mi sdug pa'i cha byad 'dzin par gyur ba'i mi rnams lam la 'gro zhing 'di ltar brjod do //
analyzed: pa; lhag par gzugs mi sdug pa'i cha byad 'dzin par gyur ba'i mi rnams lam la 'gro zhing 'di ltar brjod do //
translated: who have the appearance of being extremely ugly, go on the road and say this:

original: 'jig rten pa 'dis lo 'bum phrag gcig 'das nas bskal ba 'jig bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'dis lo 'bum phrag gcig 'das nas bskal ba 'jig bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “After a hundred thousand years of this world have passed, the eon will be destroyed.

original: 'di yi 'jig rten rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yi 'jig rten rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: This world will be destroyed.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'ang bskams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'ang bskams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great ocean will dry up.

original: sa gzhi chen po 'di dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyang thal bar gyur cing 'jig go /
analyzed: sa gzhi chen po 'di dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyang thal bar gyur cing 'jig go /
translated: This great earth and Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, will be reduced to dust and destroyed.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'jig par 'gyur zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'jig par 'gyur zhes brjod do //
translated: Up to the Brahma world, it will be destroyed.”

original: 'jig rten pa rnams byams pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams byams pa sgoms shig /
translated: Worldly people, cultivate love!

original: snying rje sgoms shig /🔽dga' ba sgoms shig /
analyzed: snying rje sgoms shig / dga' ba sgoms shig /
translated: Cultivate compassion!🔽Cultivate joy!

original: btang snyoms sgoms shig /🔽ma la rim gro gyis shig /
analyzed: btang snyoms sgoms shig / ma la rim gro gyis shig /
translated: Cultivate equanimity!🔽Serve your mother!

original: pha la rim gro gyis shig /
analyzed: pha la rim gro gyis shig /
translated: Serve your father!🔽Serve the head of your clan!

original: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro gyis shig ces pa 'di ni bskal pa'i sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro gyis shig ces pa 'di ni bskal pa'i sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the proclamation of the eon.

original: lo stong phrag gcig 'das nas slar yang sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten du byon no zhes brjod pa 'di 'jig rten skyong ba'i lha rnams 'di nas 'jig rten pa rnams lo stong phrag gcig 'das nas /
analyzed: lo stong phrag gcig 'das nas slar yang sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten du byon no zhes brjod pa 'di 'jig rten skyong ba'i lha rnams 'di nas 'jig rten pa rnams lo stong phrag gcig 'das nas /
translated: After a thousand years have passed, the gods who protect the world will proclaim, The Omniscient Buddha has appeared in the world!🔽 This proclamation, The Buddha has appeared in the world!

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byon no zhes brjod cing sgra cher sgrogs pas rgyu ba 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byon no zhes brjod cing sgra cher sgrogs pas rgyu ba 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is called the proclamation of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang / lo brgya 'das nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po byon no zhes brjod pa @331b ni lha nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / lo brgya 'das nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po byon no zhes brjod pa @331b ni lha nyid de /
translated: when it is said that a wheel-turning king will appear after a hundred years, this is the sound of the gods.

original: 'jig rten ba rnams lo brgya 'das nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du byon zhes sgra cher brjod cing rgyu ba 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba rnams lo brgya 'das nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du byon zhes sgra cher brjod cing rgyu ba 'di ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sgra cher sgrogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When worldly people say that a wheel-turning king will appear in the world after a hundred years, this is called the great proclamation of the wheel-turning king.

original: gsum po 'di ni sgra cher sgrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni sgra cher sgrogs pa yin no //
translated: These three are great proclamations.

original: de rnams las sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrags pa thos nas stong phrag bcu'i khor yug gi lha thams cad gnas gcig tu 'dus te /
analyzed: de rnams las sangs rgyas kyi sgra cher sgrags pa thos nas stong phrag bcu'i khor yug gi lha thams cad gnas gcig tu 'dus te /
translated: Hearing the great proclamation of the Buddha, all the gods of the ten thousand world systems gather in one place.

original: che ge mo zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar rtogs nas zhu ba'i phyir nye bar song ste /
analyzed: che ge mo zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar rtogs nas zhu ba'i phyir nye bar song ste /
translated: They approach to ask, “We understand that a bodhisattva named so-and-so will become a buddha.”

original: zhus nas kyang sngar gyi mtshan ma skyes pa la zhus so //
analyzed: zhus nas kyang sngar gyi mtshan ma skyes pa la zhus so //
translated: Having asked, they ask about the previously arisen signs.

original: de'i tshe slar yang thams cad kyi re re'i khor yug gi rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris dang / brgya byin dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa chen po dang bcas pa'i lha dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe slar yang thams cad kyi re re'i khor yug gi rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris dang / brgya byin dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa chen po dang bcas pa'i lha dang /
translated: At that time, again, all the gods of the four great kings, Śakra, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, Paranirmitavaśavartin, and Mahābrahmā,

original: khor yug gi lha rnams 'dus ba'o //
analyzed: khor yug gi lha rnams 'dus ba'o //
translated: and the gods of the outer ring gathered.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas su byang chub sems dpa'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas su byang chub sems dpa'i drung du song ste /
translated: They approached the Bodhisattva in the Tuṣita realm

original: drang srong chen po khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs pa ni brgya byin gyi phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: drang srong chen po khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs pa ni brgya byin gyi phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: and said, “Great Sage, you have completed the ten perfections not for the sake of attaining the excellence of Śakra,

original: bdud kyi phyir ma yin /🔽tshangs pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyir ma yin / tshangs pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of Māra,🔽not for the sake of completing the pursuit of Brahmā,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: not for the sake of completing the pursuit of the excellence of a universal monarch.

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten bsgral ba'i phyir dang / thams cad @332a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten bsgral ba'i phyir dang / thams cad @332a *//
translated: Moreover,

original: mkhyen pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mkhyen pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir rdzogs par byed do //
translated: in order to liberate the world and in order to strive for omniscience, he will perfect it.

original: de rnams ni da lta'i dus nas drang srong chen po sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i dus ni drang srong chen po sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhes zhus so //
analyzed: de rnams ni da lta'i dus nas drang srong chen po sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i dus ni drang srong chen po sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhes zhus so //
translated: These are the great sages who will become Buddhas in the present time.

original: sems dpa' chen po lha la gnang ba ma byin te /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po lha la gnang ba ma byin te /
translated: The great being did not give permission to the gods,

original: dus dang / gling dang / yul dang / rigs dang / yum dang / tshe dang / tshe'i bye brag lhag ma las med do //
analyzed: dus dang / gling dang / yul dang / rigs dang / yum dang / tshe dang / tshe'i bye brag lhag ma las med do //
translated: saying that there is no time, continent, country, caste, mother, life, or remainder of life.

original: chen po lnga po zhes bya ba legs par gzigs so //
analyzed: chen po lnga po zhes bya ba legs par gzigs so //
translated: He saw the five great ones.

original: de la dus dang / dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la dus dang / dus ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: There is what is called time and untimely.

original: dang po dus la gzigs so //
analyzed: dang po dus la gzigs so //
translated: First he saw the time.

original: de la lo 'bum phrag gcig gi thog ma nas 'phel ba ni tshe'i dus dang / dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lo 'bum phrag gcig gi thog ma nas 'phel ba ni tshe'i dus dang / dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: There, from the beginning of a hundred thousand years, the increase is the time of life and the untimely.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba rnams la gzigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba rnams la gzigs so //
translated: Because at that time, he saw that beings were born, aged, sickened, and died.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ston pa ni mtshan nyid lnga spangs nas gzhan pa ni med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ston pa ni mtshan nyid lnga spangs nas gzhan pa ni med do //
translated: The teaching of the Buddhas is not otherwise than the five characteristics.

original: de rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa ston cing 'di rnams ci'i phyir 'chad pa nyid mi nyan pa dang / mi dad pa dang / mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa ston cing 'di rnams ci'i phyir 'chad pa nyid mi nyan pa dang / mi dad pa dang / mi sems pa'o //
translated: They teach impermanence, suffering, and non-self. Why do they not listen to this teaching, have no faith in it, and do not reflect on it?

original: de ni dus ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus ma yin no //
translated: That is not the right time.

original: de'i phyir mi sems pa dang / ma nges pa'i bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi sems pa dang / ma nges pa'i bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a teaching that is not reflected upon and is uncertain.

original: de'i phyir de ni dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that is not the right time.

original: lo brgya ba dman pas tshe'i dus kyang de'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: lo brgya ba dman pas tshe'i dus kyang de'i dus ma yin no //
translated: Even a hundred-year-old inferior person is not the right time.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshe /🔽sems can nyon mongs pa shin tu che ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshe / sems can nyon mongs pa shin tu che ba yin no //
translated: Because at that time,🔽beings have very strong afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa shin tu che bas gdams pa @332b byin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shin tu che bas gdams pa @332b byin no //
translated: Because of very strong afflictions, they are instructed.

original: gdams pa la mi gnas na chu la dbyug pa rgyab pa'i ri mo bzhin myur du 'gag go /
analyzed: gdams pa la mi gnas na chu la dbyug pa rgyab pa'i ri mo bzhin myur du 'gag go /
translated: If he does not abide in the precepts, he will quickly disappear like a drawing on water.

original: de'i phyir de yang dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that is also untimely.

original: lo 'bum phrag gcig nas gzung ba'i 'og tu lo brgya pa'i mgor tshe'i dus te dus zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lo 'bum phrag gcig nas gzung ba'i 'og tu lo brgya pa'i mgor tshe'i dus te dus zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: From one hundred thousand years, below that, at the beginning of a hundred years, the time of life is called time.

original: de'i tshe yang lo brgya pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang lo brgya pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is also a hundred years.

original: de nas sems dpa' chen po skye bar rigs so zhes dus la gzigs so //
analyzed: de nas sems dpa' chen po skye bar rigs so zhes dus la gzigs so //
translated: Then, it is appropriate for the great being to be born, so he looks at the time.

original: de nas gling la gzigs te /
analyzed: de nas gling la gzigs te /
translated: Then, he looks at the continent.

original: gling bzhi 'khor dang bcas pa la gzigs nas gling gsum po rnams su sangs rgyas mi byon no //
analyzed: gling bzhi 'khor dang bcas pa la gzigs nas gling gsum po rnams su sangs rgyas mi byon no //
translated: Looking at the four continents with their retinue, the Buddha does not come to the three continents.

original: 'dzam bu gling nyid du 'byon no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling nyid du 'byon no //
translated: He comes only to Jambudvīpa.

original: gling la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: gling la gzigs pa'o //
translated: This is looking at the continent.

original: de nas 'dzam bu gling zhes bya ba dpag tshad stong phrag bcu'i tshad kyis che ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dzam bu gling zhes bya ba dpag tshad stong phrag bcu'i tshad kyis che ba'o //
translated: Then, Jambudvīpa is great with a size of ten thousand yojanas.

original: yul gyi phyogs gang zhig tu sangs rgyas byon par 'gyur zhes yangs shing grol ba'i gnas blta zhing yul dbus la gzigs te yul dbus zhes bya ba ni shar gyi phyogs na ka dzam ga la zhes bya ba'i grong rdal lo //
analyzed: yul gyi phyogs gang zhig tu sangs rgyas byon par 'gyur zhes yangs shing grol ba'i gnas blta zhing yul dbus la gzigs te yul dbus zhes bya ba ni shar gyi phyogs na ka dzam ga la zhes bya ba'i grong rdal lo //
translated: In which direction will the Buddha appear? He looked at the open and liberated place, and saw the central country. He said, The central country is called Kāśī in the east.

original: de'i pha rol na shing s'a la chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i pha rol na shing s'a la chen po'o //
translated: Beyond that is the great Sāla tree.

original: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs nye ba'i nang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs nye ba'i nang ngo //
translated: Then, beyond that is the inner region of the border land.

analyzed: shar lho'i mtshams su s'a la can zhes bya ba'i chu klung ngo //
translated: In the southeast corner is the river called Sālakā.

original: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
translated: Then, beyond that is the inner region of the border land.

original: lho phyogs su soo ta karni ka zhes bya ba'i grong rdal lo //
analyzed: lho phyogs su soo ta karni ka zhes bya ba'i grong rdal lo //
translated: In the south is the town called Sāketa.

original: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
translated: Then, beyond that is the inner region of the border land.

original: nub phyogs ka ba zhes bya ba bram ze'i grong rdal lo //🔽de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye @333a *//
analyzed: nub phyogs ka ba zhes bya ba bram ze'i grong rdal lo // de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye @333a *//
translated: In the west is the brahmin town called Kāvya.

original: ba'i nang ngo //
analyzed: ba'i nang ngo //
translated: Then, beyond that is the inner region of the border land.

original: byang gi phyogs su au shi ri'i ri'o //
analyzed: byang gi phyogs su au shi ri'i ri'o //
translated: In the north, the Ushirij Mountains.

original: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bas mtha'i ljongs dang nye ba'i nang ngo //
translated: “Moreover, the inner regions are near the borderlands.

original: 'di ltar 'dul bar bshad cing bstan no; ;dkyus su dpag tshad sum brgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dul bar bshad cing bstan no; ;dkyus su dpag tshad sum brgya'o //
translated: It is explained and taught in this way: three hundred yojanas long,

original: zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang sum brgya'o //
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang sum brgya'o //
translated: half a yojana and three hundred yojanas wide,

original: mtha' bskor la dpag tshad dgu brgya'o //
analyzed: mtha' bskor la dpag tshad dgu brgya'o //
translated: and nine hundred yojanas in circumference.

original: yul phyogs de rnams su ni sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos mchog rnams dang / nyan thos chen po brgyad cu dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: yul phyogs de rnams su ni sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos mchog rnams dang / nyan thos chen po brgyad cu dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / gzhan yang /
translated: In these regions, the Buddhas, the Solitary Buddhas, the supreme Shravakas, the eighty great Shravakas, the Chakravartin kings, and

analyzed: skyes bu chen por grags pa'i rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / shing s'a la chen po'i lta bu'i khyim bdag rnams 'khrungs pa'i gnas so //
translated: other greatly renowned beings, the Brahmins, and the householders like great Sala trees, are born.

original: de rnams las grong khyer ser skya zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: de rnams las grong khyer ser skya zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: Among them, this is the city called Kapila.

original: der bdag 'khrungs par rigs so zhes thugs kyis nges par byas so //
analyzed: der bdag 'khrungs par rigs so zhes thugs kyis nges par byas so //
translated: It is fitting for me to be born there.” Thus he made up his mind.

original: de nas rigs la gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba rje'u rigs sam /
analyzed: de nas rigs la gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba rje'u rigs sam /
translated: Then, the so-called “inspection of the family” is the so-called “Buddha” family, the merchant class.🔽

analyzed: gdol ba'i rigs la mi 'khrung ngo // slar yang 'jig rten pa mos pa'i rgyal rigs sam /
translated: Then, he looked at the family means that a Buddha is not born into a family of outcastes or of the warrior class.

original: bram ze'i rigs gnyis la 'khrung ngo //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs gnyis la 'khrung ngo //
translated: He is born into one of two families, that of the Brahmins or that of the warrior class.

original: da lta ni rgyal rigs la 'jig rten pa sems so //
analyzed: da lta ni rgyal rigs la 'jig rten pa sems so //
translated: Now, the world thinks that he is born into the warrior class.

original: de la 'khrung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'khrung ngo //
translated: He is born into that family.

original: bdag gi yab ni zas gtsang ma zhes bya ba'i rgyal po yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi yab ni zas gtsang ma zhes bya ba'i rgyal po yin te /
translated: My father is the king called Shuddhodana.

original: rigs la gzigs so //
analyzed: rigs la gzigs so //
translated: He looked at the family.

original: de nas yum la gzigs te /
analyzed: de nas yum la gzigs te /
translated: Then he looked at the mother.

original: 'dod @333b pa dang / chang la dga' ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yum zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod @333b pa dang / chang la dga' ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yum zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A woman who is passionate and fond of alcohol is not called the mother of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang / bskal pa 'bum phrag gcig la pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byas nas 'khrung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bskal pa 'bum phrag gcig la pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byas nas 'khrung ngo //
translated: Moreover, she is born after a hundred thousand eons, having completed the perfections.

original: nyams pa med pa'i tshul khrims lnga po nyid len no //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i tshul khrims lnga po nyid len no //
translated: She takes up the five precepts without transgression.

original: lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya ba 'di de dang 'dra ba bdag gi yum yin no //
analyzed: lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo zhes bya ba 'di de dang 'dra ba bdag gi yum yin no //
translated: The mother of the Buddha is called Mahamaya, the great illusion. She is like that.

original: gzhan yang gang de tsam gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang de tsam gyi tshe'o //
translated: Moreover, at that time,

original: zla ba bcu'i mgo nas zhag bdun du gzigs so //
analyzed: zla ba bcu'i mgo nas zhag bdun du gzigs so //
translated: he saw for seven days from the beginning of the tenth month.

original: 'di ni chen po lnga la gzigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni chen po lnga la gzigs so //
translated: He saw the five great elements.

original: gzigs nas / drang srong chen po bdag gi dus de sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i lha rnams kyi tshig gis gnang ngo //
analyzed: gzigs nas / drang srong chen po bdag gi dus de sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i lha rnams kyi tshig gis gnang ngo //
translated: Having seen, the great sage, by the words of the gods who were to become buddhas at that time, gave permission.

original: khyod rnams gshegs par zhu zhes lha de rnams btang nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyis yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: khyod rnams gshegs par zhu zhes lha de rnams btang nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyis yongs su bskor te /
translated: Having sent those gods, saying, You may go, surrounded by the gods of Tushita,

original: dga' ldan gyi dga' ba'i tshal du zhugs so; ;'jig rten gyi lha thams cad dga' ba'i tshal na yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi dga' ba'i tshal du zhugs so; ;'jig rten gyi lha thams cad dga' ba'i tshal na yod pa nyid do //
translated: he entered the Joy Grove of Tushita. All the worldly gods are in the Joy Grove.

original: de la 'di yi lha 'di nas shi 'phos nas bde ba'i 'gro bar skyes te /
analyzed: de la 'di yi lha 'di nas shi 'phos nas bde ba'i 'gro bar skyes te /
translated: Among them, This god, having died and transmigrated from here, was born in a happy realm.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas bde ba'i 'gro bar skyes so //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas bde ba'i 'gro bar skyes so //
translated: Having died and transmigrated from here, he was born in a happy realm.

original: sngar byas pa'i dge ba'i las byas pa rjes su dran zhing rgyu'o //
analyzed: sngar byas pa'i dge ba'i las byas pa rjes su dran zhing rgyu'o //
translated: Remembering the virtuous actions done before, he proceeded, I did this virtuous action.

original: de de ltar lha rnams kyis dge ba rjes su dran pa rnams 'khor du byas shing der rgyu'o //
analyzed: de de ltar lha rnams kyis dge ba rjes su dran pa rnams 'khor du byas shing der rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, surrounded by the gods who recollect virtue, he proceeded there.

original: shi 'phos nas lha mo sgyu 'phrul ma chen mo'i mngal du zhugs so //
analyzed: shi 'phos nas lha mo sgyu 'phrul ma chen mo'i mngal du zhugs so //
translated: After his death, he entered the womb of Mahāmāyā.

original: de la legs par brjod pa'i phyir 'di go rim bzhin du sngon gyi gtam brjod do //
analyzed: de la legs par brjod pa'i phyir 'di go rim bzhin du sngon gyi gtam brjod do //
translated: In order to praise him, this story is told in sequence.

original: de'i tshe grong khyer ser skyar dbyar @334a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer ser skyar dbyar @334a *//
translated: At that time, in the city of Kapilavastu,

original: zla 'bring po'i rgyu skar du brjod par skye bo thams cad rgyu skar la rtse zhing lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo yang nya'i sdun du zhag bdun nas me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos kyi 'byor pa dang ldan pas rgyu skar la rtse zhing longs spyod do //
analyzed: zla 'bring po'i rgyu skar du brjod par skye bo thams cad rgyu skar la rtse zhing lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo yang nya'i sdun du zhag bdun nas me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos kyi 'byor pa dang ldan pas rgyu skar la rtse zhing longs spyod do //
translated: in the middle month of summer, on the lunar mansion called Puṣya, all the people were playing in the lunar mansion. Mahāmāyādevī, after seven days from the full moon, with abundant flowers and incense, played and enjoyed in the lunar mansion.

original: zhag bdun gyi mthar snga dro langs nas dri bzang gi chus khrus byas te /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi mthar snga dro langs nas dri bzang gi chus khrus byas te /
translated: At the end of seven days, in the morning she got up, bathed in fragrant water,

original: 'bum phrag bzhi'i longs spyod spel te sbyin pa chen po btang nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan /
analyzed: 'bum phrag bzhi'i longs spyod spel te sbyin pa chen po btang nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan /
translated: increased her enjoyments to four hundred thousand, gave great gifts, and adorned herself with all ornaments.

original: kha zas bzang po zos te /
analyzed: kha zas bzang po zos te /
translated: He ate good food,

analyzed: de nas de thams cad @335a *//

translated: Therefore, the mother of the Bodhisattva, after giving birth to the Bodhisattva, died after seven days and was reborn in the Tuṣita Heaven.🔽Other women give birth after ten months,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yum thams cad kyi chos nyid do //

analyzed: lha rigs kyi rgyud kyi grong khyer chen po lha bstan du bdag 'gro bar 'dong do //

analyzed: rgyal pos legs so zhes brjod nas gnang ngo //

translated: Between Kapilavastu and Devakula, the road was made even, and they set up decorations of plantain trees, full vases, victory banners, flags, and so forth. The goddess was seated on a golden palanquin,

analyzed: blon po stong phrag gcig gis bteg ste /

original: yal ga'i bar nyid dang / me tog gi bar kha dog sna lnga pa'i bung ba mang po lding ba dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya mang po'i tshogs ni snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs sgrogs shing spyod do //
analyzed: yal ga'i bar nyid dang / me tog gi bar kha dog sna lnga pa'i bung ba mang po lding ba dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya mang po'i tshogs ni snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs sgrogs shing spyod do //
translated: In between the branches, in between the flowers, many bees hovered, their colors of five different kinds. Many flocks of birds of various kinds sang melodious songs and frolicked.

original: lumbi n'a'i tshal thams cad ni shing rta sna tshogs pa'i tshal bzhin du mthu dang / dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i mdzes par byas pa'i mdun sa lta bu de lha mos gzigs nas shing s'a la'i tshal du rtse bar bsam pa skyes so //
analyzed: lumbi n'a'i tshal thams cad ni shing rta sna tshogs pa'i tshal bzhin du mthu dang / dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i mdzes par byas pa'i mdun sa lta bu de lha mos gzigs nas shing s'a la'i tshal du rtse bar bsam pa skyes so //
translated: The entire Lumbini Grove was like a grove of various chariots. Its power and majesty were like the royal palace of King Indra. The queen saw this and thought of playing in the Sāla Grove.

original: blon po rnams kyis lha mo bteg nas shing s'a la'i tshal du bzhugs so //
analyzed: blon po rnams kyis lha mo bteg nas shing s'a la'i tshal du bzhugs so //
translated: The ministers lifted the queen and she went to the Sāla Grove.

original: de bkra shis pa'i shing s'a la'i rtsa bar gshegs te des shing s'a la'i yal ga bzung bar sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de bkra shis pa'i shing s'a la'i rtsa bar gshegs te des shing s'a la'i yal ga bzung bar sems par gyur te /
translated: She went to the foot of an auspicious Sāla tree and thought of grasping a branch of the Sāla tree.

original: des shing s'a la'i yal ga shin tu legs pa me la sros nas bkug pa bzhin du mdud pa la lha mo'i lag par nye bar 'phyang ngo //
analyzed: des shing s'a la'i yal ga shin tu legs pa me la sros nas bkug pa bzhin du mdud pa la lha mo'i lag par nye bar 'phyang ngo //
translated: She was like a well-trained branch of a sāla tree, which bends down to the fire when heated.

original: de'i lag pa brkyang nas yal ga'i rtse mo bzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i lag pa brkyang nas yal ga'i rtse mo bzung ngo //
translated: She extended her hand and took hold of the top of the branch.

original: de ma thag tu las kyi rlung gis bskyod do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu las kyi rlung gis bskyod do //
translated: Immediately, the wind of karma stirred.

original: de nas de'i phyogs kun tu yol ba byas nas skye bo thams cad phyir ring du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de'i phyogs kun tu yol ba byas nas skye bo thams cad phyir ring du gyur te /
translated: Then, a curtain was drawn all around her, and all the people were sent far away.

original: shing s'a la'i yal ga bzung nas 'dug pa nyid la de ltar de'i mngal nas @337b bltams par gyur to //
analyzed: shing s'a la'i yal ga bzung nas 'dug pa nyid la de ltar de'i mngal nas @337b bltams par gyur to //
translated: She gave birth to him while holding onto the top of the sāla branch.

original: de ma thag rnam par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i tshangs pa bzhi bos gser gyi dra ba blangs nas slob bo //
analyzed: de ma thag rnam par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i tshangs pa bzhi bos gser gyi dra ba blangs nas slob bo //
translated: Immediately, the four gods of joy, with joyful minds, took up a golden net and held it.

original: de rnams kyis der gser gyi dra bas byang chub sems dpa' blangs te yum gyi mdun na 'dug go /
analyzed: de rnams kyis der gser gyi dra bas byang chub sems dpa' blangs te yum gyi mdun na 'dug go /
translated: They took the Bodhisattva with the golden net and placed him in front of his mother.

original: lha mo / sems sdug bsngal bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: lha mo / sems sdug bsngal bar ma byed cig /
translated: “Goddess, do not be sad!”

original: khyed kyi sras dbang phyug dang / grags pa dang bcas pa bltams so zhes smras so; ;de ltar yang sems can gzhan rnams ma'i rum nas 'thon pa na mi gtsang bas gos shing skyug bro ba can 'thon no //
analyzed: khyed kyi sras dbang phyug dang / grags pa dang bcas pa bltams so zhes smras so; ;de ltar yang sems can gzhan rnams ma'i rum nas 'thon pa na mi gtsang bas gos shing skyug bro ba can 'thon no //
translated: Other beings, when they emerge from the mother's womb, emerge covered with impurities, disgusting.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But not so the Bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang / chos kyi khri nas chos 'chad pa 'bab pa bzhin dang / skas la 'bab pa'i skyes bu bzhin du lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis brkyang nas 'dug pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos kyi khri nas chos 'chad pa 'bab pa bzhin dang / skas la 'bab pa'i skyes bu bzhin du lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis brkyang nas 'dug pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, he emerges from the womb like a preacher descending from a Dharma seat, like a man descending from a staircase, with his two hands and two feet extended.

original: ma'i rum nas mi gtsang ba cung zad kyis kyang ma gos par dag cing 'jigs pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma'i rum nas mi gtsang ba cung zad kyis kyang ma gos par dag cing 'jigs pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: He emerges from the womb without being soiled by the slightest impurity, pure and fearless.

original: yul ka shi ka'i ras kyi nang du nor bu rin po che bcug pa bzhin du 'od 'gyed cing yum gyi? rum nas 'thon no //
analyzed: yul ka shi ka'i ras kyi nang du nor bu rin po che bcug pa bzhin du 'od 'gyed cing yum gyi? rum nas 'thon no //
translated: He emerges from the womb shining like a jewel placed in the middle of a cloth of Benares silk.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yum de dag par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' nas chu'i rgyun gnyis babs pas byang chub sems dpa' dang / yum gyi sku dag par byas so //🔽de'ang gser gyi dra bas blangs nas tshangs pa 'dug pa'i lag nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams kyis bkra shis pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par @338a *//
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yum de dag par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' nas chu'i rgyun gnyis babs pas byang chub sems dpa' dang / yum gyi sku dag par byas so // de'ang gser gyi dra bas blangs nas tshangs pa 'dug pa'i lag nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams kyis bkra shis pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par @338a *//
translated: In order to purify the Bodhisattva and the Bodhisattva’s mother, two streams of water fell from the sky, purifying the body of the Bodhisattva and the mother.

original: bya ba'i phyir gzig gi pags pas sngar gyi bzhin du blangs so //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir gzig gi pags pas sngar gyi bzhin du blangs so //
translated: Then, having been received on a golden net, the four great kings received it in their hands from Brahmā, and in order to bring about auspiciousness and the experience of happiness, they received it on a leopard skin as before.

original: de rnams kyi lag nas mi rnams kyis du gu la'i ras kyi steng du blangs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lag nas mi rnams kyis du gu la'i ras kyi steng du blangs so //
translated: Then, having been received in the hands of the humans, they received it on a cloth from Dūgulapatta.

original: mi rnams kyi lag tu btang nas sa la gnas so //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lag tu btang nas sa la gnas so //
translated: Having been placed in the hands of the humans, they remained on the ground.

original: shar phyogs la gzigs te /
analyzed: shar phyogs la gzigs te /
translated: Looking to the east,

original: stong phrag du ma'i khor yug rnams phan tshun du mthong ngo //
analyzed: stong phrag du ma'i khor yug rnams phan tshun du mthong ngo //
translated: he saw the surrounding areas for many thousands of leagues.

original: de'i lha dang / mi rnams kyis me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos la sogs pas mchod cing skyes bu chen po khyod lta bu 'di na med /
analyzed: de'i lha dang / mi rnams kyis me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos la sogs pas mchod cing skyes bu chen po khyod lta bu 'di na med /
translated: The gods and humans there worshiped him with flower garlands, incense, and so forth, saying, “There is no one like you, great being.

original: khyod kyi gong na gzhan du 'ang med do zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyi gong na gzhan du 'ang med do zhes smras so //
translated: There is no one above you, nor is there anyone else like you.”

original: de bzhin du phyogs bzhi dang / mtshams bzhi dang / 'og dang / steng gi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bzhi dang / mtshams bzhi dang / 'og dang / steng gi ste /
translated: In the same way, he looked to the four directions, the four intermediate directions, below, and above.

original: phyogs bcu po thams cad legs par gzigs nas bdag dang mtshungs pa med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu po thams cad legs par gzigs nas bdag dang mtshungs pa med par mthong ngo //
translated: Having looked well in all ten directions, he saw that there was no one equal to him.

original: de nas byang gi phyogs su gom pa bdun bgrod do; ;tshangs pa chen po gdugs dkar po 'dzin cing 'thab bral bas rnga yab g-yob pa /
analyzed: de nas byang gi phyogs su gom pa bdun bgrod do; ;tshangs pa chen po gdugs dkar po 'dzin cing 'thab bral bas rnga yab g-yob pa /
translated: Then he took seven steps north, and Great Brahmā held up a white parasol, while the gods of the Yāma heaven fanned him with yak-tail whisks.

original: lha gzhan rnams kyis rgyal po la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po ma lus pa lag tu thogs nas rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kyis rgyal po la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po ma lus pa lag tu thogs nas rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: Other gods followed him, holding in their hands all the necessary articles for a king.

original: de nas gom pa bdun pa la gnas pa na 'jig rten pa rnams las bdag mchog go zhes pa la sogs pa'i shis pa brjod pa'i gtam brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas gom pa bdun pa la gnas pa na 'jig rten pa rnams las bdag mchog go zhes pa la sogs pa'i shis pa brjod pa'i gtam brjod cing /
translated: Then, when he was in the seventh step, the people said, “You are the best of us!” and so on, and they spoke auspicious words.

original: sengge'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: sengge'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: He roared the lion’s roar.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang skye ba gsum du yum gyi rum nas 'thon tsam nas gtam du brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang skye ba gsum du yum gyi rum nas 'thon tsam nas gtam du brjod do //
translated: The Bodhisattva also spoke these words when he was about to emerge from his mother’s womb in his last three births.

original: sman chen por skyes pa dang / thams cad @338b sgrol du skyes pa dang / 'dir skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sman chen por skyes pa dang / thams cad @338b sgrol du skyes pa dang / 'dir skyes pa'o //
translated: He was born as Mahāvaidya, Viśvantara, and here.

original: sman chen po skyes pa na yum gyi rum nas 'thon ma thag nyid du brgya byin lha'i rgyal po 'ongs te tsandan gyi snying po lag tu thogs nas song ngo //
analyzed: sman chen po skyes pa na yum gyi rum nas 'thon ma thag nyid du brgya byin lha'i rgyal po 'ongs te tsandan gyi snying po lag tu thogs nas song ngo //
translated: When he was born as Mahāvaidya, as soon as he emerged from his mother’s womb, Śakra, king of the gods, came and placed a heart of sandalwood in his hand.

original: de de rnams kyi khu tshur du bcug nas 'thon no //
analyzed: de de rnams kyi khu tshur du bcug nas 'thon no //
translated: He put it in their cupped hands and emerged.

original: de nas yang yum gyis dris pa /
analyzed: de nas yang yum gyis dris pa /
translated: Then his mother asked,

original: bu / ci khyer nas 'ongs /
analyzed: bu / ci khyer nas 'ongs /
translated: “Son, what did you bring?”

original: ma / sman yin no //
analyzed: ma / sman yin no //
translated: “Mother, it is medicine.”

original: 'dis sman khyer nas 'ongs pa'i phyir sman gyi khye'u zhes bya bar ming btags so //
analyzed: 'dis sman khyer nas 'ongs pa'i phyir sman gyi khye'u zhes bya bar ming btags so //
translated: Because he brought medicine, he was named the boy Vaidya.

original: des sman blangs nas chu'i snod kyi nang du bcug go /
analyzed: des sman blangs nas chu'i snod kyi nang du bcug go /
translated: He took the medicine and put it in a vessel of water.

original: 'ongs shing 'ongs pa'i long ba dang / 'on ba la sogs pa de rnams de nyid kyi nad thams cad nye bar zhi bas na sman par gyur to //
analyzed: 'ongs shing 'ongs pa'i long ba dang / 'on ba la sogs pa de rnams de nyid kyi nad thams cad nye bar zhi bas na sman par gyur to //
translated: The blind, the deaf, and so on, who came and came, all their illnesses were cured by that medicine, and he became a doctor.

original: de nas sman chen po sman chen po zhes brjod cing skyes pa'i tshig gi rgyus sman chen po nyid de'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sman chen po sman chen po zhes brjod cing skyes pa'i tshig gi rgyus sman chen po nyid de'i ming du gyur to //
translated: Then, because of the words of the people who said, “Great medicine, great medicine,” the name of Great Medicine became his name.

original: gzhan yang / thams cad sgrol du skyes pa na ma'i rum nas skyes tsam na lag pa g-yas pa brkyang nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad sgrol du skyes pa na ma'i rum nas skyes tsam na lag pa g-yas pa brkyang nas /
translated: Moreover, when he was born as Viśvantara, as soon as he was born from his mother’s womb, he extended his right hand

original: yum / bdag cag gi khyim na spyin pa gtang rgyu 'dra bdog gam zhes brjod cing 'thon no //
analyzed: yum / bdag cag gi khyim na spyin pa gtang rgyu 'dra bdog gam zhes brjod cing 'thon no //
translated: and said, “Mother, is there anything to give in charity in our house?” and he came out.

original: de nas de'i mas /
analyzed: de nas de'i mas /
translated: Then his mother said,

original: bu / 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rigs su khyod skyes so //
analyzed: bu / 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rigs su khyod skyes so //
translated: “Son, you were born into a family that has wealth.”

original: bu'i lag pa rang gi lag ba'i steng du gzhag ste /
analyzed: bu'i lag pa rang gi lag ba'i steng du gzhag ste /
translated: She placed the boy’s hand on her breast

original: nor bu rin po che stong phrag gcig gi snod bzhag go /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che stong phrag gcig gi snod bzhag go /
translated: and placed a vessel of one thousand precious jewels in it.

original: gzhan yang / 'di skyes pa na 'dis sengge'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di skyes pa na 'dis sengge'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: Moreover, when he was born, he roared the lion’s roar:🔽“I am the highest among men, the best of men, the last birth, the one who has gone beyond to the other shore.”

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gsum du ma'i rum nas skyes tsam nas gtam brjod do //🔽ji ltar yang rum du zhugs tsam dang / bltams tsam na sum cu rtsa gnyis sngon gyi @339a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gsum du ma'i rum nas skyes tsam nas gtam brjod do // ji ltar yang rum du zhugs tsam dang / bltams tsam na sum cu rtsa gnyis sngon gyi @339a *//
translated: In the same way, as soon as the Bodhisattva was born from his mother’s right side, he spoke.

original: mtshan ma bzhin du skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: mtshan ma bzhin du skyes par gyur to //
translated: Just as soon as he entered the womb and was born, the thirty-two marks of a great being appeared on his body.

original: gzhan yang / gang gi tshe bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' lumbi ni'i tshal du bltams so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang gi tshe bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' lumbi ni'i tshal du bltams so //
translated: Moreover, when we were born in Lumbini Grove,

original: de ma thag tu lha mo sgra gcan 'dzin gyi ma dang / blon po 'dun pa dang / blon po nag po 'char ka dang / rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan dang / byang chub kyi shing dang / gter bzhi'i bum pa skyes so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu lha mo sgra gcan 'dzin gyi ma dang / blon po 'dun pa dang / blon po nag po 'char ka dang / rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan dang / byang chub kyi shing dang / gter bzhi'i bum pa skyes so //
translated: immediately the goddess Yaśodharā, the mother of Rāhula, the minister Aśvai, the minister Kṛṣṇa Udayana, the king of horses Kaṇṭhaka, the Bodhi tree, and the four treasure vases were born.

original: de la gcig la rgyang grags bzhi dang / gcig la rgyang grags brgyad dang / gcig la rgyang grags bcu gnyis dang / gcig la rgyang grags bcu drug go /
analyzed: de la gcig la rgyang grags bzhi dang / gcig la rgyang grags brgyad dang / gcig la rgyang grags bcu gnyis dang / gcig la rgyang grags bcu drug go /
translated: One was four krośas, one was eight krośas, one was twelve krośas, and one was sixteen krośas.

original: bdun po 'di lhan cig tu skyis pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun po 'di lhan cig tu skyis pa yin no //
translated: These seven were born together.

original: grong khyer gnyis na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' khrid nas grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi kho nar phyin no //
analyzed: grong khyer gnyis na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' khrid nas grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi kho nar phyin no //
translated: The people of the two cities took the Bodhisattva and went only to the city of Kapilavastu.

original: nyi ma de nyid la grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi la rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gi sras por bltams so //
analyzed: nyi ma de nyid la grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi la rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gi sras por bltams so //
translated: On that very day, in the city of Kapilavastu, the son of King Śuddhodana was born.

original: gzhon nu 'di byang chub shing gi drung du bzhugs nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes pa la sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas kyi lha rnams kyis dga' ba dang / tshim pas lag pa gyen du bskyod nas rtse zhing bstod pa byed do //
analyzed: gzhon nu 'di byang chub shing gi drung du bzhugs nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes pa la sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas kyi lha rnams kyis dga' ba dang / tshim pas lag pa gyen du bskyod nas rtse zhing bstod pa byed do //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, with joy and satisfaction, raised their arms and said, This youth, sitting under the Bodhi tree, will become a Buddha.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gis mchod gnas snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad thob pa'i dka' thub pa nag po lha len zhes bya ba kha zas bzang po la longs spyod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gis mchod gnas snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad thob pa'i dka' thub pa nag po lha len zhes bya ba kha zas bzang po la longs spyod do //
translated: At that time, King Śuddhodana had a guru named Asita, who had attained the eight liberations. He enjoyed good food.

original: nyin mo nyi ma la mi gnas pa'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum @339b gyi gnas su 'gro zhing der bde bar 'dug nas lha de rnams blta'o //
analyzed: nyin mo nyi ma la mi gnas pa'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum @339b gyi gnas su 'gro zhing der bde bar 'dug nas lha de rnams blta'o //
translated: During the day, because he did not stay in the sun, he went to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three. There he sat comfortably and looked at the gods.

original: khyed rnams ci'i phyir 'di ltar dga' ba'i sems kyis rtse /
analyzed: khyed rnams ci'i phyir 'di ltar dga' ba'i sems kyis rtse /
translated: “Why are you all so happy and playing like this?” he asked.

original: bdag kyang 'di rnams kyi ched du bya ba kho bo la ston cig ces dris so //
analyzed: bdag kyang 'di rnams kyi ched du bya ba kho bo la ston cig ces dris so //
translated: “Please show me what you are doing.”

original: lha rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The gods said,

original: drang srong chen po //
analyzed: drang srong chen po //
translated: “Great sage!

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gi sras bltams so //
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gi sras bltams so //
translated: The son of King Śuddhodana has been born.

original: des byang chub shing gi drung du bzhugs nas sangs rgyas su gyur nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: des byang chub shing gi drung du bzhugs nas sangs rgyas su gyur nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: He sat under the Bodhi tree, became a buddha, and turned the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: de nas mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rol mo blta ba dang / chos thams cad thob bo snyam pa 'di rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gyis dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas mtha' yas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rol mo blta ba dang / chos thams cad thob bo snyam pa 'di rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gyis dga' bar gyur to //
translated: Then, seeing the infinite music of the Buddhas, and thinking that he had attained all the Dharmas, he was filled with joy.

original: dka' thub pas de'i tshig thos nas myur du lha'i yul nas babs te /
analyzed: dka' thub pas de'i tshig thos nas myur du lha'i yul nas babs te /
translated: When the ascetic heard these words, he quickly descended from the celestial realm.

original: rgyal bo'i gnas su 'ongs nas /
analyzed: rgyal bo'i gnas su 'ongs nas /
translated: Arriving at the king's palace,

original: gdan bshams pa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: gdan bshams pa la 'dug ste /
translated: he sat on the prepared seat.

original: bu rnams / rgyal po chen po'i sras su gyur pa de bdag gis blta'o zhes smras so; ;rgyal pos rgyan dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu blangs nas dka' thub pa la phyag bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs kyis bskor nas dka' thub pa'i ral pa'i steng na 'dug go /
analyzed: bu rnams / rgyal po chen po'i sras su gyur pa de bdag gis blta'o zhes smras so; ;rgyal pos rgyan dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu blangs nas dka' thub pa la phyag bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs kyis bskor nas dka' thub pa'i ral pa'i steng na 'dug go /
translated: He said, Sons, I will see the one who became the son of the great king. The king took the prince adorned with ornaments and, circling around at the feet of the Bodhisattva for the sake of paying homage, he sat on the ascetic's matted hair.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang de rnams kyis lus kyis phyag byed par rig pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang de rnams kyis lus kyis phyag byed par rig pa gzhan med do //
translated: The Bodhisattva also knew that they were paying homage with their bodies.

original: gal te mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i dbu la dka' thub pa'i rkang pa bzhag na de'i mgo tshal pa bdun du 'gas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i dbu la dka' thub pa'i rkang pa bzhag na de'i mgo tshal pa bdun du 'gas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, out of ignorance, he were to place his foot on the head of a Bodhisattva, his head would split into seven pieces.

original: dka' thub pas bdag nyams pa'i phyir du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dka' thub pas bdag nyams pa'i phyir du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right for an ascetic to destroy himself.🔽He rose from his seat and,

original: stan las langs nas byang chub sems dpa' la thal mo sbyar @340a *//
analyzed: stan las langs nas byang chub sems dpa' la thal mo sbyar @340a *//
translated: with his hands joined in respect,

original: ro; ;rgyal pos ya mtshan che ba gzigs nas rang gi sras la phyag byas so //🔽dka' thub bas 'das pa'i bskal ba bzhi bcu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa bzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: ro; ;rgyal pos ya mtshan che ba gzigs nas rang gi sras la phyag byas so // dka' thub bas 'das pa'i bskal ba bzhi bcu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa bzhi bcu ste /
translated: The king, seeing this marvel, bowed to his son.🔽The ascetic remembered eighty eons, forty past and forty future,

original: bskal ba brgyad cu rjes su dran no //
analyzed: bskal ba brgyad cu rjes su dran no //
translated: and he remembered the Bodhisattva’s former lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas sangs rgyas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas sangs rgyas par 'gyur ram /
translated: He examined whether one who has the perfect characteristics of a Bodhisattva will become a Buddha or not.

original: mi 'gyur zhes brtags pas the tshom med pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar rtogs te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes brtags pas the tshom med pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar rtogs te /
translated: Since there was no doubt, he understood that he would become a Buddha.

original: 'di ya mtshan che ba'i skyes bu yin no zhes bsams nas bgad do //
analyzed: 'di ya mtshan che ba'i skyes bu yin no zhes bsams nas bgad do //
translated: Thinking, “This is a marvel! This is a great man!” he smiled.

original: de nas 'di nas sangs rgyas nas bdag gis mthong ngam; mi mthong zhes brtags pas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas 'di nas sangs rgyas nas bdag gis mthong ngam; mi mthong zhes brtags pas mi mthong ngo //
translated: Then he thought, “After my enlightenment, will I see him or not?” He saw that he would not.

original: bar du dus las 'das nas sangs rgyas brgya'am /
analyzed: bar du dus las 'das nas sangs rgyas brgya'am /
translated: “After some time, will I see him after a hundred buddhas have come and gone, or after a thousand buddhas have come and gone?”

original: sangs rgyas stong gshegs nas brtag par mi nus pa'i gzugs med ba'i gnas su skye bar nges par mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong gshegs nas brtag par mi nus pa'i gzugs med ba'i gnas su skye bar nges par mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that he would not be able to see him until he was reborn in the formless realm.

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis ya mtshan che ba'i skyes bu mthong bar mi nus so snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis ya mtshan che ba'i skyes bu mthong bar mi nus so snyam ste /
translated: “In this way, I will not be able to see this wondrous being.”

original: bdag gi sems shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur nas ngus so; ;de mi rnams kyis mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur nas ngus so; ;de mi rnams kyis mthong ste /
translated: Thinking this, he was very sad and wept.

original: bdag cag gi 'phags bar 'ga' ni dgod /
analyzed: bdag cag gi 'phags bar 'ga' ni dgod /
translated: Some people saw him and said,

original: re 'ga' ni du ba'i rgyu mtshan ci lags /
analyzed: re 'ga' ni du ba'i rgyu mtshan ci lags /
translated: “Why do you sometimes laugh and sometimes weep?”

original: bdag cag gi sras 'phags pa la bar du gcod pa 'ong ngam zhes dris so //
analyzed: bdag cag gi sras 'phags pa la bar du gcod pa 'ong ngam zhes dris so //
translated: “Is there an obstacle to our noble son’s enlightenment?”

original: 'di la bar du gcod pa mi 'byung zhing the tshom med par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la bar du gcod pa mi 'byung zhing the tshom med par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: “There is no obstacle for him. He will certainly become a buddha.”

original: 'o na gang gi phyir du zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi phyir du zhes dris so //
translated: “Then why do you weep?”

original: 'di lta bu'i @340b tshul gyi skyes bu sangs rgya bar 'gyur ba bdag gis mthong bar mi 'gyur bas bdag shin tu nges bar sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i @340b tshul gyi skyes bu sangs rgya bar 'gyur ba bdag gis mthong bar mi 'gyur bas bdag shin tu nges bar sdug bsngal lo //
translated: I will not see such a person become a Buddha. I am very sad.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ched du mya ngan gyis ngu'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ched du mya ngan gyis ngu'o zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, I am crying out of sorrow for myself.

original: de na ci'i phyir rang gi nye du rnams las 'ga' zhig gis 'di sangs rgyas su gyur nas mthong bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de na ci'i phyir rang gi nye du rnams las 'ga' zhig gis 'di sangs rgyas su gyur nas mthong bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Then, why would anyone among his relatives see him become a Buddha?

original: mi 'gyur / zhes brtags pas tsha bo n'a la ka'i gzhon nus mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi 'gyur / zhes brtags pas tsha bo n'a la ka'i gzhon nus mthong ngo //
translated: He thought, No one will see him.

original: de srid mo'i khang bar song ste /
analyzed: de srid mo'i khang bar song ste /
translated: He went to the house of his daughter,

original: n'a la ka gzhon nu de gang na yod /
analyzed: n'a la ka gzhon nu de gang na yod /
translated: and asked, Where is the young Nalaka?

original: 'phags pa / khang ba na yod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa / khang ba na yod do //
translated: Noble one, he is in the house.

original: de bos la shog /
analyzed: de bos la shog /
translated: Call him.

original: de rang gi gnas su 'ongs nas n'a la ka la smras so //
analyzed: de rang gi gnas su 'ongs nas n'a la ka la smras so //
translated: He came to his own place and Nalaka spoke to him.

original: tsha bo / rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gi rigs kyi bu 'khrungs so //
analyzed: tsha bo / rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gi rigs kyi bu 'khrungs so //
translated: Nephew, a son was born to King Shuddhodana.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi myu gu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi myu gu'o //
translated: This is the sprout of a Buddha.

original: lo sum cu rtsa lnga 'das nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lo sum cu rtsa lnga 'das nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhing /
translated: After thirty-five years, he will become a Buddha.

original: khyod kyis 'di mthong bar 'gyur bas da ltar nyid du rab tu byung ba gyis shig ces smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di mthong bar 'gyur bas da ltar nyid du rab tu byung ba gyis shig ces smras so //
translated: You will see it. Go forth right now!”

original: bye ba brgyad cu rtsa bdun gyi nor gyi rigs la skyes pa'i gzhon nus /
analyzed: bye ba brgyad cu rtsa bdun gyi nor gyi rigs la skyes pa'i gzhon nus /
translated: The young man, who had been born into a family of wealth of eighty-seven quintillion,

original: zhang po 'dis bdag la don med cing dgos pa med do zhes brjod par bsams so //
analyzed: zhang po 'dis bdag la don med cing dgos pa med do zhes brjod par bsams so //
translated: thought, “This uncle of mine is useless and pointless.”

original: de ma thag tu rang gi tshong gnas su dur smrig gi gos nyid dang / sa'i lhung bzed blangs nas skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu rang gi tshong gnas su dur smrig gi gos nyid dang / sa'i lhung bzed blangs nas skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
translated: Immediately, in his own place of business, he took on the saffron-colored robes and the alms bowl of the earth, shaved his hair and beard,

original: dur smrig gi gos gyon na gang zhig 'jig rten ba'i gang zag gi mchog gi mchog la bsams shing bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams te byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs su thal mo sbyar nas yan lag lnga'i phyag @341a *//
analyzed: dur smrig gi gos gyon na gang zhig 'jig rten ba'i gang zag gi mchog gi mchog la bsams shing bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams te byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs su thal mo sbyar nas yan lag lnga'i phyag @341a *//
translated: and put on the saffron-colored robes. He thought, “I will go forth, thinking of the supreme person in the world.” He joined his palms in the direction of the Bodhisattva and prostrated with his five limbs.

original: byed do; ;lhung bzed snod du bcug nas phrag pa la gzar te gangs can du gshegs nas dge sbyong gi chos byed do //
analyzed: byed do; ;lhung bzed snod du bcug nas phrag pa la gzar te gangs can du gshegs nas dge sbyong gi chos byed do //
translated: He put the alms bowl in his bag and slung it over his shoulder. He went to the Himalayas and practiced the Dharma of mendicancy.

original: des mchog tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du nye bar song ste /
analyzed: des mchog tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du nye bar song ste /
translated: He went into the presence of the Tathagata who had attained supreme, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: n'a la ka'i so so'i rtogs ba'i gtam thos nas slar yang gangs can du gshegs te dgra bcom pa thob /
translated: Having heard the individual story of Nalaka, he again went to the snowy mountains and attained arhatship.

original: mchog tu rtogs dka' ba rtogs nas zla ba bdun nyid kyi nang du tshe 'das te gser gyi ri gcig la brten nas 'dug ste lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //

translated: Having realized what is supremely difficult to realize, he passed away within seven months and, relying on a golden mountain, he passed into parinirvana in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang zhag lnga nas dbu 'khru bar byed cing ming 'dogs par rigs so zhes bsams nas rgyal po'i pho brang la dri bzhi'i rigs kyis byug par byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang zhag lnga nas dbu 'khru bar byed cing ming 'dogs par rigs so zhes bsams nas rgyal po'i pho brang la dri bzhi'i rigs kyis byug par byas te /
translated: The Bodhisattva thought, After five days, I will wash my head and give a name. Having thought this, he anointed the royal palace with the four types of incense.

analyzed: rin po che lnga'i me tog gcal du bkram nas chu med pa'i 'o ma btsos pa'i 'o thug 'tshod cing rig byed gsum gyi pha rol tu son pa'i bram ze brgya rtsa brgyad mgron du gnyer te rgyal po'i pho brang du bzhugs nas /
translated: He spread out flowers of the five precious substances, cooked rice milk that was boiled with milk without water, invited one hundred and eight brahmins who had mastered the three Vedas, and they stayed in the king's palace.

original: kha zas bzang po la longs spyod cing bkur sti chen po byas nas mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhes dris so //
analyzed: kha zas bzang po la longs spyod cing bkur sti chen po byas nas mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhes dris so //
translated: They enjoyed good food, were greatly honored, and asked, What are the characteristics?

original: de rnams las dga' byed dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi bsngags pa dang / koo ndi n+ya dang / lag pa can dang / gshin rje bzang dang / legs sbyin te /
analyzed: de rnams las dga' byed dang / rgyal mtshan dang / mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi bsngags pa dang / koo ndi n+ya dang / lag pa can dang / gshin rje bzang dang / legs sbyin te /
translated: Among them, Nandī, Dhvaja, Lakṣaṇa, Gotraśaṃsa, Kauṇḍinya, Hastaka, Yamabhadra, and Supriya,

original: de rnams de'i @341b tshe bram ze brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de rnams de'i @341b tshe bram ze brgyad yin no //
translated: these eight were the brahmins at that time.

original: yan lag drug gi sngags brda sprad nas bram ze brgyad po 'di lta bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid so sor brjod nas dga' ldan gnas nas ma'i mngal du zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi sngags brda sprad nas bram ze brgyad po 'di lta bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid so sor brjod nas dga' ldan gnas nas ma'i mngal du zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: The eight brahmans were given the secret mantra of the six limbs. The characteristics of the Bodhisattva’s entry into his mother’s womb from the Tuṣita Heaven were explained with these verses.

original: de rnams las bram ze bdun gyis mdzub mo gnyis bsgrengs te don gnyis lung bstan no //
analyzed: de rnams las bram ze bdun gyis mdzub mo gnyis bsgrengs te don gnyis lung bstan no //
translated: Among them, seven brahmans raised two fingers to indicate two meanings.

original: mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pas khyim na gnas na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pas khyim na gnas na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: “If he remains in the household, he will become a wheel-turning king.

original: rab tu byung na sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung na sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he goes forth, he will become a buddha.”

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bshad pa rdzogs nas; gzhan de rnams kyi nang nas thams cad kyi gzhon shos kyi rigs ni ko ndi n+ya bram ze'i khye'u 'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bshad pa rdzogs nas; gzhan de rnams kyi nang nas thams cad kyi gzhon shos kyi rigs ni ko ndi n+ya bram ze'i khye'u 'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: After explaining all the perfections of a wheel-turning king, the youngest of the remaining brahmans was named Koṇḍiṇya.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i ma'i mtshan mchog rnams rdzogs par btags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i ma'i mtshan mchog rnams rdzogs par btags so //
translated: The characteristics of the Bodhisattva’s mother were fully described.

original: 'di ni khyim na gnas pa'i rgyu med pas mtha' gcig nyid du khyim na mi gnas par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyim na gnas pa'i rgyu med pas mtha' gcig nyid du khyim na mi gnas par sangs rgya'o //
translated: Since he has no reason to remain in the household, he will definitely not remain in the household but will go forth.🔽“He will be one-pointedly focused, and so I prophesy that he will be one-pointedly focused.

original: mdzub mo gcig bsgrengs te 'di ltar lung bstan no; ;'di ni sngar gyi gzhi byas pas phyis mir gyur pa na shes rab dang ldan no //
analyzed: mdzub mo gcig bsgrengs te 'di ltar lung bstan no; ;'di ni sngar gyi gzhi byas pas phyis mir gyur pa na shes rab dang ldan no //
translated: Since he has previously been a scholar, he will be wise in his next life.

original: bram ze bdun las lhag par gyur nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rigs par ldan nas khyim du gnas pa'i ming yang med do //
analyzed: bram ze bdun las lhag par gyur nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rigs par ldan nas khyim du gnas pa'i ming yang med do //
translated: He will be superior to seven brahmins, and since he will be endowed with the characteristics of a brahmin, he will not even have the name of a householder.

original: the tshom med par sangs rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom med par sangs rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will definitely become a buddha.

original: 'gro ba gcig las gzhan ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig las gzhan ma mthong ngo //
translated: He will not see any other goer.

original: de'i phyir mdzub mo gcig bsgrengs te 'di ltar lung @342a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzub mo gcig bsgrengs te 'di ltar lung @342a *//
translated: Therefore, I prophesy that he will be one-pointedly focused.”

original: bstan no // de nas bram ze de rnams rang gi khyim du 'gro zhing bu rnams bos te /
analyzed: bstan no // de nas bram ze de rnams rang gi khyim du 'gro zhing bu rnams bos te /
translated: Then the brahmins went to their homes and called out to their sons,
