analyzed: bu / bdag cag rnams rgan por gyur pas rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gi sras thams cad mkhyen pa thob par gyur pa na bdag cag dang mjal bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Son, since we are old, will we meet the son of King Śuddhodana, who will attain omniscience,

original: mi 'gyur cha med kyi /🔽khyod de'i sras kyis thams cad mkhyen pa thob par gyur nas de'i bstan pa la rab tu byung zhig ces smras so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur cha med kyi / khyod de'i sras kyis thams cad mkhyen pa thob par gyur nas de'i bstan pa la rab tu byung zhig ces smras so //
translated: The seven brāhmaṇas said, We will do as you say.

original: bram ze bdun po rnams kyis kyang ji srid tshe gnas kyi bar ji ltar byas pa'i las rtogs so //
analyzed: bram ze bdun po rnams kyis kyang ji srid tshe gnas kyi bar ji ltar byas pa'i las rtogs so //
translated: The seven brāhmaṇas, having made a vow to do so, went to their own abodes.

original: bram ze'i khye'u ko ndi n+ya nyid nad med par gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u ko ndi n+ya nyid nad med par gyur nas gnas so //
translated: The young brāhmaṇa Kauṇḍinya, having recovered, remained there.

original: de'i sems dpa' chen po blo dang ldan pa nges par 'byung ba chen pos mngon par byung nas go rim bzhin du lteng rgyas su song ngo //
analyzed: de'i sems dpa' chen po blo dang ldan pa nges par 'byung ba chen pos mngon par byung nas go rim bzhin du lteng rgyas su song ngo //
translated: With his great mind, endowed with wisdom, he went forth with great renunciation and gradually went to Uruvilvā.🔽Thinking, This place is delightful, it is fitting for a son of noble family to practice austerities here, he took up residence there and went forth as a great being.

original: sa phyogs 'di ni nyams dga' bas rigs kyi bu sa phyogs 'di dka' ba spyod pa'i gnas su rigs par sems skyes pas der gnas te skyes bu chen po rab tu byung ngo zhes thos nas bram ze'i bu'i gnas su nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di ni nyams dga' bas rigs kyi bu sa phyogs 'di dka' ba spyod pa'i gnas su rigs par sems skyes pas der gnas te skyes bu chen po rab tu byung ngo zhes thos nas bram ze'i bu'i gnas su nye bar song ngo //
translated: Having heard that the great being has gone forth, he went to the abode of the young brāhmaṇa.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: He said, Young man, I have come to you.

original: gzhon nu don grub rab tu byung nas the tshom med par de sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu don grub rab tu byung nas the tshom med par de sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The young Siddhārtha has gone forth, and there is no doubt that he will become a buddha.

original: gal te khyed rnams kyi pha nad med par gnas na /
analyzed: gal te khyed rnams kyi pha nad med par gnas na /
translated: If your father is well,

original: de ring phyin nas rab tu byung ba byed do //
analyzed: de ring phyin nas rab tu byung ba byed do //
translated: then from today on he will go forth.

original: gal te khyod kyang 'dod na 'dir 'ongs nas bdag gis skyes bu de'i rjes su rab tu 'byung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyang 'dod na 'dir 'ongs nas bdag gis skyes bu de'i rjes su rab tu 'byung bar bgyi'o //
translated: If you also wish to do so, come here and I will go forth after that man.”

original: de thams cad 'dun pa gcig par ma nus @342b par skye bo bzhi po las ko ndi n+ya gtso bo byas nas skye bo lnga po rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: de thams cad 'dun pa gcig par ma nus @342b par skye bo bzhi po las ko ndi n+ya gtso bo byas nas skye bo lnga po rab tu byung ste /
translated: All of them were unable to agree, so the four people, with Kauṇḍinya as their leader, went forth as a group of five.

original: de rnams kyi skye bo lnga po ni gnas brtan lnga sde zhes bya ba'i rigs su gyur to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye bo lnga po ni gnas brtan lnga sde zhes bya ba'i rigs su gyur to //
translated: They became known as the group of five elders.

original: gzhan yang / de'i tshe rgyal po 'di skad du gang mthong nas bdag gi bu rab tu 'byung zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de'i tshe rgyal po 'di skad du gang mthong nas bdag gi bu rab tu 'byung zhes 'dri'o //
translated: At that time the king asked, “Who saw my son and made him go forth?”

original: sngon gyi mtshan ma bzhi mthong bas de gang dang rgas zhing 'khogs pa dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshan ma bzhi mthong bas de gang dang rgas zhing 'khogs pa dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The four previous signs were seen: old age, sickness, death, and renunciation.

original: rgyal pos 'di rnams bzung nas 'di lta bu'i tshul bdag gi bu dang nye bar 'ong du ma 'jug cig /
analyzed: rgyal pos 'di rnams bzung nas 'di lta bu'i tshul bdag gi bu dang nye bar 'ong du ma 'jug cig /
translated: The king, having understood these, said, Do not let such things come near my son!

original: bdag gi sras kyis sangs rgyas thob kyang don med do //
analyzed: bdag gi sras kyis sangs rgyas thob kyang don med do //
translated: Even if my son attains Buddhahood, it will be meaningless.

original: bdag gi sras stong phrag gnyis kyi gling 'khor dang bcas pa'i gling chen po bzhi po rnams kyi dbang phyug gi bdag po'i rgyal po byed cing dpag tshad sum cu rtsa drug gi 'khor yug gi 'khor nam mkha'i dbyings su gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod do //

translated: I want to see my son, the king of the lords of the four great continents with two thousand islands, traveling through the sky in a circle of thirty-six yojanas.

translated: Again, saying this, he guarded against such four types of people coming into the prince's sight, and placed guards in the four directions, four krosha each.

original: de'i nyi ma la'ang bkra shis pa'i gnas su 'dus pa'i rigs kyi nye du stong phrag brgyad cu po re re'i bu brgya yongs su ster bar bsams so //
analyzed: de'i nyi ma la'ang bkra shis pa'i gnas su 'dus pa'i rigs kyi nye du stong phrag brgyad cu po re re'i bu brgya yongs su ster bar bsams so //

original: 'di sangs rgyas su 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas su 'gyur ram /
translated: They said, Will he become a Buddha?

original: rgyal por 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyal por 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will he become a king?

original: bdag gi bu re re ster ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bu re re ster ro //

original: gal te sangs rgyas bar gyur na rgyal rigs kyi dge sbyong nyid kyis mdun rgyab thams cad du bskong nas 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bar gyur na rgyal rigs kyi dge sbyong nyid kyis mdun rgyab thams cad du bskong nas 'gro ba yin no //
translated: If he becomes a Buddha, he will go surrounded in front and back by the Śākya clan.

original: @343a *// gal te rgyal por gyur na rgyal rigs kyi gzhon nu nyid kyis mdun rgyab kun nas bskor nas 'gro'o zhes smra zhing 'bul lo //
analyzed: @343a *// gal te rgyal por gyur na rgyal rigs kyi gzhon nu nyid kyis mdun rgyab kun nas bskor nas 'gro'o zhes smra zhing 'bul lo //
translated: If he becomes a king, he will go surrounded in front and back by the Śākya princes.

analyzed: rgyal pos kyang byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs ma chog dang ldan pa skyon thams cad spangs pa'i nu ma snun pa nyid gnas pa byin no //
translated: The king also gave the Bodhisattva a nurse who was of the same age, had no faults, and was free from all defects.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor mtha' yas pa dpal dang / skal ba 'phel ba dang ldan no //
translated: The Bodhisattva was endowed with an infinite retinue and increasing glory.

original: de nas nyi ma gcig la rgyal po'i 'bras 'debs pa la bkra shis byed do //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gcig la rgyal po'i 'bras 'debs pa la bkra shis byed do //
translated: Then, on one day, the king's rice was sown, and a benediction was pronounced.

original: de'i nyi ma la grong khyer thams cad du lha gshegs pa bzhin du brgyan no //
analyzed: de'i nyi ma la grong khyer thams cad du lha gshegs pa bzhin du brgyan no //
translated: On that day, the whole city was adorned as if the gods had come.

original: bran dang / las byed pa la sogs pas gos legs po gyon nas /
analyzed: bran dang / las byed pa la sogs pas gos legs po gyon nas /

analyzed: spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pas brgyan par byas nas rgyal po'i pho brang gi nang du 'dus so //

analyzed: rgyal po'i gzhis rnams la zhing rmo ba stong phrag gcig rigs so //

translated: Again, on that day, the yoking of the oxen's neck yokes made of silver, together with the plowing of the fields, and the plowshares of the king's fields made of gold, were reduced by one.

original: glang gi rva gnyis la gser gyis bskus so //
analyzed: glang gi rva gnyis la gser gyis bskus so //
translated: The two horns of the oxen were smeared with gold.

original: kha dang ske'i thag pa ni gser la'ang byas so //
analyzed: kha dang ske'i thag pa ni gser la'ang byas so //
translated: The rope around the mouth and neck was also made of gold.

analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor chen po dang bcas pa byon nas sras blangs te gshegs so //
translated: The king, with his great retinue, came and took the prince and left.

analyzed: gzhis ka'i gnas na shing 'dzam bu gcig la lo ma mang pos grib ma stug por gyur pa zhig yod @343b pa'i 'og tu gzhon nu'i mal stan chen po byas nas steng du bla res gser gyi skar ma dang mtshungs pa bres te /
translated: In the place of the estate, under a single rose-apple tree with many leaves that formed a thick shade, a great bed for the prince was made, and above it a canopy was spread, like a golden star.

analyzed: lcags ri ltar yol bas phyogs kun nas bskor te /
translated: Like an iron mountain, it was surrounded on all sides by curtains.

original: rgyal po rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par byas nas blon po 'khor dang bcas pa zhing rmo ba'i gnas su gshegs te /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par byas nas blon po 'khor dang bcas pa zhing rmo ba'i gnas su gshegs te /

analyzed: der rgyal pos gser gyi thong ba bzung ngo //

analyzed: de rnams kyi thong pa bzung nas de dang / der sgal rmo'o //
translated: Holding those plows, he plowed here and there.

analyzed: rgyal pos slar yang 'di nas phar 'gro zhing pha rol nas tshur 'ongs /
translated: The king thought, “He goes away from here and comes back from there.

original: de'i gnas phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i gnas phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas /
translated: His dwelling will be perfect.”

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa bzhugs pa'i nu ma snun pa rnams rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs par blta'o //
translated: The nurses of the Bodhisattva and his retinue saw the king’s perfection.

original: yol ba'i nang nas phyir 'thon no //
analyzed: yol ba'i nang nas phyir 'thon no //

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dang / der gzigs pas gcig kyang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dang / der gzigs pas gcig kyang mi snang ngo //
translated: The Bodhisattva looked there, but he did not see anyone.

original: myur bar langs nas skyil krung bcas te /
analyzed: myur bar langs nas skyil krung bcas te /
translated: He quickly got up, crossed his legs,

analyzed: rlung 'byung ba dang / rdub cing bzung bas bsam gtan dang po skyes so //
translated: and through holding the breath, the first concentration arose.

analyzed: nu ma snun pa rnams kha zas za ba'i phyir phan tshun da 'gro zhing de ma thag cung zad thogs par gyur to //

analyzed: shing gzhan rnams kyi grib ma mi ldog cing gzhan yang shing de'i grib ma rnams kun nas gnas so //
translated: The shadows of the other trees moved, but the shadow of that tree remained in place.

original: nu ma snun pa rnams @344a *//
analyzed: nu ma snun pa rnams @344a *//
translated: The nurses

analyzed: kyis sras 'phags pa zhes gcig tu brjod cing myur du yol ba steng du brdzes te nang du zhugs nas /
translated: The king, having heard this, said: It is the same son, and quickly had the curtain raised and entered.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mal stan la skyil krung gis bzhugs pa de'i cho 'phrul mthong nas song ste rgyal po la zhus so //
translated: Seeing the Bodhisattva sitting cross-legged on his bed, he went out and told the king:

analyzed: lha / gzhon nu 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis bzhugs so //
translated: Your Majesty, the prince is sitting in this manner.

original: 'di ltar shing gzhan rnams grib ma mi bzlog go /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing gzhan rnams grib ma mi bzlog go /

analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma ni kun nas gnas so //

original: rgyal po myur du byon nas cho 'phrul blta ste /
analyzed: rgyal po myur du byon nas cho 'phrul blta ste /

original: sras 'di la phyag gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sras 'di la phyag gnyis pa ste /

original: zhes brjod nas sras la phyag btsal lo //
analyzed: zhes brjod nas sras la phyag btsal lo //

analyzed: de nas go rim bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' lo bcu drug pa'i na tshod du gyur to //
translated: Then, in due order, the Bodhisattva reached the age of sixteen.

analyzed: rgyal pos byang chub sems dpa' la dus gsum du rjes su rigs par khang bzang gsum byas nas gcig dgu thog /

analyzed: gcig la bdun thog /
translated: one with seven stories,

original: gcig lnga thog go /
analyzed: gcig lnga thog go /
translated: One, five, top!

analyzed: stong phrag bzhi bcu'i gar byed pa'i bud med rnams nye bar gnas par byas so //
translated: The women, who were dancing in the four hundred thousand, were placed nearby.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni lha bzhin du lha dang 'dra ba'i bud med rnams 'khor du byas nas rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bud med du ma dang bcas pa skyes pa med pa'i rol mo sgrogs pa 'khor du bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni lha bzhin du lha dang 'dra ba'i bud med rnams 'khor du byas nas rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bud med du ma dang bcas pa skyes pa med pa'i rol mo sgrogs pa 'khor du bya ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva, like a god, surrounded by women who were like goddesses, with many women adorned with ornaments, with the sound of music without men, was surrounded and

analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa chen po rjes su myong bar byed do //
translated: experienced great perfection.

analyzed: dus kyi res dang / dus kyi res pa de dang / de'i khang bzang du bzhugs so //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sgra gcan @344b 'dzin gyi ma de nyid btsun mo rnams kyi gtso mor gyur to //

analyzed: de'i de bzhin du phun sum tshogs pa chen po rjes su myong bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, he experienced great perfection.

analyzed: nyi ma gcig la nye du'i nang du 'di lta bu'i gtam byung ngo //
translated: On one day, such a conversation arose among the relatives:

analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bos nas /

analyzed: bu / khyod kyi nye du rnams don grub bzo cung zad kyang mi slob cing rtsed mos gshegs nas 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
translated: “Son, your relatives say that Siddhattha does not study any crafts and goes out to play.”

analyzed: 'dir g-yul byung na ji ltar byed ces bsams /
translated: “What will I do when the time comes for me to fight?”

analyzed: lha / ngas bzo bslabs pa la dgos pa med do //
translated: “Your Majesty, there is no need for me to study a craft.”

analyzed: grong khyer gyi mi rnams bdag gi bzo blta ba'i sems yod na dril sgrogs shig /

analyzed: 'di nas zhag bdun pa la nye du rnams la bzo bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: “After seven days from now I will show my craft to my relatives.”

translated: The king did as he was told. The Bodhisattva assembled the archers, the bowmen, and the crossbowmen, and in the midst of the people he demonstrated his skill in the twelve arts to his relatives and to the other archers.

analyzed: de rnams mnga' 'joms pa'i skyes rabs las 'byung ba'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is described in the Jataka of the Conqueror of Enemies.

original: de'i nye du rnams kyi the tshom sel lo; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: de'i nye du rnams kyi the tshom sel lo; ;gzhan yang /
translated: He dispelled the doubts of his relatives.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyed mos tshal du gshegs par bsams nas kha lo sgyur ba pos te /

analyzed: shing rta chas su chug cig ces smras so // des legs? @345a *//
translated: “Charioteer, prepare the chariot.”

original: so zhes brjod cing tshig thos nas /
analyzed: so zhes brjod cing tshig thos nas /

analyzed: shing rta chen po'i 'khor lo'i mchog la ji ltar rigs pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan nas /
translated: he adorned the best of the great chariot wheels with all the appropriate ornaments.

analyzed: ku mu ta'i 'dab ma'i mdog dang 'dra ba'i bkra shis pa'i rta bzhis shing rta khrid nas byang chub sems dpa' gshegs so zhes smras so //
translated: The four auspicious horses, the color of lotus petals, drew the chariot and announced, The Bodhisattva is coming!

original: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i gzhal med khang bzhin du shing rta la zhon nas skyed mos tshal gyi phyogs su gshegs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i gzhal med khang bzhin du shing rta la zhon nas skyed mos tshal gyi phyogs su gshegs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva, seated in the chariot like a celestial palace, went to the pleasure grove.

analyzed: lha rnams kyis gzhon nu don grub kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i dus ni nye bar gyur to //

analyzed: sngar gyi mtshan ma rnams blta bar rigs so // lha'i bu gcig gis rgas pa /

original: 'khogs pa / so byi ba /
analyzed: 'khogs pa / so byi ba /

analyzed: skra dkar ba /

analyzed: sgur ba / rgyab grum pa'i lus can lag tu 'khar ba thogs pa /
translated: and a hunched body, holding a cane in his hand

original: skad 'dzer bar byed pa bstan no //
analyzed: skad 'dzer bar byed pa bstan no //
translated: and speaking in a hoarse voice.

analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' kha lo sgyur bas mthong ngo //
translated: The Bodhisattva's charioteer saw him.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas kha lo sgyur ba la dris so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas kha lo sgyur ba la dris so //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva asked the charioteer,

translated: Who is this person?

original: skra yang gzhan dang mi 'dra ba ji lta bu /
analyzed: skra yang gzhan dang mi 'dra ba ji lta bu /

translated: Ask him as it is written in the Mahāpuruṣa Sūtra.

analyzed: de'i tshig thos nas skye ba mi rtag cing skyes par gyur pa thams cad rgas par 'gyur ro zhes sems sdug bsngal zhing de nyid du bzlog nas /

analyzed: rgyal pos rgyu mtshan ci'i phyir bdag gi sras po myur du ldog pa ci'i phyir dris so //

analyzed: lha rgas shing @345b 'khogs pa'i mi gcig mthong bas rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: “Your Majesty, he saw an old man and will go forth.”

original: myur du bu la gar byed pa rnams sta gon gyis shig /
analyzed: myur du bu la gar byed pa rnams sta gon gyis shig /
translated: “Quickly prepare the entertainments for the prince.”

original: phun sum tshogs pa nyams su myong bar byas pas rab tu 'byung ba rjes su dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras nas srung bar byed pa spel to /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa nyams su myong bar byas pas rab tu 'byung ba rjes su dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras nas srung bar byed pa spel to /
translated: “If he experiences perfect pleasures, he will not remember going forth.” Having said this, he increased the guards.

original: phyogs thams cad du rgyang grags brgyad brgyad du bzhag go /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du rgyang grags brgyad brgyad du bzhag go /
translated: He placed them in all directions, eight krośas apart.

original: gzhan yang / nyi ma gcig la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du skyed mos tshal du gshegs ba na lhas sprul pa'i nad pa zhig mthong nas sngar bzhin du dris so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / nyi ma gcig la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du skyed mos tshal du gshegs ba na lhas sprul pa'i nad pa zhig mthong nas sngar bzhin du dris so //
translated: Moreover, one day when the Bodhisattva went to the park, he saw a sick man emanated by the gods. He asked as before.

original: sems sdug bsngal bar gyur te slar yang bzlog nas rang gi khang bzang du gshegs so //
analyzed: sems sdug bsngal bar gyur te slar yang bzlog nas rang gi khang bzang du gshegs so //
translated: His mind was pained. He turned back again and went to his palace.

original: rgyal pos yang dris pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos yang dris pa /
translated: The king asked him again.

original: sngar de bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: sngar de bzhin du byas nas /
translated: He did as before.

original: sngar yang spel te thams cad du rgyang grags bcu gnyis kyi sa'i char srung bar byed pa bzhag go /
analyzed: sngar yang spel te thams cad du rgyang grags bcu gnyis kyi sa'i char srung bar byed pa bzhag go /
translated: He increased it and placed guards all around for twelve leagues.

original: yang nyi ma gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du skyed mos tshal du gshegs pa na lhas sprul ba'i dus la 'das pa zhig mthong nas sngar bzhin du dris te sems sdug bsngal bar gyur nas slar yang bzlog te khang bzang du gshegs nas rgyal pos
analyzed: yang nyi ma gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du skyed mos tshal du gshegs pa na lhas sprul ba'i dus la 'das pa zhig mthong nas sngar bzhin du dris te sems sdug bsngal bar gyur nas slar yang bzlog te khang bzang du gshegs nas rgyal pos
translated: Again, one day when the Bodhisattva went to the park, he saw a dead man emanated by the gods. He asked as before. His mind was pained. He turned back again and went to his palace. The king asked him

original: dris pa slar bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: dris pa slar bzhin du byas nas /
translated: He did as before.

original: slar yang srung ba spel te kun nas bskor bar dpag tshad gcig gi tshad la bsrung ba bzhag go /
analyzed: slar yang srung ba spel te kun nas bskor bar dpag tshad gcig gi tshad la bsrung ba bzhag go /
translated: Then, having increased the protection, he established a protection extending one yojana all around.

original: slar yang nyi ma gzhan la skyed mos tshal du gshegs pa na de bzhin du lhas sprul ba'i gos bzang po legs pa gyon pa'i rab tu byung ba gcig gzigs nas /
analyzed: slar yang nyi ma gzhan la skyed mos tshal du gshegs pa na de bzhin du lhas sprul ba'i gos bzang po legs pa gyon pa'i rab tu byung ba gcig gzigs nas /
translated: Then, on another day, when he went to the park, he saw a monk who was an emanation of the gods, wearing excellent, fine robes.

original: 'di'i ming ci zhes kha lo ba la dris so //
analyzed: 'di'i ming ci zhes kha lo ba la dris so //
translated: He asked the charioteer, “What is the name of this man?”

original: gang @346a *// du yang sangs rgyas byon par ma gyur cing rab tu byung ba'i yon tan mi shes /
analyzed: gang @346a *// du yang sangs rgyas byon par ma gyur cing rab tu byung ba'i yon tan mi shes /
translated: “I do not know the name of this man,” he replied, “nor do I know the qualities of the renunciant life.

original: lha'i mthus slar yang /
analyzed: lha'i mthus slar yang /
translated: But by the power of the gods,

original: lha / rab tu byung ba yin zhes brjod de /
analyzed: lha / rab tu byung ba yin zhes brjod de /
translated: he said, “Lord, this is a renunciant.”

original: rab tu byung ba'i yon tan la bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i yon tan la bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: And he praised the qualities of the renunciant life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu 'byung ba la 'dun pa skyes nas de'i nyin mo skyed mos tshal du gshegs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu 'byung ba la 'dun pa skyes nas de'i nyin mo skyed mos tshal du gshegs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having developed the aspiration to go forth, went to the park that very day.

original: slob dpon kha cig 'di skad zer te; sdun gyi mtshan ma bzhi pa nyi ma gcig nyid la mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig 'di skad zer te; sdun gyi mtshan ma bzhi pa nyi ma gcig nyid la mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some masters say that he saw the four sights on that very day, but others say that he saw them on different days.

original: de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: This is not correct.

original: de la nyin mo'i char rtse zhing bkra shis pa'i rdzing bur khrus byas nyi ma nub pa na bkra shis pa'i rdo leb kyi stan la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de la nyin mo'i char rtse zhing bkra shis pa'i rdzing bur khrus byas nyi ma nub pa na bkra shis pa'i rdo leb kyi stan la bzhugs so //
translated: During the day, he plays in the auspicious pond, and when the sun sets, he sits on the auspicious flat stone seat.

original: rang la rgyan gyis brgyan par sems so //
analyzed: rang la rgyan gyis brgyan par sems so //
translated: He thinks that he is adorned with ornaments.

original: de nas rjes su 'brang ba'i skyes bu rnams la kha dog sna tshogs pa'i gos dang / rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pas brgyan /
analyzed: de nas rjes su 'brang ba'i skyes bu rnams la kha dog sna tshogs pa'i gos dang / rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pas brgyan /
translated: Then, the attendant people, adorned with various colored clothes and various kinds of ornaments,

original: me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa la sogs pa blangs nas phyogs kun tu bskor nas 'dug go /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa la sogs pa blangs nas phyogs kun tu bskor nas 'dug go /
translated: take flower garlands, incense, ointments, and so forth, and sit, surrounding him in all directions.

original: de ma thag par brgya byin sdod pa'i gdan dro bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ma thag par brgya byin sdod pa'i gdan dro bar gyur to //
translated: Immediately, the seat of Śakra becomes warm.

original: gang zhig bdag gi gnas 'dor ba'i sems su zhig la skyes par gyur zhes brtags so //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag gi gnas 'dor ba'i sems su zhig la skyes par gyur zhes brtags so //
translated: He thinks, Who is going to be born in my place?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan byed pa'i dus mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan byed pa'i dus mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the time of the Bodhisattva's adornment.

original: las thams cad pa bos so; ;las thams cad pa /
analyzed: las thams cad pa bos so; ;las thams cad pa /
translated: He calls out to the all-accomplishing one, All-accomplishing one!

original: gzhon nu don grub de rang gi mtshan phyed kyi dus su nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon no //
analyzed: gzhon nu don grub de rang gi mtshan phyed kyi dus su nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon no //
translated: The young Siddhārtha will leave at midnight with great renunciation.

original: 'di de'i phyi ma'i rgyan yin no //
analyzed: 'di de'i phyi ma'i rgyan yin no //
translated: This is his last ornament.

original: skyed mos tshal du song la skyes @346b bu chen po lha'i rgyan gyis brgyan par gyis shig /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal du song la skyes @346b bu chen po lha'i rgyan gyis brgyan par gyis shig /
translated: Go to the garden and adorn the great being with divine ornaments.”

original: des de thos nas legs so zhes brjod de /
analyzed: des de thos nas legs so zhes brjod de /
translated: Having heard that, he said, “Excellent!”

original: lha'i mthus de ma thag par nye bar song ste /
analyzed: lha'i mthus de ma thag par nye bar song ste /
translated: By the power of the gods, he immediately went there

original: de'i rim gro ba dang mtshungs bar gyur nas rim gro pa'i lag tu ras blangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i dbu la bcings so //
analyzed: de'i rim gro ba dang mtshungs bar gyur nas rim gro pa'i lag tu ras blangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i dbu la bcings so //
translated: and became the attendant’s equal. He took the cloth from the attendant’s hand and tied it around the Bodhisattva’s head.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mgo la lag pas reg pa na 'di mi ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mgo la lag pas reg pa na 'di mi ma yin te /
translated: When the Bodhisattva touched his head with his hand, he knew that this was not a human being

original: lha'i bu yin par shes so //🔽bcings pa tsam na bcings pa'i dbu'i cod pan nor bu rin po che'i rnam pa la /
analyzed: lha'i bu yin par shes so // bcings pa tsam na bcings pa'i dbu'i cod pan nor bu rin po che'i rnam pa la /
translated: but a god.🔽As soon as it was tied, on the crown of his head, which was tied with the cloth,

original: stong phrag gcig gi du ku la'i ras kyis bcings so //
analyzed: stong phrag gcig gi du ku la'i ras kyis bcings so //
translated: there appeared a jewel ornament made of a thousand pieces of dukūla cloth.

original: slar yang 'ching ba na du ku la'i ras stong phrag gcig gis lan bcu dkris nas stong phrag bcus du ku la'i ras bcings so //
analyzed: slar yang 'ching ba na du ku la'i ras stong phrag gcig gis lan bcu dkris nas stong phrag bcus du ku la'i ras bcings so //
translated: When he was bound again, he was wrapped in a thousand pieces of dukūla cloth, ten times over, and bound with ten thousand pieces of dukūla cloth.

original: dbu ni chung zhing du ku la'i ras ni mang bas ji ltar bcings zhes mi bsam mo //
analyzed: dbu ni chung zhing du ku la'i ras ni mang bas ji ltar bcings zhes mi bsam mo //
translated: Do not think that it was difficult to bind him, since his head was small and the dukūla cloth was abundant.

original: de rnams thams cad la 'khri zhing s'a la'i me tog gi tshad tsam che ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad la 'khri zhing s'a la'i me tog gi tshad tsam che ba'o //

original: yang na ku ba'i me tog gi tshad tsam du gyur to //
analyzed: yang na ku ba'i me tog gi tshad tsam du gyur to //
translated: Or they became the size of cucumber flowers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dbu ki dza la ka'i me tog ltar mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dbu ki dza la ka'i me tog ltar mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's head was like a kiṃśuka flower.

original: yang na ku spya ka'i me tog ltar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ku spya ka'i me tog ltar gyur pa'o //
translated: Or it became like a kusuma flower.

original: de nas thams cad kyis so sor brgyan nas rol mo thams cad rang rang gi sgra 'byin zhing bram ze rnams rgyal bar gyur cing //
analyzed: de nas thams cad kyis so sor brgyan nas rol mo thams cad rang rang gi sgra 'byin zhing bram ze rnams rgyal bar gyur cing //
translated: Then, after adorning each one, all the musical instruments sounded their own tones, and the brahmins became victorious and joyful.

original: dga' bar gyur cig ces rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bkra shis kyis bstod pa'i dbyangs byed do //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur cig ces rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bkra shis kyis bstod pa'i dbyangs byed do //
translated: With various auspicious praises, they made sounds of praise.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan nas mchog gi shing rta la chibs so //🔽de'i tshe grags @347a *//
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan nas mchog gi shing rta la chibs so // de'i tshe grags @347a *//
translated: He was adorned with all the ornaments and mounted on the finest chariot.

original: 'dzin ma la bu btsas so //
analyzed: 'dzin ma la bu btsas so //
translated: At that time Yaśodharā gave birth to a son.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis thos nas bdag gi bu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pho nya ba btang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis thos nas bdag gi bu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir pho nya ba btang ngo //
translated: When King Śuddhodana heard this, he sent a messenger to please his son.

original: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas sgrag? can 'dzin skyes pas 'ching ba skyes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas sgrag? can 'dzin skyes pas 'ching ba skyes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the Bodhisattva heard this, he said, “Rāhula has been born. The fetter of birth has arisen.”

original: rgyal po bdag gi bu la ci'i phyir 'dri /
analyzed: rgyal po bdag gi bu la ci'i phyir 'dri /
translated: The king said, “Why did you say this to me?”

original: de'i tshig thos te 'di nas bzung ste bdag gi tsha bo gzhon nu sgra gcan 'dzin nyid ming du gyur to zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshig thos te 'di nas bzung ste bdag gi tsha bo gzhon nu sgra gcan 'dzin nyid ming du gyur to zhes smras so //
translated: Hearing his words, from that time on my nephew Rāhula became known by that name.”

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang grags pa chen pos shin tu dga' ba dang / dpal dang / skal ba bzang po dang ldan pa'i grong khyer du gshegs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang grags pa chen pos shin tu dga' ba dang / dpal dang / skal ba bzang po dang ldan pa'i grong khyer du gshegs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva also said, “I will go to the city that is endowed with great fame, great joy, great glory, and great fortune.”

original: de'i tshe goo ta mi skem mo zhes bya ba rgyal rigs kyi bu mo khang bzang gi steng du 'dug pas grong khyer la skor ba byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dpal dang ldan pa'i gzugs mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe goo ta mi skem mo zhes bya ba rgyal rigs kyi bu mo khang bzang gi steng du 'dug pas grong khyer la skor ba byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dpal dang ldan pa'i gzugs mthong nas /
translated: At that time, a kṣatriya girl named Kṛmigautāmī was sitting on the top of a palace. Seeing the Bodhisattva's glorious form circumambulating the city,
