analyzed: dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes te ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do // de yi ma ni zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: she gave rise to joy and mental satisfaction and uttered this inspired utterance:🔽Her mother will be at peace,

original: de yi pha ni nges bar zhi //
analyzed: de yi pha ni nges bar zhi //
translated: her father will certainly be at peace,

original: de yi bud med nges zhir gyur //
analyzed: de yi bud med nges zhir gyur //
translated: her wife will certainly be at peace,

original: de yi yang ni de bdag mtshungs //
analyzed: de yi yang ni de bdag mtshungs //
translated: and her own self will be the same as that.

original: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas bsams pa /
translated: Hearing this, the Bodhisattva thought,

original: 'di 'di lta bur smra ba /
analyzed: 'di 'di lta bur smra ba /
translated: She speaks like this

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyi bdag nyid kyi lus mthong bas ma'i sems zhi bar gyur /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyi bdag nyid kyi lus mthong bas ma'i sems zhi bar gyur /
translated: because she sees my body in such a way that her mother's mind becomes peaceful,

original: pha'i sems zhi bar gyur /
analyzed: pha'i sems zhi bar gyur /
translated: her father's mind becomes peaceful,

original: skye dgu dang skye dgu'i bdag mo'i sems zhi bar gyur zhes smre'o //
analyzed: skye dgu dang skye dgu'i bdag mo'i sems zhi bar gyur zhes smre'o //
translated: and the minds of the people and their leader become peaceful.

original: ci'i phyir sems zhi ba zhes bya ba'i don gang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems zhi ba zhes bya ba'i don gang /
translated: What is the meaning of peaceful mind?

original: de nas nyon mongs pa'i chags pa med pa'i @347b sems la de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de nas nyon mongs pa'i chags pa med pa'i @347b sems la de skad brjod do //
translated: Then he said to the mind that is free from the passion of the afflictions, “You are called ‘peace.’

original: 'dod chags kyi me zhi bar gyur pa ni zhi ba'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi me zhi bar gyur pa ni zhi ba'i ming du gyur to //
translated: The fire of desire has been extinguished, and so you are called ‘peace.’

original: skyon gyi me dang / gti mug gi me zhi bar gyur pa ni zhi ba'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: skyon gyi me dang / gti mug gi me zhi bar gyur pa ni zhi ba'i ming du gyur to //
translated: The fire of faults and the fire of delusion have been extinguished, and so you are called ‘peace.’

original: nga rgyal dang / lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs ba kun skyes pa thams cad zhi ba ni zhi ba'i ming du brjod do //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs ba kun skyes pa thams cad zhi ba ni zhi ba'i ming du brjod do //
translated: The arising of all the afflictions such as pride, views, and so on, has been pacified, and so you are called ‘peace.’

original: 'di bdag la tshig snyan ba brjod cing /
analyzed: 'di bdag la tshig snyan ba brjod cing /
translated: This one speaks pleasant words to me.

original: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa tshol du 'gro zhing tshol lo //
analyzed: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa tshol du 'gro zhing tshol lo //
translated: I go and seek nirvāṇa.

original: de ring nyid nas bdag khyim na gnas pa spangs nas nges par 'byung bas rab tu byung nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar rigs so //
analyzed: de ring nyid nas bdag khyim na gnas pa spangs nas nges par 'byung bas rab tu byung nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar rigs so //
translated: From this very day, I will abandon living in a home and go forth. It is right for me to seek nirvāṇa by going forth.

original: 'di ni bdag gi slob dpon bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi slob dpon bar gyur to //
translated: This one has become my teacher.

original: goo ta mi skem mo la 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i mu tig gi dra ba mgrin pa nas bkrol te bskur ro //
analyzed: goo ta mi skem mo la 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i mu tig gi dra ba mgrin pa nas bkrol te bskur ro //
translated: To the emaciated Gautami, he took off the pearl necklace worth a hundred thousand and gave it to her.”

original: des don grub gzhon nu bdag la chags shing zhen bar gyur pas sems rten bskur ba yin pas /
analyzed: des don grub gzhon nu bdag la chags shing zhen bar gyur pas sems rten bskur ba yin pas /
translated: He was attached to and clung to the young Siddhārtha, and so he lost his support.

original: des sems bde bskyes par gyur to //
analyzed: des sems bde bskyes par gyur to //
translated: And so he was born in the mind of the Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dpal dang ldan ba skal pa bzang po dang ldan pa'i rang gi khang bzang du gshegs nas dpal gyi mal stan la gzims so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dpal dang ldan ba skal pa bzang po dang ldan pa'i rang gi khang bzang du gshegs nas dpal gyi mal stan la gzims so //
translated: The Bodhisattva, who was glorious and fortunate, went to his own palace and lay down on his glorious bed.

original: de ma thag tu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i glu dang / gar rnams legs par bslabs pa'i lha'i bu mo dang 'dra ba'i gzugs mchog dang ldan pa'i bud med rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo bzung nas de la yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: de ma thag tu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i glu dang / gar rnams legs par bslabs pa'i lha'i bu mo dang 'dra ba'i gzugs mchog dang ldan pa'i bud med rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo bzung nas de la yongs su bskor nas /
translated: Immediately, women who were like celestial maidens, who were well trained in singing and dancing, and who had the most beautiful bodies, surrounded him with various musical instruments.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
translated: They delighted him.

original: gar dang / glu dang / rol mo la sogs pa byed par rtsom mo //
analyzed: gar dang / glu dang / rol mo la sogs pa byed par rtsom mo //
translated: They began to sing, dance, play music, and so forth.

original: byang chub @348a *//
analyzed: byang chub @348a *//
translated: The Bodhisattva

original: sems dpa' nyon mongs pa la mi dga' ba'i sems kyis gar la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba med pas yud tsam gyis mnal du bzhud do //
analyzed: sems dpa' nyon mongs pa la mi dga' ba'i sems kyis gar la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba med pas yud tsam gyis mnal du bzhud do //
translated: The Bodhisattva, with a mind displeased with the defilements, was not at all delighted with the dancing, etc. and so fell asleep in an instant.

original: bud med de rnams kyang gang gi don du nged rnams kyis gar la sogs byed pa la de mnal du gshegs so //
analyzed: bud med de rnams kyang gang gi don du nged rnams kyis gar la sogs byed pa la de mnal du gshegs so //
translated: Those women, for whose sake we were dancing, etc., he has gone to sleep.

original: da ni ci'i phyir bdag cag ngal bar byed /
analyzed: da ni ci'i phyir bdag cag ngal bar byed /
translated: Now, why should we tire ourselves?

original: gang dang / gang bslabs pa'i rol mo rnams la bzhag nas nyal lo //
analyzed: gang dang / gang bslabs pa'i rol mo rnams la bzhag nas nyal lo //
translated: Having placed the musical instruments, etc. that were being played, they too fell asleep.

original: dri bzang dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu sad nas mal gyi steng du skyil krung gis bzhugs nas gzigs pas bud med rnams rol mo bzhag nas gnyid du song ba gzigs so //
analyzed: dri bzang dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rab tu sad nas mal gyi steng du skyil krung gis bzhugs nas gzigs pas bud med rnams rol mo bzhag nas gnyid du song ba gzigs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having awakened, and having seen the women, who had fallen asleep, having placed the musical instruments, etc. that were being played, on the bed, sat cross-legged on the bed, and looked around.

original: kha cig mchil ma lug pa dang / kha cig ni lus la mchil mas gos pa'i dri ma can du gyur pa dang / kha cig ni so 'cha' ba dang / kha cig ni ngar ngar 'byin pa dang / kha cig ni rnya ma rmi 'chad pa dang /
analyzed: kha cig mchil ma lug pa dang / kha cig ni lus la mchil mas gos pa'i dri ma can du gyur pa dang / kha cig ni so 'cha' ba dang / kha cig ni ngar ngar 'byin pa dang / kha cig ni rnya ma rmi 'chad pa dang /
translated: Some were drooling, some were covered with the filth of drool, some were gnashing their teeth, some were snoring, some were grinding their teeth in their sleep,

original: kha cig ni kha gdangs pa dang / kha cig ni gos zhus pa dang / 'ga' zhig gi ni mtshan ma snang ngo //
analyzed: kha cig ni kha gdangs pa dang / kha cig ni gos zhus pa dang / 'ga' zhig gi ni mtshan ma snang ngo //
translated: some were gaping, some were naked, some were exposed.

original: byang chub sems dpas de rnams kyis rnam 'gyur gzigs nas thugs 'jigs pas 'dod pa la mi dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de rnams kyis rnam 'gyur gzigs nas thugs 'jigs pas 'dod pa la mi dga' bar gyur to //
translated: The Bodhisattva, seeing their behavior, was frightened and became disgusted with desire.

original: de'i rgyan du byas pa ni nye bar ldan pa brgya byin gyi pho brang dang mtshungs pa'i khang bzang chen po yangs shing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dri nga bas gang ba'i ro dang ldan pa'i dur khrod dang mtshungs par bsams so //
analyzed: de'i rgyan du byas pa ni nye bar ldan pa brgya byin gyi pho brang dang mtshungs pa'i khang bzang chen po yangs shing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dri nga bas gang ba'i ro dang ldan pa'i dur khrod dang mtshungs par bsams so //
translated: He thought of the palace, which was like Indra's palace, as a great charnel ground filled with various foul smells and corpses.

original: srid pa gsum po me 'bar ba'i @348b khyim dang mtshungs par bsams so //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po me 'bar ba'i @348b khyim dang mtshungs par bsams so //
translated: He thought of the three realms as like a house ablaze with fire.

original: bdag la gnod par byed pa dang / 'tshe bar byed pa'o zhes ched du brjod pa 'chad cing shin tu rab tu byung bar 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag la gnod par byed pa dang / 'tshe bar byed pa'o zhes ched du brjod pa 'chad cing shin tu rab tu byung bar 'dod par gyur to //
translated: I will be a refuge for those without refuge, a support for those without support, and I will be a guide for those who have gone astray.🔽

original: de bdag gi di ring nyid nas nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par bsams te mal nas bzhengs nas sgo dang nye bar gshegs te 'di na su yod ces dris so //
analyzed: de bdag gi di ring nyid nas nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par bsams te mal nas bzhengs nas sgo dang nye bar gshegs te 'di na su yod ces dris so //
translated: He thought, I will go forth today, and he got up from his bed and went to the door. He asked, Who is there?

original: blon po 'dun pa them pa la sngas byas nas nyal lo /
analyzed: blon po 'dun pa them pa la sngas byas nas nyal lo /
translated: The minister Chanda was lying down on the threshold.

original: ;'phags pa / bu bdag blon po 'dun pa yin no zhes smras so //🔽da ni nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par 'dod do //
analyzed: ;'phags pa / bu bdag blon po 'dun pa yin no zhes smras so // da ni nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par 'dod do //
translated: The prince said, Chanda, is that you?🔽 Chanda said, Yes, it is I, and the prince said, Chanda, I wish to go forth today.

original: bdag gi rta gcig la sga gyis shig /
analyzed: bdag gi rta gcig la sga gyis shig /
translated: Chanda said, I will prepare the chariot.

original: des lha legs so zhes brjod nas rta'i sga khyer te rta rar song nas dri bzang po dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me spar ba su ma na'i me tog can gyi dar gyi bla res kyi 'og na shin tu dga' ba'i sa phyogs la sdod pa'i
analyzed: des lha legs so zhes brjod nas rta'i sga khyer te rta rar song nas dri bzang po dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me spar ba su ma na'i me tog can gyi dar gyi bla res kyi 'og na shin tu dga' ba'i sa phyogs la sdod pa'i
translated: Chanda said, Very well, and he took the chariot equipment, went to the stable, lit a lamp with fragrant oil, and spread out a cloth with jasmine flowers.

original: rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan mthong ngo //
analyzed: rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan mthong ngo //
translated: and saw the king of horses, Kaṇṭhaka.

original: da ni bdag gis 'di nyid kyi sga bya bar rig nas bsngags ldan la sga sgron no //
analyzed: da ni bdag gis 'di nyid kyi sga bya bar rig nas bsngags ldan la sga sgron no //
translated: “Now I know that he is going to saddle him,” and he saddled Kaṇṭhaka.🔽Kaṇṭhaka, understanding that he was being saddled, neighed.

original: des sga sgron bar shes nas 'di sga sgron pa na glo bsdams so; ;nyi ma gzhan la skyed mos tshal du rtsed mo la 'gro ba'i dus su sgra 'di ltar ma byas so //
analyzed: des sga sgron bar shes nas 'di sga sgron pa na glo bsdams so; ;nyi ma gzhan la skyed mos tshal du rtsed mo la 'gro ba'i dus su sgra 'di ltar ma byas so //
translated: On another day, when it was time to go to the park, he did not make a sound.

original: bdag gi sras 'phags pa /
analyzed: bdag gi sras 'phags pa /
translated: “My son is noble,🔽and now he has become one who wishes to leave through the great departure.”🔽With a happy mind, he neighed loudly. The sound filled the entire city.

original: da ni nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par 'dod par gyur to snyam nas sems dga' bas rta skad tsher tsher 'don pa de'i sgra grong khyer thams cad du grags par byed pa slar yang lha rnams kyis de'i sgra bkag nas sus kyang mi thos par byas
analyzed: da ni nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon par 'dod par gyur to snyam nas sems dga' bas rta skad tsher tsher 'don pa de'i sgra grong khyer thams cad du grags par byed pa slar yang lha rnams kyis de'i sgra bkag nas sus kyang mi thos par byas
translated: The gods blocked the sound so that no one could hear it.

original: @349a *// so; ;byang chub sems dpas kyang blon po 'dun pa rta'i gnas su btang nas re zhig bu la blta bar bsams so //
analyzed: @349a *// so; ;byang chub sems dpas kyang blon po 'dun pa rta'i gnas su btang nas re zhig bu la blta bar bsams so //
translated: The Bodhisattva sent the minister Chanda to the stable and thought for a while about his son.

original: grags 'dzin ma'i gnas su gshegs te sgo phye nas de ma thag par nyal sa'i nang du dri bzang po dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me spar /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i gnas su gshegs te sgo phye nas de ma thag par nyal sa'i nang du dri bzang po dang ldan pa'i 'bru mar gyi mar me spar /
translated: He went to Yaśodharā’s quarters, opened the door, and immediately lit a fragrant oil lamp in the bed.

original: grags 'dzin ma su ma na'i me tog dang / ma la li ka'i me tog la sogs pa'i me tog mal gyi steng du khal gcig tsam bkram pa'i steng du lag pa bzhag nas gnyid du song ba la byang chub sems dpas sgo'i them pa'i steng du zhabs ya cig bzhag ste 'khod pas gzigs so; ;gal te
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma su ma na'i me tog dang / ma la li ka'i me tog la sogs pa'i me tog mal gyi steng du khal gcig tsam bkram pa'i steng du lag pa bzhag nas gnyid du song ba la byang chub sems dpas sgo'i them pa'i steng du zhabs ya cig bzhag ste 'khod pas gzigs so; ;gal te
translated: Yaśodharā was sleeping, her hand resting on a pile of flowers, such as jasmine and mallika, that was the height of a man. The Bodhisattva saw her from the threshold, placing one foot inside the door.

original: bdag gi lha mo'i lag pa nas 'then nas rang gi bu blang bar bsams te /
analyzed: bdag gi lha mo'i lag pa nas 'then nas rang gi bu blang bar bsams te /
translated: He thought, “If I pull my wife’s hand away to take my son,

original: lha mo gnyid sad na bdag nyid 'gro ba'i bar gcod du 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas su gyur nas bu blta'o sems te khang bzang nas babs so //
analyzed: lha mo gnyid sad na bdag nyid 'gro ba'i bar gcod du 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas su gyur nas bu blta'o sems te khang bzang nas babs so //
translated: she will wake up and create an obstacle to my departure. But when I have become a buddha, I will see my son.” With that thought, he left the palace.

original: slar yang slob dpon kha cig 'di ltar smra ste /
analyzed: slar yang slob dpon kha cig 'di ltar smra ste /
translated: Some masters say this:

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gshegs pa'i sngon rol gyi nyi ma bdun gyi gong du skyes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gshegs pa'i sngon rol gyi nyi ma bdun gyi gong du skyes so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bodhisattva was born seven days before the sun of his departure.

original: de 'dra gzhan du ma bshad pas de'i phyir 'di kho na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dra gzhan du ma bshad pas de'i phyir 'di kho na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Since this is not mentioned in other sources, we should accept this account.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' khang bzang nas babs nas rta'i ra ba nyid du gshegs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' khang bzang nas babs nas rta'i ra ba nyid du gshegs te /
translated: Thus, the Bodhisattva descended from the palace and went to the stable of the horses.

original: 'di ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs so //
translated: He said:

original: bu bsngags ldan khyod kyis da ni nub gcig bsgral bar gyis zhig /
analyzed: bu bsngags ldan khyod kyis da ni nub gcig bsgral bar gyis zhig /
translated: “Kanthaka, my son, you must carry me one more night.

original: bdag khyod kyi drin gyis sangs rgyas su gyur nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad @349b bsgral bar bya'o //🔽de nas bsngags ldan gyi rgyab tu chibs so //
analyzed: bdag khyod kyi drin gyis sangs rgyas su gyur nas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad @349b bsgral bar bya'o // de nas bsngags ldan gyi rgyab tu chibs so //
translated: Through your kindness I will become a buddha and liberate the whole world, including the gods.”🔽Then he mounted Kanthaka.

original: bsngags ldan gyi ske nas bzung nas mchu ru khru bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bsngags ldan gyi ske nas bzung nas mchu ru khru bco brgyad pa /
translated: He took hold of Kanthaka’s mane, which was eighteen cubits long.

original: de dang mthun pa'i mtho tshad dang ldan zhing mthu dang / mgyogs pa dang ldan la dung phyis pa'i kha dog ltar thams cad dkar ba dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i mtho tshad dang ldan zhing mthu dang / mgyogs pa dang ldan la dung phyis pa'i kha dog ltar thams cad dkar ba dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It was of the same height, strength, and speed, and was all white like a conch shell.

original: gal te tsher tsher sgrogs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te tsher tsher sgrogs pa'am /
translated: If it neighed or whinnied,

original: rmig pa'i sgra sgrogs pa'i sgras grong khyer thams cad grags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmig pa'i sgra sgrogs pa'i sgras grong khyer thams cad grags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the sound would have filled the entire city.

original: de'i phyir lha rang gi mthus de sus kyang mi thos par de 'di ltar sgra sgrogs pa bkag go /
analyzed: de'i phyir lha rang gi mthus de sus kyang mi thos par de 'di ltar sgra sgrogs pa bkag go /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the gods, no one could hear it, and so it was kept silent.

original: khra khrab 'gro ba'i rkang lag gi rmig pa re re lha'i lag pa'i mthil du nye bar bzhag go /
analyzed: khra khrab 'gro ba'i rkang lag gi rmig pa re re lha'i lag pa'i mthil du nye bar bzhag go /
translated: Each hoof of the horse’s feet was placed on the palm of a god.

original: byang chub sems dpas rta'i rgyab kyi dngus su bzhugs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rta'i rgyab kyi dngus su bzhugs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva sat on the horse’s back.

original: blon po 'dun ba rta'i mjug ma nas zungs shig ces mtshan phyed kyi dus su sgo chen po dang nye bar phyin to //
analyzed: blon po 'dun ba rta'i mjug ma nas zungs shig ces mtshan phyed kyi dus su sgo chen po dang nye bar phyin to //
translated: At midnight, they reached the great gate, and the minister Channa said, “Hold on to the horse’s tail.”

original: de'i tshe slar yang 'di ltar rgyal po chen pos 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang gi dus su yang grong khyer chen po'i sgo phye nas phyi rol tu 'gro bar mi nus par phyed sgo ma'i sgo glegs re re la mi stong phrag re res dbye dgos🔽par bskos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe slar yang 'di ltar rgyal po chen pos 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang gi dus su yang grong khyer chen po'i sgo phye nas phyi rol tu 'gro bar mi nus par phyed sgo ma'i sgo glegs re re la mi stong phrag re res dbye dgos par bskos so //
translated: At that time, the great king again appointed a thousand men to open each half-door of the city gate, so that the Bodhisattva could not open the city gate and go outside.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang ldan pas glang po che'i grangs bye ba stong phrag bcu'i glang po che'i stobs 'dzin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang ldan pas glang po che'i grangs bye ba stong phrag bcu'i glang po che'i stobs 'dzin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva, with his great strength, held the strength of ten thousand elephants.

original: mi'i grangs kyis mi bye ba 'bum phrag gcig gi mi'i stobs 'dzin no //
analyzed: mi'i grangs kyis mi bye ba 'bum phrag gcig gi mi'i stobs 'dzin no //
translated: With the number of men, he held the strength of one hundred thousand men.

original: byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva thought,

original: gal te sgom phyed na /
analyzed: gal te sgom phyed na /
translated: If I open the door,

original: da ni bsngags ldan gyi rgyab tu bzhugs pa nyid ni blon po 'dun pas rngam @350a *//
analyzed: da ni bsngags ldan gyi rgyab tu bzhugs pa nyid ni blon po 'dun pas rngam @350a *//
translated: now the minister Chanda will be angry at being on the back of Kanthaka,

original: nas bzung ba dang lhan cig nyid du bsngags ldan brlab cir nas khru bco brgyad pa'i lcags ri'i mtho tshad la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
analyzed: nas bzung ba dang lhan cig nyid du bsngags ldan brlab cir nas khru bco brgyad pa'i lcags ri'i mtho tshad la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
translated: He thought that he would jump over the eighteen cubit high iron fence with Kanthaka and Channa.

original: blon po 'dun pas bsams pa /
analyzed: blon po 'dun pas bsams pa /
translated: The minister Channa thought,

original: gal te sgo ma phyed na bdag gi 'phags pa sras dpung pa la khyer nas lag pa g-yas pas bsngags ldan gyi gsus pa mchan khung du bcug nas lcags ri la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
analyzed: gal te sgo ma phyed na bdag gi 'phags pa sras dpung pa la khyer nas lag pa g-yas pas bsngags ldan gyi gsus pa mchan khung du bcug nas lcags ri la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
translated: “If the gate is not opened, I will carry my master on my shoulder, put Kanthaka’s belly under my arm, and jump over the iron fence.”

original: bsngags ldan gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: bsngags ldan gyis bsams pa /
translated: Kanthaka thought,

original: gal te sgo ma phyed na bdag gis rang gi bdag po ji ltar rgyab tu bzhugs pa de bzhin nyid du blon po 'dun pas rnga ma nas bzung nas lhan cig tu gnas pa nyid du khur nas lcags ri la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
analyzed: gal te sgo ma phyed na bdag gis rang gi bdag po ji ltar rgyab tu bzhugs pa de bzhin nyid du blon po 'dun pas rnga ma nas bzung nas lhan cig tu gnas pa nyid du khur nas lcags ri la mchongs te 'da' bar bsams so //
translated: “If the gate is not opened, I will carry my master just as he is sitting on my back, and the minister Channa will hold on to my tail, and we will jump over the iron fence.”

original: gal te sgo ma phyed par gyur na ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du gsum po'i nang nas gang yang rung gcig nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgo ma phyed par gyur na ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du gsum po'i nang nas gang yang rung gcig nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the gate is not opened, then one of the three will certainly be fulfilled, just as he thought.

original: slar yang sgo srung ba'i lha rnams kyis sgo phye'o //
analyzed: slar yang sgo srung ba'i lha rnams kyis sgo phye'o //
translated: Then the gate-guarding gods opened the gate.

original: de ma thag nyid du bdud kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzlog par bsams nas 'ongs te nam mkha' la 'dug nas smras ba /
analyzed: de ma thag nyid du bdud kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzlog par bsams nas 'ongs te nam mkha' la 'dug nas smras ba /
translated: Immediately Māra thought to turn back the Bodhisattva. He came and sat in the sky and said,

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: “Great Sage!

original: nges par 'byung bas ma 'gro zhig /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bas ma 'gro zhig /
translated: Do not go forth!

original: 'di nas nyi ma bdun pa la khyod kyis rin po che'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas nyi ma bdun pa la khyod kyis rin po che'i 'khor lo thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: After seven days from now you will obtain the precious wheel.

original: gling phran stong phrag gnyis kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gling chen po bzhi'i rgyal srid byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gling phran stong phrag gnyis kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gling chen po bzhi'i rgyal srid byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will rule the four continents surrounded by two thousand islands.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage!

original: zlog cig ces smras so //
analyzed: zlog cig ces smras so //
translated: Turn back!”

original: khyod su zhig yin zhes dris so //
analyzed: khyod su zhig yin zhes dris so //
translated: He asked, “Who are you?”

original: @350b bdag ni 'jig rten gyi dbang po yin zhes smras so //
analyzed: @350b bdag ni 'jig rten gyi dbang po yin zhes smras so //
translated: He said, “I am the lord of the world.”

original: bdud rin po che'i 'khor lo bdag la yod par bdag gis shes te /
analyzed: bdud rin po che'i 'khor lo bdag la yod par bdag gis shes te /
translated: I know that I have the precious wheel.

original: bdag la rgyal po'i dgos pa med do //
analyzed: bdag la rgyal po'i dgos pa med do //
translated: I have no need for a king.

original: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sgra sgrogs shing sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sgra sgrogs shing sangs rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will proclaim the sound in the ten thousand world systems and become a Buddha.

original: zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: bdud kyis smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa /
translated: The demon said,

original: 'di nas bzung nas 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am /🔽gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: 'di nas bzung nas 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'am /
translated: “From now on, if you think of the conceptual thoughts of desire,🔽or the conceptual thoughts of malice,

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa sems la bsams pa'i dus su /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa sems la bsams pa'i dus su /
translated: or the conceptual thoughts of violence,

original: bu / bdag gis shes so zhes smras so //
analyzed: bu / bdag gis shes so zhes smras so //
translated: son, I will know it.”

original: grogs dang ma bral bar grib ma bzhin du rjes su 'brel bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: grogs dang ma bral bar grib ma bzhin du rjes su 'brel bar 'gro'o //
translated: He went along, inseparable from his friend, like a shadow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid lag tu thogs kyang mchil ma'i thal ba bzhin du ltos pa med par dor nas bkur sti chen pos grong khyer nas phyir 'thon no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid lag tu thogs kyang mchil ma'i thal ba bzhin du ltos pa med par dor nas bkur sti chen pos grong khyer nas phyir 'thon no //
translated: The Bodhisattva, though he had the universal monarch’s kingdom in the palm of his hand, cast it off without a second thought, like a gob of spit. With great respect he left the city.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la mchog gi skar ma bre'i dus su phyir 'thon nas slar yang grong khyer la bzlog nas blta bar brjod par bsams so //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la mchog gi skar ma bre'i dus su phyir 'thon nas slar yang grong khyer la bzlog nas blta bar brjod par bsams so //
translated: On the full moon of the middle summer month, at the time of the constellation Puṣya, he turned back and again faced the city.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i thugs la 'khrungs tsam nyid na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i thugs la 'khrungs tsam nyid na'o //
translated: Thus, as soon as the thought arose in the Bodhisattva,

original: skyes bu chen po khyod kyis log nas blta ba'i las kyi bsod nams khyod kyis byas pa med dam zhes brjod pa bzhin du sa gzhi chen po rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin du phug nas bzlog go /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po khyod kyis log nas blta ba'i las kyi bsod nams khyod kyis byas pa med dam zhes brjod pa bzhin du sa gzhi chen po rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin du phug nas bzlog go /
translated: “Great man, have you not performed the meritorious deed of turning back?” the great earth sank in like a potter’s wheel and turned back.

original: byang chub sems dpa' grong khyer la sngon du phyogs shing 'khod nas grong khyer la gzigs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grong khyer la sngon du phyogs shing 'khod nas grong khyer la gzigs te /
translated: The Bodhisattva, facing the city, sat down and looked at the city.

original: de'i sa phyogs zhig tu bsngags ldan ldog pa'i mchod rten gyi gnas gcig @351a *//
analyzed: de'i sa phyogs zhig tu bsngags ldan ldog pa'i mchod rten gyi gnas gcig @351a *//
translated: He pointed out to the place where Kaṇṭhaka’s stūpa would be built.

original: bstan no // bsngags ldan 'gro ba'i lam la mngon du phyogs bar byas nas byon no //
analyzed: bstan no // bsngags ldan 'gro ba'i lam la mngon du phyogs bar byas nas byon no //
translated: Kaṇṭhaka turned around and faced the road he had come on.

original: bkur sti chen po dang / dpal dang / bskal pa bzang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bkur sti chen po dang / dpal dang / bskal pa bzang po dang ldan no //
translated: He will have great respect, glory, and good fortune.

original: de'i tshe lha rnams kyis de'i mdun du stong phrag drug cu'i mar me chen po spar ro //🔽rgyab kyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro //🔽g-yas kyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lha rnams kyis de'i mdun du stong phrag drug cu'i mar me chen po spar ro // rgyab kyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro // g-yas kyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro //
translated: At that time, the gods will light sixty thousand great lamps in front of him.🔽They will also light sixty thousand great lamps behind him.🔽They will also light sixty thousand great lamps to his right.

original: g-yon gyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro //
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyogs su yang mar me chen po stong phrag drug cu spar ro //
translated: They will also light sixty thousand great lamps to his left.

original: lha gzhan rnams kyis kyang 'khor yug gi ri'i steng du grangs med pa'i mar me stong phrag mang po spar ro //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kyis kyang 'khor yug gi ri'i steng du grangs med pa'i mar me stong phrag mang po spar ro //
translated: Other gods will light countless thousands of lamps on top of the surrounding mountains.

original: lha gzhan rnams dang / klu dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pas lha'i spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / bdug pa la sogs pas mchod cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams dang / klu dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pas lha'i spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / bdug pa la sogs pas mchod cing 'gro'o //
translated: Other gods, nāgas, Suparṇas, and so forth will go, making offerings with divine incense, flower garlands, powders, and incense.

original: p'a ri tstsha tra'i me tog nyid dang / man d'a ra'i me tog sbrin ltar mthug pa rgyun du 'bab pa bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyun mi 'chad par me tog gi char babs par gyur to //
analyzed: p'a ri tstsha tra'i me tog nyid dang / man d'a ra'i me tog sbrin ltar mthug pa rgyun du 'bab pa bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyun mi 'chad par me tog gi char babs par gyur to //
translated: And a rain of flowers fell from the sky, like a thick cloud of pāricattakas and mandāras.

original: lha'i glu dbyangs sgrogs bar gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i glu dbyangs sgrogs bar gyur to //
translated: Divine songs were sung.

original: kun nas bskor bar stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi rol mo'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: kun nas bskor bar stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi rol mo'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: Sixty-eight thousand musical instruments were played all around.

original: rgya mtsho'i dbus su 'brug gi sgra sgrogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i dbus su 'brug gi sgra sgrogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It was like the sound of thunder in the middle of the ocean.

original: ri bo gnya' shing 'dzin gyi 'gram du rgya mtsho'i sgra sgrogs pa'i dus bzhin du 'jug go /
analyzed: ri bo gnya' shing 'dzin gyi 'gram du rgya mtsho'i sgra sgrogs pa'i dus bzhin du 'jug go /
translated: It was like the sound of the ocean roaring at the foot of Yugandhara Mountain.

original: 'di ni dpal dang / skal pa bzang po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gshegs pa'i mtshan gcig la rgyal srid gsum spangs nas @351b dpag tshad sum cu'i mthar yid ldan zhes bya ba'i chu klung gi 'gram du bzhud do //
analyzed: 'di ni dpal dang / skal pa bzang po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gshegs pa'i mtshan gcig la rgyal srid gsum spangs nas @351b dpag tshad sum cu'i mthar yid ldan zhes bya ba'i chu klung gi 'gram du bzhud do //
translated: This glorious and fortunate Bodhisattva, in a single night, renounced the three kingdoms and went to the bank of the river called Mindful, thirty yojanas away.

original: ci'i phyir yang rta 'di'i pha rol tu yang 'gro bar mi nus sam /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rta 'di'i pha rol tu yang 'gro bar mi nus sam /
translated: Why can it not go beyond this horse?

original: mi nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it cannot.

original: de ni khor yug gcig gi nang du snga dro gcig la song nas bskor te de ma thag tu snga dro nyid du 'ongs zhing rang gi mdun du kha zas byin pa za bar nus so //🔽de'i tshe slar yang lha dang / klu dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pa nam mkha' la 'khod nas spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa babs te ji srid rta'i brla'i bar du lus nub pas 'thon par mi nus pa spos dang /
analyzed: de ni khor yug gcig gi nang du snga dro gcig la song nas bskor te de ma thag tu snga dro nyid du 'ongs zhing rang gi mdun du kha zas byin pa za bar nus so // de'i tshe slar yang lha dang / klu dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pa nam mkha' la 'khod nas spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa babs te ji srid rta'i brla'i bar du lus nub pas 'thon par mi nus pa spos dang /
translated: In one morning it can go around the entire Cakravāḍa and return to its place, where it can eat the food that is given to it.

original: me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa ni; ral pa ltar gdon par mi nus par shin tu thogs par gyur to //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa ni; ral pa ltar gdon par mi nus par shin tu thogs par gyur to //
translated: At that time, gods, nāgas, garuḍas, and so on, gathered in the sky and rained down incense, flower garlands, and so on. The horse was so weighed down by the incense and flower garlands that it could not get out of the water, as its body was submerged up to its knees.🔽It was so heavy that it could not even shake its mane.

original: de'i phyir dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis su song ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis su song ngo //
translated: Thus it went thirty-two leagues.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chu klung gi 'gram du 'khod nas blon po 'dun pa la dris pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chu klung gi 'gram du 'khod nas blon po 'dun pa la dris pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva sat down on the bank of the river and asked his minister Cunda,

original: chu klung 'di'i ming ci /
analyzed: chu klung 'di'i ming ci /
translated: “What is the name of this river?”

original: lha / yid ldan zhes bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: lha / yid ldan zhes bgyi ba lags so //
translated: “It is called the Nairañjanā, Your Majesty.”

original: bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ba la yid dang ldan pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ba la yid dang ldan pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: “I too have a mind to go forth.”

original: zhabs kyis brgyab ste rta bskul pa byas te /
analyzed: zhabs kyis brgyab ste rta bskul pa byas te /
translated: He kicked his horse with his foot and urged it on.

original: rta yis mchongs nas glang brgyad kyi skad tsam gyis chu klung gi zheng 'gram gyi pha rol tu 'khod do //
analyzed: rta yis mchongs nas glang brgyad kyi skad tsam gyis chu klung gi zheng 'gram gyi pha rol tu 'khod do //
translated: The horse leaped across the river, a distance of eight elephants, and landed on the other side.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rta'i rgyab nas babs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rta'i rgyab nas babs te /
translated: The Bodhisattva dismounted from the horse.

original: dngul dang mtshungs par bye ma'i phung po'i steng du 'khod do //
analyzed: dngul dang mtshungs par bye ma'i phung po'i steng du 'khod do //
translated: He sat down on a pile of sand that was like silver.

original: 'dun pa bos nas khyod kyis bdag gi rgyan rnams dang / bsngags ldan khrid la song zhig /
analyzed: 'dun pa bos nas khyod kyis bdag gi rgyan rnams dang / bsngags ldan khrid la song zhig /
translated: He called to Chanda, “Take my ornaments and Kanthaka and go.

original: bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I am going forth.”

original: @352a *// lta; bdag kyang rab tu 'byung du gsol /
analyzed: @352a *// lta; bdag kyang rab tu 'byung du gsol /
translated: “Please let me go forth too.”

original: byang chub sems dpas khyod kyis rab tu 'byung ba mi thob pas song zhig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas khyod kyis rab tu 'byung ba mi thob pas song zhig /
translated: “You cannot go forth,” the Bodhisattva replied. “Go back.”

original: lan gsum du zhus kyang ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: lan gsum du zhus kyang ma gnang ngo //
translated: He made the same request three times, but the Bodhisattva did not give his consent.

original: rgyan dang / bsngags ldan lag pas gtad de /
analyzed: rgyan dang / bsngags ldan lag pas gtad de /
translated: He gave his ornaments and Kaṇṭhaka to Chandaka,🔽and thought, “This hair of mine is not suitable for an ascetic.”

original: bsams pa / bdag gi skra 'di dge sbyong dang mi mthun no snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis kyang skra breg bar rung ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: bsams pa / bdag gi skra 'di dge sbyong dang mi mthun no snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis kyang skra breg bar rung ba gzhan med do //
translated: The Bodhisattva thought, “There is no one else to cut my hair.”

original: de nas bdag nyid kyis ral gris bregs bar bsams so //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyis ral gris bregs bar bsams so //
translated: Then he thought, “I will cut it myself with a sword.”

original: phyag g-yas pas ral gri bzung nas /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas ral gri bzung nas /
translated: He took the sword in his right hand,

original: phyag g-yon pas cod pa na dang bcas pa'i nor bu bzung ste bcad do //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pas cod pa na dang bcas pa'i nor bu bzung ste bcad do //
translated: and with his left hand he took hold of the jewel in his topknot and cut it off.

original: dbu skra ni sor gnyis par gyur cing /
analyzed: dbu skra ni sor gnyis par gyur cing /
translated: The hair was two fingers long,

original: g-yas phyogs nas 'khyil bas dbu la gnas so //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs nas 'khyil bas dbu la gnas so //
translated: and it remained on his head, curling to the right.

original: de rnams ji srid 'tsho'i bar de nyid kyi tshad du gyur to //
analyzed: de rnams ji srid 'tsho'i bar de nyid kyi tshad du gyur to //
translated: It remained that way for as long as he lived.

original: kha spu yang med par gyur to //
analyzed: kha spu yang med par gyur to //
translated: His beard also disappeared.

original: slar dbu skra dang / kha spu bzhar mi dgos par gyur to //
analyzed: slar dbu skra dang / kha spu bzhar mi dgos par gyur to //
translated: He never again needed to shave his head or face.

original: byang chub sems dpas cod pa na dang bcas pa'i nor bu bzung nas gal te bdag sangs rgyas par 'gyur na nam mkha' la 'khod cig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas cod pa na dang bcas pa'i nor bu bzung nas gal te bdag sangs rgyas par 'gyur na nam mkha' la 'khod cig /
translated: The Bodhisattva took hold of the jewel in his topknot and thought, “If I am to become a buddha, may this jewel rise up into the sky.”

original: ma yin na sa la lhung bar gyur cig ces nam mkha' la dor ro //
analyzed: ma yin na sa la lhung bar gyur cig ces nam mkha' la dor ro //
translated: If not, may I fall to the ground!” And he threw it into the sky.

original: de'i gtsug gi nor bu bcings pa dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam du song nas nam mkha' la 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i gtsug gi nor bu bcings pa dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam du song nas nam mkha' la 'khod do //
translated: The crown jewel rose up to the height of one league and remained suspended in the sky.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi lha'i mig gis bltas pas dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam gyi rin po che'i zam tog gi nang du bcug nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi pho brang du gtsug gi nor bu bzhugs @352b pa'i mchod rten bzhengs so //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi lha'i mig gis bltas pas dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam gyi rin po che'i zam tog gi nang du bcug nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi pho brang du gtsug gi nor bu bzhugs @352b pa'i mchod rten bzhengs so //
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods, saw it with his divine eye and placed it in a jeweled casket one league in size. He built a stūpa in the palace of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three to house the crown jewel.

original: mchog gi dri yis bsgos pa'i gtsug phud bcad //
analyzed: mchog gi dri yis bsgos pa'i gtsug phud bcad //
translated: “The supreme hair was cut, perfumed with the best scent,

original: gang zag mchog gis nam mkha' la ni dor //
analyzed: gang zag mchog gis nam mkha' la ni dor //
translated: and thrown into the sky by the supreme person.

original: mig stong pa yis dbu skra mgo steng bzung //
analyzed: mig stong pa yis dbu skra mgo steng bzung //
translated: The thousand-eyed one held the hair above his head

original: gser gyi zam tog tu lha gnas khyer //
analyzed: gser gyi zam tog tu lha gnas khyer //
translated: and carried it to the god realm in a golden casket.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
translated: Again the Bodhisattva thought,

original: yul ka shi ka'i ras 'di dge sbyong bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bsams so //
analyzed: yul ka shi ka'i ras 'di dge sbyong bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bsams so //
translated: “This Kāśika cloth is not suitable for an ascetic like me.”

original: de nas sangs rgyas 'od srung gi dus su sngon gyi grogs po rdza mkhan tshangs pa chen por gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas 'od srung gi dus su sngon gyi grogs po rdza mkhan tshangs pa chen por gyur to //
translated: Then, in the time of Buddha Kashyapa, the potter became a friend of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas gcig gi bar du grogs po dang ma phrad do zhes bsams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig gi bar du grogs po dang ma phrad do zhes bsams te /
translated: He thought, “I have not met a friend for one Buddha-lifetime.”

original: de ni bdag gi grogs po nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon no //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi grogs po nges par 'byung ba chen pos 'thon no //
translated: “This is my friend. He will certainly emerge through great renunciation.

original: dge sbyong gi yo byad 'di bzung nas 'gro'o zhes bsams so //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi yo byad 'di bzung nas 'gro'o zhes bsams so //
translated: I will take these ascetic’s requisites and go.”🔽The three Dharma robes, the begging bowl,🔽The razor, needle, and belt,

original: chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed dang // spu gri khab dang ska rags dang // chu tshags dang bcas brgyad yin no //
analyzed: chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed dang // spu gri khab dang ska rags dang // chu tshags dang bcas brgyad yin no //
translated: And the water strainer—these are the eight.

original: dge sbyong rnams la rigs shing mkho //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams la rigs shing mkho //
translated: These are suitable and necessary for ascetics.

original: dge sbyod gi mkho ba'i yo byad brgyad po 'di bslangs nas phul lo //
analyzed: dge sbyod gi mkho ba'i yo byad brgyad po 'di bslangs nas phul lo //
translated: He asked for these eight necessary ascetic requisites and offered them.

original: byang chub sems dpas mchod par 'os pa'i rgyal mtshan gyon nas rab tu 'byung ba mchog gi cha byad bslangs te 'dun pa la bdag gi tshig gis ma dang / yab la bdag la nad med par 'gyur ro zhes smros shig ces pas btang ngo; ;'dun pas byang chub sems dpa' la phyag byas bskor ba byas nas song //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mchod par 'os pa'i rgyal mtshan gyon nas rab tu 'byung ba mchog gi cha byad bslangs te 'dun pa la bdag gi tshig gis ma dang / yab la bdag la nad med par 'gyur ro zhes smros shig ces pas btang ngo; ;'dun pas byang chub sems dpa' la phyag byas bskor ba byas nas song //
translated: Chunda bowed down to the Bodhisattva, circumambulated him, and left.

original: slar yang bsngags ldan gyis 'dun pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gsung gleng byed cing 'dug pa @353a *//
analyzed: slar yang bsngags ldan gyis 'dun pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gsung gleng byed cing 'dug pa @353a *//
translated: When he heard that Kanthaka was talking with Chunda and the Bodhisattva,

original: thos nas / bdag ni jo bo dang da 'phrad par mi 'gyur zhes bsams so //
analyzed: thos nas / bdag ni jo bo dang da 'phrad par mi 'gyur zhes bsams so //
translated: he thought, “I will not see my master again.”

original: mig lam du spangs nas mya ngan la shin tu gnas pa bsran par ma nus te snying gas nas dus las 'das te /
analyzed: mig lam du spangs nas mya ngan la shin tu gnas pa bsran par ma nus te snying gas nas dus las 'das te /
translated: He could not bear to be separated from the Bodhisattva, and his heart broke.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su bsngags ldan zhes bya ba'i lha'i bur skyes so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su bsngags ldan zhes bya ba'i lha'i bur skyes so //
translated: He died and was reborn as a god in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, named Kanthaka.

original: 'dun pa la dang bo'i mya ngan du gyur pa gcig go /
analyzed: 'dun pa la dang bo'i mya ngan du gyur pa gcig go /
translated: This was the first time that Chunda was sad.

original: slar yang bsngags ldan dus las 'das pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mya ngan gnyis pas gzir to //
analyzed: slar yang bsngags ldan dus las 'das pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mya ngan gnyis pas gzir to //
translated: He was again afflicted with a second grief, because of the death of Kanthaka.

original: du zhing smre sngags 'don zhing grong khyer du song ngo //
analyzed: du zhing smre sngags 'don zhing grong khyer du song ngo //
translated: Weeping and lamenting, he went to the city.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i phyogs nyid du rjes su dga' ba zhes bya ba'i aa mra'i tshal yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i phyogs nyid du rjes su dga' ba zhes bya ba'i aa mra'i tshal yod do //
translated: In that very direction of the Bodhisattva, there was an mango grove called Anupamā.

original: der nyi ma bdun nas rab tu 'byung ba'i bde bas gnas shing nyin mtshan 'da'o //
analyzed: der nyi ma bdun nas rab tu 'byung ba'i bde bas gnas shing nyin mtshan 'da'o //
translated: There, for seven days, he stayed, passing the days and nights in the bliss of renunciation.

original: nyi ma gcig nyid la dpag tshad sum cu'i lam du zhabs kyis gshegs nas rgyal po'i khab tu byon no //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig nyid la dpag tshad sum cu'i lam du zhabs kyis gshegs nas rgyal po'i khab tu byon no //
translated: In a single day, he walked thirty leagues and arrived at Rājagṛha.

original: byon nas sgo mthar chags su bsod snyoms la gshegs te grong khyer ba thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sku mthong nas glang po che nor skyong zhugs pa'i rgyal po'i khab bzhin dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po zhugs pa'i lha'i grong khyer bzhin du kun tu 'khrugs par gyur te /
analyzed: byon nas sgo mthar chags su bsod snyoms la gshegs te grong khyer ba thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sku mthong nas glang po che nor skyong zhugs pa'i rgyal po'i khab bzhin dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po zhugs pa'i lha'i grong khyer bzhin du kun tu 'khrugs par gyur te /
translated: Having arrived, he went for alms in order, and the entire city, seeing the body of the Bodhisattva, became agitated, like Rājagṛha when the elephant Dhanapāla entered, or like a city of the gods when the lord of the asuras enters.

original: rgyal po'i mi 'ongs shing /
analyzed: rgyal po'i mi 'ongs shing /
translated: The king’s men did not come.

original: lha / 'di lta bu'i gzugs kyi sems can gcig grong khyer na bsod snyoms byed do //
analyzed: lha / 'di lta bu'i gzugs kyi sems can gcig grong khyer na bsod snyoms byed do //
translated: “ Your Majesty, a being with such a form is begging for alms in the city.”

original: lha'am / mi'am /
analyzed: lha'am / mi'am /
translated: “ Is it a god or a human?”

original: 'dab bzang ste /
analyzed: 'dab bzang ste /
translated: “ It is Suparṇa.”

original: 'di gang yin bdag cag gis ma @353b shes so zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di gang yin bdag cag gis ma @353b shes so zhes smras so //
translated: “ We do not know who he is.”

original: rgyal po khang bzang gi steng du 'khod nas skyes bu chen po mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyal po khang bzang gi steng du 'khod nas skyes bu chen po mthong ste /
translated: The king went up to the roof of the palace and saw the Great Man.

original: ya mtshan dang / rmad du byung bskyes so //
analyzed: ya mtshan dang / rmad du byung bskyes so //
translated: He was amazed and astonished.

original: mi gcig bos nas song la rtogs shig /
analyzed: mi gcig bos nas song la rtogs shig /
translated: He summoned a man and said, “Go and find out.

original: gal te mi ma yin par gyur na grong khyer nas phyi rol tu song ste mi snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te mi ma yin par gyur na grong khyer nas phyi rol tu song ste mi snang bar 'gyur //
translated: If he is a nonhuman, he will leave the city and disappear.

original: gal te lha yin par gyur na nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: gal te lha yin par gyur na nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: If he is a god, he will fly up into the sky.

original: gal te klu yin na sa'i 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te klu yin na sa'i 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is a nāga, he will go underground.

original: gal te mi yin na ji ltar thob pa'i kha zas za'o zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: gal te mi yin na ji ltar thob pa'i kha zas za'o zhes bsgo'o //
translated: If he is a human, he will eat the food he has obtained.”

original: skyes bu chen pos kyang kha zas 'dres pa rnams bsdus nas bdag la 'di tsam gyis chog par rtogs te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen pos kyang kha zas 'dres pa rnams bsdus nas bdag la 'di tsam gyis chog par rtogs te /
translated: The Great Man collected the mixed food and said, “I am satisfied with this much.”

original: zhugs pa'i sgo nyid nas grong khyer gyi phyi rol tu 'thon te /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i sgo nyid nas grong khyer gyi phyi rol tu 'thon te /
translated: He left the city through the gate where he had entered.

original: ri skya'o yi grib ma la shar du sdun du phyogs pas bzhugs nas kha zas la longs spyod par brtsams so //
analyzed: ri skya'o yi grib ma la shar du sdun du phyogs pas bzhugs nas kha zas la longs spyod par brtsams so //
translated: He sat down in the shade of a tree, facing east, and began to eat.

original: de nas gang gi sgyu ma phyin ci log ste kha nas 'thon pa'i rnam par bsams par gyur to //🔽de nas de'i bdag nyid kyis lus kyis 'di lta bu'i tshul gyi kha zas mig gis mthong ba yang dkon no //

translated: His golden-colored

original: ba'i nu ma'i gam du snod gsar pa nye bar gnas pa byas pa tsam na rang gi chos nyid kyis 'o ma'i rgyun gyis snod gang bar gyur @356b to; ;legs skyes mas ya mtshan che ba mthong ste /
analyzed: ba'i nu ma'i gam du snod gsar pa nye bar gnas pa byas pa tsam na rang gi chos nyid kyis 'o ma'i rgyun gyis snod gang bar gyur @356b to; ;legs skyes mas ya mtshan che ba mthong ste /
translated: Mahāprajāpatī saw this miracle.

original: 'o ma rang gi lag pas khyar nas snod gsar par blugs pa la rang ga lag gis me btang ste 'tshod par brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'o ma rang gi lag pas khyar nas snod gsar par blugs pa la rang ga lag gis me btang ste 'tshod par brtsams nas /
translated: She took the milk in her own hands, poured it into a new vessel, and with her own hands lit a fire and began to cook it.

original: der 'o thug skol pas lbu ba chen po 'thon nas g-yas phyogs su 'khor zhing thur ma gcig tsam yangs la ma lhung la /
analyzed: der 'o thug skol pas lbu ba chen po 'thon nas g-yas phyogs su 'khor zhing thur ma gcig tsam yangs la ma lhung la /
translated: As the milk boiled, a great froth arose, circled to the right, and remained about one cubit above the surface without falling.

original: thab na du ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: thab na du ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There was not the slightest smoke in the hearth.

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po 'ongs nas tha ba srun par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po 'ongs nas tha ba srun par byed do //
translated: At that time, the four world guardians come and make the ground firm.

original: tshangs pa chen pos ni gdugs 'dzin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen pos ni gdugs 'dzin no //
translated: Brahma holds up an umbrella.

original: brgya byin gyis ni ji ltar rigs pa'i me gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis ni ji ltar rigs pa'i me gtong bar byed do //
translated: Indra sets up a fire as is appropriate.

original: stong phrag gnyis kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gling chen po bzhi'i lha dang mi rnams kyis ji ltar rigs pa'i mdangs rnams /
analyzed: stong phrag gnyis kyis yongs su bskor ba'i gling chen po bzhi'i lha dang mi rnams kyis ji ltar rigs pa'i mdangs rnams /
translated: The gods and humans of the four great continents, surrounded by two thousand, put in the appropriate life force.

original: lha rang rang gi mthus bsdus nas bcug go /
analyzed: lha rang rang gi mthus bsdus nas bcug go /
translated: The gods each gather it with their own power and put it in.

original: mi rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du byas nas dus gzhan la lha rnams zan gyis gong bu re res mdangs 'jug go /
analyzed: mi rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du byas nas dus gzhan la lha rnams zan gyis gong bu re res mdangs 'jug go /
translated: Humans also do the same. Later, the gods put in life force with each lump of food.

original: slar yang byang chub ba'i nyin mo dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i nyin mo snod nyid du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang byang chub ba'i nyin mo dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i nyin mo snod nyid du 'jug par byed do //
translated: Again, on the day of enlightenment and on the day of parinirvana, they put it in the vessel.

original: legs skyes mas nyi ma gcig nyid la der rang nyid gsal bar gyur nas ya mtshan che ba du ma mthong ste /
analyzed: legs skyes mas nyi ma gcig nyid la der rang nyid gsal bar gyur nas ya mtshan che ba du ma mthong ste /
translated: On that very day, Mahaprajapati became radiant herself and saw many wonders.🔽She called her servant, Parivrajaka,

original: bran mo rdzogs ma zhes bya ba bos nas /
analyzed: bran mo rdzogs ma zhes bya ba bos nas /
translated: and said,🔽I have seen many wonders.

original: rdzogs ma / de ring bdag cag gi lha shin tu dgyes bar gyur te /
analyzed: rdzogs ma / de ring bdag cag gi lha shin tu dgyes bar gyur te /
translated: “Today our god is very pleased.

original: bdag gis de rnams khyi dus su 'di lta ba'i tshul gyi ya mtshan che ga ma mthong bas myur du song la lha'i gnas su byi dor legs bar gyis shig /🔽des legs @357a *//
analyzed: bdag gis de rnams khyi dus su 'di lta ba'i tshul gyi ya mtshan che ga ma mthong bas myur du song la lha'i gnas su byi dor legs bar gyis shig / des legs @357a *//
translated: I have never seen him so happy. Quickly go and clean the gods’ realm well.”

original: so zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: so zhes brjod nas /
translated: “Very well,” she said,

original: 'phags ma de'i tshig bzung ste myur ba myur bar shing gi drung du phyin no //
analyzed: 'phags ma de'i tshig bzung ste myur ba myur bar shing gi drung du phyin no //
translated: and she took the noble lady’s word and quickly went to the foot of the tree.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang de'i mtshan mo'i cha la rmi lam chen po lnga gzigs pa yongs su rtog cing the tshom med par bdag de ring sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du thugs brtan por mdzad nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang de'i mtshan mo'i cha la rmi lam chen po lnga gzigs pa yongs su rtog cing the tshom med par bdag de ring sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du thugs brtan por mdzad nas /
translated: The Bodhisattva, in the last part of the night, saw five great dreams. He thought about them and, without any doubt, firmly decided, “Today I will attain buddhahood.”

original: de'i nub mo 'das te sku'i byi dor mdzad nas bsod snyoms la gshegs pa'i dus kyi snga dro byon te /
analyzed: de'i nub mo 'das te sku'i byi dor mdzad nas bsod snyoms la gshegs pa'i dus kyi snga dro byon te /
translated: That night passed and he cleaned his body. In the morning, the time for his alms round arrived.

original: shing n+ya gro dha'i drung du bzhugs nas rang gi 'od kyis shing thams cad snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha'i drung du bzhugs nas rang gi 'od kyis shing thams cad snang bar mdzad do //
translated: He sat down at the foot of the banyan tree, and with his own light he illuminated all the trees.

original: de nas yang rdzogs ma de 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' shing gi drung na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams la gzigs shing gzigs pa mthong la sku la 'od zer 'thon pa'i 'od kyis shing thams cad gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas yang rdzogs ma de 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' shing gi drung na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams la gzigs shing gzigs pa mthong la sku la 'od zer 'thon pa'i 'od kyis shing thams cad gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: Then the perfect lady came and saw the Bodhisattva sitting at the foot of the tree, gazing at the world system to the east, his body shining with light, and all the trees appearing golden in color.

original: des 'di ltar bsams te /
analyzed: des 'di ltar bsams te /
translated: She thought like this:

original: de ring bdag cag gi lha shing la babs nas rang gi lag nyid kyis gtor ma len cing bzhugs so zhes bsams pas sems tshim pa thob nas myur du song ste legs skyes ma la don de rnams smras so //
analyzed: de ring bdag cag gi lha shing la babs nas rang gi lag nyid kyis gtor ma len cing bzhugs so zhes bsams pas sems tshim pa thob nas myur du song ste legs skyes ma la don de rnams smras so //
translated: Today our god has descended to the tree and is sitting there, taking the offerings with his own hands. Thinking this, she became satisfied and quickly went to Mādrī and told her about all that she had seen.

original: legs skyes mas de'i tshig thos nas sems tshim par gyur te /
analyzed: legs skyes mas de'i tshig thos nas sems tshim par gyur te /
translated: When Mādrī heard her words, she became satisfied.

original: de ring nas bzung nas bdag gi bu mo chen mo gnas su sdod cig /
analyzed: de ring nas bzung nas bdag gi bu mo chen mo gnas su sdod cig /
translated: From today on, let my eldest daughter stay here.

original: ces bu mo la ji ltar rigs pa'i rgyan thams cad byin no //
analyzed: ces bu mo la ji ltar rigs pa'i rgyan thams cad byin no //
translated: Thus he gave the girl all the ornaments suitable for her.

original: slar yang gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yongs su @357b rdzogs par thob pa'i nyin mo 'bum phrag gcig gi grangs kyang gser gyi sder ma chen po thob par rigs so //
analyzed: slar yang gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yongs su @357b rdzogs par thob pa'i nyin mo 'bum phrag gcig gi grangs kyang gser gyi sder ma chen po thob par rigs so //
translated: Again, on the day of the Buddha's full attainment, he thought, It is fitting to obtain a great golden plate worth one hundred thousand.

original: de'i phyir gser gyi sder ma chen po'i nang du 'o thug ldugs pa'i sems skyes nas 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi sder ma chen po bslangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gser gyi sder ma chen po'i nang du 'o thug ldugs pa'i sems skyes nas 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi sder ma chen po bslangs te /
translated: Therefore, he thought of cooking the milk-rice in a great golden plate worth one hundred thousand, and asked for a great golden plate worth one hundred thousand.

original: 'o thug btsos pa'i nang du kha spub nas blug go /
analyzed: 'o thug btsos pa'i nang du kha spub nas blug go /
translated: He turned it upside down and poured the cooked milk-rice into it.

original: 'o thug thams cad padma'i 'dab ma'i nang gi chu bzhin du chu'i thigs pa gcig tu gyur nas gser gyi sder du byung ngo //
analyzed: 'o thug thams cad padma'i 'dab ma'i nang gi chu bzhin du chu'i thigs pa gcig tu gyur nas gser gyi sder du byung ngo //
translated: All the milk-rice became a single drop of water like the water in a lotus leaf and appeared in the golden plate.

original: gser gyi sder ma gcig gang ba'i tshad tsam du gyur to //
analyzed: gser gyi sder ma gcig gang ba'i tshad tsam du gyur to //
translated: It became the size of a single filled golden plate.

original: des gser gyi snod de la gser gyi snod gzhan gyis bkab nas gos kyis dril to //
analyzed: des gser gyi snod de la gser gyi snod gzhan gyis bkab nas gos kyis dril to //
translated: He covered that golden vessel with another golden vessel and wrapped it in cloth.

original: legs skyes ma rgyan gyis lus thams cad brgyan nas gser gyi sder ma de rang gi mgor bzhag ste /
analyzed: legs skyes ma rgyan gyis lus thams cad brgyan nas gser gyi sder ma de rang gi mgor bzhag ste /
translated: Sujātā adorned her entire body with ornaments, placed the golden bowl on her head,

original: mthu chen pos shing n+ya gro dha'i drung du phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas shin tu yid bde bskyes par gyur to //
analyzed: mthu chen pos shing n+ya gro dha'i drung du phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas shin tu yid bde bskyes par gyur to //
translated: and with great effort went to the foot of the nyagrodha tree. When she saw the Bodhisattva, she was very happy.

original: shing gi lha yin nam zhes bsams nas blta ba'i gnas su dud cing dud cing song ste /
analyzed: shing gi lha yin nam zhes bsams nas blta ba'i gnas su dud cing dud cing song ste /
translated: Thinking, “Is this a tree spirit?” she went there, bowing and bowing.

original: mgo'i steng gi gser gyi sngar ma phab nas kha phye ste /
analyzed: mgo'i steng gi gser gyi sngar ma phab nas kha phye ste /
translated: She took off the golden bowl from her head, opened it,

original: gser gyi ril ba spyi blugs kyis dri bzang pos bsgos pa'i chu bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar song ste 'khod do //
analyzed: gser gyi ril ba spyi blugs kyis dri bzang pos bsgos pa'i chu bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar song ste 'khod do //
translated: and with the golden water pot filled with water scented with perfume, she approached the Bodhisattva and sat down.

original: grogs po rdza mkhan tshangs pa chen por gyur pas phul ba'i sa'i lhung bzed ni de rnams kyi dus su byang chub sems dpas ma spangs kyang de de ma thag tu mi snang bar gyur /
analyzed: grogs po rdza mkhan tshangs pa chen por gyur pas phul ba'i sa'i lhung bzed ni de rnams kyi dus su byang chub sems dpas ma spangs kyang de de ma thag tu mi snang bar gyur /
translated: “Friend, the earthen bowl offered by the potter who became Great Brahmā, although the Bodhisattva did not abandon it at that time, immediately disappeared.🔽The Bodhisattva took the bowl

original: byang chub sems dpas lhung bzed @358a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lhung bzed @358a *//
translated: and

original: ma gzigs so //
analyzed: ma gzigs so //
translated: He did not look at her.

original: phyag g-yas pa brkyang nas chu bslang ste /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa brkyang nas chu bslang ste /
translated: He extended his right hand and took the water.

original: legs skyes mas snod dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'o thug skyes bu chen po'i phyag cu phul lo //
analyzed: legs skyes mas snod dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'o thug skyes bu chen po'i phyag cu phul lo //
translated: Sujātā offered the milk-rice and the golden vessel to the Great Man.

original: skyes bu chen pos legs skyes ma la brtags pa na /
analyzed: skyes bu chen pos legs skyes ma la brtags pa na /
translated: When the Great Man looked at Sujātā,

original: de rnam 'gyur shes nas /
analyzed: de rnam 'gyur shes nas /
translated: she understood his intention.

original: 'phags pa / bdag gis yid la yongs su phul gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa / bdag gis yid la yongs su phul gyi /
translated: “Noble One, I offer it to you with my mind.

original: bzhes la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin gshegs par zhu zhes phyag byas nas /
analyzed: bzhes la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin gshegs par zhu zhes phyag byas nas /
translated: Please accept it and go as you wish.”

original: ji ltar bdag gi 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: “Just as I have fulfilled my desire,🔽may you also fulfill your intention.”

original: 'di ltar nyid kyis kyang bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces smras so; ;'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi sder ma chen po gcig shing gi lo ma rnying pa bzhin du ltos pa med par song ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyid kyis kyang bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces smras so; ;'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi sder ma chen po gcig shing gi lo ma rnying pa bzhin du ltos pa med par song ngo //
translated: She said this and without hesitation threw away the golden vessel worth a hundred thousand, as if it were an old leaf.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs pa las bzhengs nas shing la bskor ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs pa las bzhengs nas shing la bskor ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva rose from his seat, circumambulated the tree,🔽and said to himself,

original: gser gyi sder ma blangs nas chu klung ne ra dza na'i 'gram du gshegs te /
analyzed: gser gyi sder ma blangs nas chu klung ne ra dza na'i 'gram du gshegs te /
translated: He took the golden bowl and went to the bank of the Nairañjanā River.

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa 'bum brag mang po rnams gyis mngon par byang chub pa'i nyin mo babs nas khrus byed pa'i gnas su legs par rab tu gnas pa'i mu gnas zhes bya ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa 'bum brag mang po rnams gyis mngon par byang chub pa'i nyin mo babs nas khrus byed pa'i gnas su legs par rab tu gnas pa'i mu gnas zhes bya ba yod do //
translated: On the day of his enlightenment, countless hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas had gathered at the site of his ablution, which was called “Well-Established.”

original: de'i 'gram du sder ma bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i 'gram du sder ma bzhag ste /
translated: He placed the bowl on the bank,

original: babs nas khrus mdzad do //
analyzed: babs nas khrus mdzad do //
translated: and after descending, he bathed.

original: 'bum phrag du ma'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi na bza' dang / mchod bar 'os pa gyon nas shar phyogs su sngon du phyogs pas bzhugs nas /
analyzed: 'bum phrag du ma'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi na bza' dang / mchod bar 'os pa gyon nas shar phyogs su sngon du phyogs pas bzhugs nas /
translated: Having bathed, he put on the robes of the many hundreds of thousands of buddhas and the robes of the worthy ones.

original: ta la'i @358b shing tog gi nang gi rus pa cig gi tshad tsam dang mnyam pa gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu'i gong bu byas nas chu med cing dngar ba'i 'o thug thams cad gsol lo //
analyzed: ta la'i @358b shing tog gi nang gi rus pa cig gi tshad tsam dang mnyam pa gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu'i gong bu byas nas chu med cing dngar ba'i 'o thug thams cad gsol lo //
translated: Facing east, he made a lump of the porridge, the size of a jujube fruit, and ate all the thick porridge without water.

original: de 'di ltar gang gis sangs rgyas su gyur nas zhag bzhi bcu zhe dgu ru byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs te zhag bzhi bcu zhe dgu'i kha zas su gyur to //
analyzed: de 'di ltar gang gis sangs rgyas su gyur nas zhag bzhi bcu zhe dgu ru byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs te zhag bzhi bcu zhe dgu'i kha zas su gyur to //
translated: In this way, after he became a Buddha, he remained in the seat of awakening for forty-nine days, subsisting on the porridge.

original: de rnams kyi dus su kha zas gzhan med pa dang / khrus byed pa med pa dang / zhal shol ba med pa dang / sku lus kyi bya ba byed pa med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dus su kha zas gzhan med pa dang / khrus byed pa med pa dang / zhal shol ba med pa dang / sku lus kyi bya ba byed pa med do //
translated: During that time, he had no other food, no bathing, no cleaning of the face, and no physical activity.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang / lam gyi bde ba dang / 'bra bu'i bde ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan 'da'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang / lam gyi bde ba dang / 'bra bu'i bde ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan 'da'o //
translated: He spent day and night in the bliss of concentration, the bliss of the path, and the bliss of the fruit.

original: gzhan yang / de'i 'o thug gsol nas gser gyi snger ma phyag tu bzhes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / de'i 'o thug gsol nas gser gyi snger ma phyag tu bzhes te /
translated: Moreover, after he ate the porridge, he took the golden bowl in his hand.

original: gal te bdag ni de ring sangs rgyas su 'gyur nus? na sder ma 'di chu'i steng du gyen du 'gro bar gyur cig /
analyzed: gal te bdag ni de ring sangs rgyas su 'gyur nus? na sder ma 'di chu'i steng du gyen du 'gro bar gyur cig /
translated: “If I can become a Buddha today, may this bowl float on the water.”

original: ma yin na thur la 'gro bar gyur cig ces chu la dor ro //
analyzed: ma yin na thur la 'gro bar gyur cig ces chu la dor ro //
translated: “If not, may it sink.” He threw it into the water.

original: des chu'i rgyun gyi rlabs chu klung gi dbus su song nas dbus kyi gnas nyid du rta ma gyogs por 'gro ba bzhin du /
analyzed: des chu'i rgyun gyi rlabs chu klung gi dbus su song nas dbus kyi gnas nyid du rta ma gyogs por 'gro ba bzhin du /
translated: The current of the river carried the wave to the middle of the river, and it went to the middle place, like a swift horse.

original: khru brgyad cu'i tshad tsam gyi steng du song zhing /
analyzed: khru brgyad cu'i tshad tsam gyi steng du song zhing /
translated: It went up to a height of about eighty cubits.

original: chu lan gcig 'khyil bas bying nas klu'i rgyal po nag po'i gnas su song ngo /
analyzed: chu lan gcig 'khyil bas bying nas klu'i rgyal po nag po'i gnas su song ngo /
translated: Once the water had swirled around, it sank and went to the abode of the nāga king Kāla.🔽Then the three buddhas ate their meal on a large golden plate that clattered with a sound.

original: de nas sangs rgyas gsum po rnams kyis bshos gsol ba'i gser gyi sder mchen po sil sil zhes sgra sgrogs par byed cing phyogs gcig tu de rnams thams cad kyi 'og? @359a *//🔽gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas gsum po rnams kyis bshos gsol ba'i gser gyi sder mchen po sil sil zhes sgra sgrogs par byed cing phyogs gcig tu de rnams thams cad kyi 'og? @359a *// gyur nas gnas so //
translated: All of them were below it in one place.

original: klu'i rgyal po nag pos de'i sgra thos nas kha sang sangs rgyas gcig thob bar gyur cing /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nag pos de'i sgra thos nas kha sang sangs rgyas gcig thob bar gyur cing /
translated: The nāga king Kāla heard that sound and thought, “Yesterday one buddha came.

original: slar yang de ring sangs rgyas nyid thob par gyur nas mang pos bstod pa byed par gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang de ring sangs rgyas nyid thob par gyur nas mang pos bstod pa byed par gyur to //
translated: Again today, many buddhas have come and are being praised by many.”

original: byang chub sems dpas ni chu klung gi 'gram shing s'a la'i tshal du nyin mo bzhugs nas srod kyi dus su me tog ku mud kha 'bye ba'i dus la lha rnams kyis brgyan par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni chu klung gi 'gram shing s'a la'i tshal du nyin mo bzhugs nas srod kyi dus su me tog ku mud kha 'bye ba'i dus la lha rnams kyis brgyan par byas nas /
translated: The Bodhisattva spent the day in a grove of sāla trees on the bank of the river. In the evening, when the kumuda flowers opened, the gods adorned him.

original: zheng la glang gi skad brgyad kyis thos pa'i tshad du lam byed pa la seng ge bzhin du sgra bsgrags nas /
analyzed: zheng la glang gi skad brgyad kyis thos pa'i tshad du lam byed pa la seng ge bzhin du sgra bsgrags nas /
translated: He walked on a path eight elephant calls wide, his voice resounding like a lion’s.

original: byang chub kyi shing la mngon par phyogs pas bzhud do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing la mngon par phyogs pas bzhud do //
translated: He proceeded, facing the Bodhi tree.

original: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pa rnams kyis lha'i spos dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / klu'i glu dbyangs la sogs pas mchod do //
analyzed: klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / 'dab bzang la sogs pa rnams kyis lha'i spos dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / klu'i glu dbyangs la sogs pas mchod do //
translated: Nāgas, yakṣas, garuḍas, and so forth made offerings with divine incense, flowers, and so forth, and with nāga songs and so forth.

original: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dri bzang por gyur cing me tog gi phreng bar gyur nas thams cad legs so zhes brjod par gyur to //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dri bzang por gyur cing me tog gi phreng bar gyur nas thams cad legs so zhes brjod par gyur to //
translated: The worlds in the ten directions became fragrant and became garlands of flowers. Everyone said, “Excellent!”

original: de'i tshe rtsva 'tshod bkra shis zhes bya bas rtsva blangs nas lam gyi sngon du 'ongs te skyes bu chen po'i rnam 'gyur rtogs nas rtsva sbar mo brgyad phul lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsva 'tshod bkra shis zhes bya bas rtsva blangs nas lam gyi sngon du 'ongs te skyes bu chen po'i rnam 'gyur rtogs nas rtsva sbar mo brgyad phul lo //
translated: At that time, a grass-seller named Svastika, having taken grass, came before the path and, understanding the demeanor of the Great Being, offered eight handfuls of grass.

original: byang chub sems dpas rtsva blangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rtsva blangs nas /

analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po dang nye bar gshegs te lho phyogs kyi char zhal byang du mngon par phyogs pas 'khod do //
translated: and, approaching the seat of enlightenment, sat facing east toward the south.

analyzed: de ma thag par lho phyogs kyi khor yug gi sa bying nas 'gro ba ni 'og @359b mnar med ba'i bar du gyur pa bzhin no //

analyzed: byang phyogs kyi khor yug steng du langs nas 'gro ba ni srid ba'i rtse mor gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: and in the north it rose up as if it had reached the peak of existence.

original: byang chub sems dpas 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes dgongs zhing bskor nas nub kyi phyogs kyi char gshegs te shar phyogs su mngon du phyogs pas 'khod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes dgongs zhing bskor nas nub kyi phyogs kyi char gshegs te shar phyogs su mngon du phyogs pas 'khod do //
translated: The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain perfect buddhahood.” He turned and went to the west, where he sat facing east.

original: de nas nub phyogs kyi khor yug 'og tu bying nas 'gro ba ni mnar med pa'i bar du gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas nub phyogs kyi khor yug 'og tu bying nas 'gro ba ni mnar med pa'i bar du gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Then he sank down into the earth of the western continent up to the Cakravāḍa Mountains, as if he were sinking into cotton wool or flax.

original: shar phyogs kyi khor yug steng du langs nas 'gro ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi khor yug steng du langs nas 'gro ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: He rose up to the Cakravāḍa Mountains in the east, as if he were rising up to the peak of existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khod cing 'khod pa'i gnas ni mu khyud kyi mthar thug par mnan zhing so sor gnas pa'i shing rta'i 'khor lo chen po lta bur sa gzhi chen po la bying zhing bying nas 'gro bar gyur te /

translated: The Bodhisattva sat down, and the place where he sat sank down and remained separate, like a great chariot wheel, sinking into the great earth up to the edge of the Cakravāḍa Mountains.

original: byang chub sems dpas 'di ni byang chub thob pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes bskor nas byang phyogs kyi char gshegs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di ni byang chub thob pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes bskor nas byang phyogs kyi char gshegs te /
translated: He turned around and went east.🔽The earth sank down in the east and rose up in the west.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”🔽He turned around and went south.

analyzed: lho phyogs su sdun du phyogs pas 'khod do; ;de nas byang gi khor yug sa la bying nas mnar med kyi bar du gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: The earth sank down in the south and rose up in the north.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”🔽He turned around and went north.

analyzed: lho'i khor yug gyen du langs nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gyur pa bzhin no //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di ni byang chub thob pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes bsams te /
translated: He turned around and went north.🔽The earth sank down in the north and rose up in the south.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”🔽He turned around and went east.🔽The earth sank down in the east and rose up in the west.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”🔽He turned around and went south.

original: bskor nas shar phyogs kyi char gshegs nas nub phyogs su sdun du phyogs pas 'khod do //
analyzed: bskor nas shar phyogs kyi char gshegs nas nub phyogs su sdun du phyogs pas 'khod do //
translated: The earth sank down in the south and rose up in the north.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”

original: slar yang @360a *//
analyzed: slar yang @360a *//
translated: He turned around and went north.🔽The earth sank down in the north and rose up in the south.🔽The Bodhisattva thought, “This is not the place to attain enlightenment.”🔽He turned around and went east.🔽The earth sank down in the east and rose up in the west.

original: shar phyogs kyi chang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis skyil krung? bcas ba'i gnas de g-yo bar mi 'gyur zhing mi ldeg go /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi chang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis skyil krung? bcas ba'i gnas de g-yo bar mi 'gyur zhing mi ldeg go /
