analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma spangs shing mi g-yo ba'i gnas /
translated: The great being said, “This is the place that is not abandoned and is unshakable by all buddhas.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'i gnas su rtogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'i gnas su rtogs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva understood that this was the place where all the Buddhas had not abandoned the world, the place where they had conquered the net of all afflictions.

original: de'i rtsva rnams rtse mo nas bzung ste bkra ma nas de ma thag tu khru bcu bzhi pa'i tshad tsam gyi gdan du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rtsva rnams rtse mo nas bzung ste bkra ma nas de ma thag tu khru bcu bzhi pa'i tshad tsam gyi gdan du gyur to //
translated: He took the grass, held it by the tips, and shook it. Immediately it became a seat fourteen cubits wide.

original: de yang de lta bu'i tshul gyis ji ltar bzhag pa de bzhin du mi gnas so //
analyzed: de yang de lta bu'i tshul gyis ji ltar bzhag pa de bzhin du mi gnas so //
translated: And it remained just as he had arranged it, without moving.

original: ji ltar gzugs la mkhas pa'i ri mo byed pa rnams kyis ri mo bris pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub shing gi sdong po la sku rgyab rten par byas nas zhal shar du sdun du phyogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la mkhas pa'i ri mo byed pa rnams kyis ri mo bris pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub shing gi sdong po la sku rgyab rten par byas nas zhal shar du sdun du phyogs par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva leaned his back against the trunk of the Bodhi tree and faced east, just as a skilled painter might draw a picture.

original: brtan pa'i sems su gyur nas bdag gi pags pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang / khrag dang / sha rnams skam par gyur kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma thob par du ni stan 'di las lus bskyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtan pa'i sems su gyur nas bdag gi pags pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang / khrag dang / sha rnams skam par gyur kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma thob par du ni stan 'di las lus bskyod par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if my skin, sinews, bones, blood, and flesh should dry up, I will not move my body from this seat until I have attained perfect awakening.

original: thog brgya phrag babs kyang mi phyed cing pha rol gyis mi tshugs par stan la skyil krung gis bzhugs so //
analyzed: thog brgya phrag babs kyang mi phyed cing pha rol gyis mi tshugs par stan la skyil krung gis bzhugs so //
translated: Even if a hundred bolts of lightning were to strike, he would not be split apart, and he would not be harmed by others. He sat cross-legged on the seat.

original: de'i tshe lha'i bu'i bdud kyis gzhon nu don grub bdag gi dbang du byed par 'dod pas da ni bdag las 'da' bar byed du mi ster ro zhes bsams nas bdud kyi dmag dang nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe lha'i bu'i bdud kyis gzhon nu don grub bdag gi dbang du byed par 'dod pas da ni bdag las 'da' bar byed du mi ster ro zhes bsams nas bdud kyi dmag dang nye bar song ste /
translated: At that time, the son of the gods Māra, desiring to bring the prince Siddhārtha under his control, thought, “Now he will not let me pass beyond him.” Having thought this, he approached the army of Māra.

original: don 'di smras @360b shing bdud kyi sgra zhes pas sgra bsgrags nas bdud kyi dmag khrid de 'thon nas /
analyzed: don 'di smras @360b shing bdud kyi sgra zhes pas sgra bsgrags nas bdud kyi dmag khrid de 'thon nas /
translated: Having spoken this matter and having proclaimed the sound of Māra, he led the army of Māra and departed.

original: bdud kyi sde bdud kyi mdun du dpag tshad bcu gnyis kyi sar 'gro'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde bdud kyi mdun du dpag tshad bcu gnyis kyi sar 'gro'o //
translated: The army of Māra went twelve leagues in front of Māra.

original: g-yas phyogs dang / g-yon phyogs rnams su dpag tshad bcu gnyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs dang / g-yon phyogs rnams su dpag tshad bcu gnyis 'gro'o //
translated: On the right and left sides, it extends twelve yojanas.

original: rgyab phyogs su ji srid khor yug gi gnas mthar thug bar byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: rgyab phyogs su ji srid khor yug gi gnas mthar thug bar byas nas gnas so //
translated: Behind it, it extends as far as the outer ring of mountains.

original: steng du dpag tshad dgu'o //
analyzed: steng du dpag tshad dgu'o //
translated: Above, it is nine yojanas.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi gtam byed pa'i sgra dpag tshad stong phrag gcig gi bar du sa gzhi 'bugs pa tsam gyi sgra thos so //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi gtam byed pa'i sgra dpag tshad stong phrag gcig gi bar du sa gzhi 'bugs pa tsam gyi sgra thos so //
translated: The sound of all the discussions of the retinue is heard as if it were filling the ground, up to a distance of one thousand yojanas.

original: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud dpag tshad phyed dang nyis brgya'i ri'i 'og pag zhes bya ba'i glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon nas lag pa stong phrag gcig sprul nas mtshon cha sna tshogs pa blangs so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud dpag tshad phyed dang nyis brgya'i ri'i 'og pag zhes bya ba'i glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon nas lag pa stong phrag gcig sprul nas mtshon cha sna tshogs pa blangs so //
translated: Then, the demon of the sons of gods, half a yojana and two hundred yojanas in height, mounted on the back of an elephant called Pāka, emanated one thousand hands and took up various weapons.

original: gzhan yang / bdud kyi 'khor gyi grogs gnyis gcig dang mtshungs par mtshon cha'i rigs gnyis mi len no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdud kyi 'khor gyi grogs gnyis gcig dang mtshungs par mtshon cha'i rigs gnyis mi len no //
translated: Moreover, the retinue of the demon does not take up two types of weapons, as if they were equal to one another.

original: kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdong can sems dpa' chen po gzhom par bya ba'i phyir 'ongs so //
analyzed: kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdong can sems dpa' chen po gzhom par bya ba'i phyir 'ongs so //
translated: with various colors and various faces, came to destroy the Great Being.

analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i khor yug gi lha rnams slar yang sems dpa' chen po la bstod pa byed cing gnas so //
translated: The gods of the ten thousand worlds again praised the Great Being and remained.

original: brgya byin lha'i rgyal pos rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa'i dung 'bud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i rgyal pos rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa'i dung 'bud cing 'khod do //
translated: Śakra, king of the gods, blew the unsurpassable conch of victory and remained.

original: slar yang dung de khru brgya nyi shur gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang dung de khru brgya nyi shur gyur to //
translated: Again, that conch became one hundred and twenty cubits long.

original: gal te legs bar bus na zla ba bzhi'i bar du rgyun mi 'chad cing de nas rgyun chad do //
analyzed: gal te legs bar bus na zla ba bzhi'i bar du rgyun mi 'chad cing de nas rgyun chad do //
translated: If it is blown well, it continues for four months without interruption, and then it stops.

original: klu'i rgyal po nag po chen pos brgya phrag du ma'i bstod pa byed @361a *//🔽cing gnas so //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nag po chen pos brgya phrag du ma'i bstod pa byed @361a *// cing gnas so //
translated: The great black nāga king remained, making hundreds of praises.

original: tshangs pa chen po gdugs dkar po bzung nas gnas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po gdugs dkar po bzung nas gnas so //
translated: The great Brahmā remained, holding a white parasol.

original: slar yang bdud kyi dmag byang chub kyi snying por 'ongs shing 'ongs so //
analyzed: slar yang bdud kyi dmag byang chub kyi snying por 'ongs shing 'ongs so //
translated: Again, the demon army came to the seat of awakening.

original: lha de rnams gcig tu 'khod par ma nus pas rang gi gnas su bros nas song ngo //
analyzed: lha de rnams gcig tu 'khod par ma nus pas rang gi gnas su bros nas song ngo //
translated: The gods were unable to gather in one place, so they fled to their own abodes.

original: klu'i rgyal po nag pos la bying nas dpag tshad lnga brgya'i snye ma can gyi klu'i pho brang du song ste /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nag pos la bying nas dpag tshad lnga brgya'i snye ma can gyi klu'i pho brang du song ste /
translated: The nāga king Kālika sank into the ground and went to the nāga palace of Mātaṅga, five hundred leagues away.

original: lag pa gnyis kha la bkab nas nyal lo //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kha la bkab nas nyal lo //
translated: He lay down, covering his face with his two hands.

original: brgya byin gyi rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa'i dung rgyab tu bkal te khor yug gi steng du 'khod do //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa'i dung rgyab tu bkal te khor yug gi steng du 'khod do //
translated: Śakra placed the conch shell of unsurpassed victory on his back and sat on the top of the surrounding wall.

original: tshangs pa chen pos gdugs dkar po khor yug gi steng du btsugs nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du song ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen pos gdugs dkar po khor yug gi steng du btsugs nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du song ngo //
translated: Great Brahmā raised a white parasol on the top of the surrounding wall and went to the Brahma world.

original: lha gcig gis kyang 'khod par ma nus te /
analyzed: lha gcig gis kyang 'khod par ma nus te /
translated: Not a single god was able to remain.

original: skyes bu chen po nyid gcig pu bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po nyid gcig pu bzhugs so //
translated: Only the Great Being remained alone.

original: bdud kyis rang gi 'khor la smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis rang gi 'khor la smras pa /

original: bu / zas gtsang gi bu don grub dang 'dra ba'i skyes bu gzhan med pas /
analyzed: bu / zas gtsang gi bu don grub dang 'dra ba'i skyes bu gzhan med pas /
translated: Sons, there is no other being like Siddhārtha, the son of Śuddhodana.

original: bdag gis de'i mdun du g-yul 'gyed par mi nus kyi rgyab kyi phyogs su g-yul bgyi'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: bdag gis de'i mdun du g-yul 'gyed par mi nus kyi rgyab kyi phyogs su g-yul bgyi'o zhes smras so //
translated: I cannot fight him in front, but I will fight from behind.”

analyzed: skyes bu chen pos kyang phyogs gsum la gzigs pas lha thams cad bros pa'i phyir gnas thams cad stong par mthong ngo //
translated: The Great Being looked in three directions, and saw that all the gods had fled, and that the whole place was empty.

original: gzhan yang byang phyogs su gzigs pas bdud kyi dmag rnams bdag gzhom pa'i phyir 'ongs pa gzigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang phyogs su gzigs pas bdud kyi dmag rnams bdag gzhom pa'i phyir 'ongs pa gzigs so //
translated: Then he looked in the northern direction and saw the army of Māra coming to destroy him.

original: 'di rnams kyi dmag gi tshogs bdag gcig pu'i phyir rtsol ba chen pos pha rol gnon par @361b byed cing gnas 'dir 'ongs te /🔽bdag gi ma'am /🔽pha'am / spun nam /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dmag gi tshogs bdag gcig pu'i phyir rtsol ba chen pos pha rol gnon par @361b byed cing gnas 'dir 'ongs te / bdag gi ma'am / pha'am / spun nam /
translated: “This army of his is exerting itself with great effort for my sake alone, and has come to this place.🔽There is no one else, not even a mother,🔽father, brother,

original: su yang rung bas gnyen las gzhan med do //
analyzed: su yang rung bas gnyen las gzhan med do //
translated: or anyone else.

original: gzhan yang / gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po nyid bdag gis dus yun ring por gnyen la dga' ba bzhin goms pa de'i phyir bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis phub byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po nyid bdag gis dus yun ring por gnyen la dga' ba bzhin goms pa de'i phyir bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis phub byas nas /
translated: Moreover, since I have long been accustomed to the ten perfections, as if they were dear relatives, I will now, by means of the perfections themselves,

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis mtshon thogs te /
translated: He thought, It is fitting to take up the weapon of the perfections themselves.

original: 'di'i dmag gi tshogs rnam par gzhom par rigs so snyam nas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po thugs la bsams nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di'i dmag gi tshogs rnam par gzhom par rigs so snyam nas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po thugs la bsams nas bzhugs so //
translated: Thinking of the ten perfections in his mind, he remained there.

original: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud kyis don grub de ma thag tu 'bros par byed par rigs so zhes smras nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor nye bar gnas nas 'ongs so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud kyis don grub de ma thag tu 'bros par byed par rigs so zhes smras nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor nye bar gnas nas 'ongs so //
translated: Then the demon of the son of gods said, It is fitting to flee immediately from this Accomplisher of Goals. Having said that, he approached, creating a circle of wind.

translated: Immediately the circles of wind from the east and so forth arose and came, taking up heaps of mountains the size of half a league and two leagues, and so on, and throwing them down on the forest, trees, and so forth.

original: grong rdal phye ma dang / rnam par phye mar byed pa'i nus pa ni skyes bu chen po'i bsod nams kyi gzi brjid kyis mthus gyes te /
analyzed: grong rdal phye ma dang / rnam par phye mar byed pa'i nus pa ni skyes bu chen po'i bsod nams kyi gzi brjid kyis mthus gyes te /
translated: The power to pulverize the villages and towns into dust was born from the splendor of the great man's merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas bla gos kyi grva tsam yang bsgul par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas bla gos kyi grva tsam yang bsgul par mi nus so //
translated: He came before the Bodhisattva and was unable to move even the edge of his upper robe.

original: de nas chu yis gzhom pa'i phyir 'ongs nas gsod par bsams pa na char pa chen po 'bab cing gnas so //
analyzed: de nas chu yis gzhom pa'i phyir 'ongs nas gsod par bsams pa na char pa chen po 'bab cing gnas so //
translated: Then, in order to destroy him with water, he came and thought to kill him. A great rain fell and remained.🔽By its power, many hundreds of layers above and many thousands of

analyzed: de'i mthus steng nas steng du brgya phrag du ma brtsegs pa dang / stong phrag du @362a *//
translated: layers above were piled up.

analyzed: ma brtsegs pa'i sprin chen po 'dus nas char 'bebs so //

analyzed: char pa'i rgyun gyi shugs kyis sa gzhi 'bugs par gyur to //
translated: By the force of the rain, the earth was penetrated.

original: nags tshal dang / shing la sogs pa'i steng gi char sprin chen po 'ongs nas sems dpa' chen po chu thigs gcig tsam gyis kyang spang bar ma nus so //
analyzed: nags tshal dang / shing la sogs pa'i steng gi char sprin chen po 'ongs nas sems dpa' chen po chu thigs gcig tsam gyis kyang spang bar ma nus so //
translated: Great rain clouds came above the forest, trees, and so forth. The great being was not able to be moved by even a single drop of water.

original: de nas rdo yi char pa bkug nas ches che ba'i ri'i phung po du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de nas rdo yi char pa bkug nas ches che ba'i ri'i phung po du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas /
translated: Then, summoning a rain of stones, he made a great mass of mountains burn and blaze, and coming from the sky, he came before the Bodhisattva.

original: lha'i me tog gi chun bu'i gzugs 'bab bo //
analyzed: lha'i me tog gi chun bu'i gzugs 'bab bo //
translated: divine flower garlands rained down.

original: de nas mtshon cha'i char thams cad bkug nas mtshon so gcig pa dang / so gnyis pa dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung dang / spu gri la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' la 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas mtshon cha'i char thams cad bkug nas mtshon so gcig pa dang / so gnyis pa dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung dang / spu gri la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' la 'ongs te /
translated: Then, having drawn in all the rain of weapons, the one-edged, two-edged, swords, spears, razors, and so forth, having been extinguished and put out, came into the sky

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas lha'i me tog tu gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du 'ongs nas lha'i me tog tu gyur to //
translated: and, having come into the presence of the Bodhisattva, became divine flowers.

original: de nas sol ba'i char bkug nas rgya skyegs kyi me tog gi kha dog can gyi sol ba nam mkha' nas 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i me tog tu gyur nas 'bab bo //
analyzed: de nas sol ba'i char bkug nas rgya skyegs kyi me tog gi kha dog can gyi sol ba nam mkha' nas 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i me tog tu gyur nas 'bab bo //
translated: Then, having drawn in the rain of charcoal, the charcoal, which had the color of the China rose, came down from the sky and, having become divine flowers, fell at the feet of the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas thal ba'i char pa rnams bkug nas shin tu dro ba me'i kha dog can gyi thal ba nam mkha' nas 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du tsandan gyi phye ma ltar gyur pa'i char 'bab bo //
analyzed: de nas thal ba'i char pa rnams bkug nas shin tu dro ba me'i kha dog can gyi thal ba nam mkha' nas 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du tsandan gyi phye ma ltar gyur pa'i char 'bab bo //
translated: Then, having drawn in the rain of dust, the dust, which was very hot and had the color of fire, came down from the sky and, having become a rain of sandalwood powder, fell at the feet of the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas bye ma'i char bkug @362b nas shin tu phra ba'i bye ma rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i phye ma ltar gyur nas char 'bab bo //
analyzed: de nas bye ma'i char bkug @362b nas shin tu phra ba'i bye ma rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i phye ma ltar gyur nas char 'bab bo //
translated: Then, having drawn in the rain of sand, he causes the very fine sand to smoke and blaze, and coming from the sky, it becomes divine powder at the feet of the Bodhisattva and falls as rain.

original: de nas 'jim pa'i char pa rnams bkug nas 'jim pa rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i byug par gyur nas 'bab bo //
analyzed: de nas 'jim pa'i char pa rnams bkug nas 'jim pa rnams du bar byed cing 'bar bar byas nas nam mkha' nas 'ongs te byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs drung du lha'i byug par gyur nas 'bab bo //
translated: Then, having drawn in the rain of clay, he causes the clay to smoke and blaze, and coming from the sky, it becomes divine unguent at the feet of the Bodhisattva and falls.

original: de nas 'di bzhin du 'jigs par byed pas don grub 'bros par bya ba'i phyir mun pa nye bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di bzhin du 'jigs par byed pas don grub 'bros par bya ba'i phyir mun pa nye bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to frighten him in this way and make Siddhārtha flee, he should make darkness appear.

original: de ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mun nag chen por gyur nas /
analyzed: de ni yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mun nag chen por gyur nas /
translated: That becomes a great darkness with four limbs.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du sleb nas nyi ma'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa bzhin du mi snang bar gyur nas 'di ltar bdud dgu po 'di rlung dang / char dang / rdo dang / mtshon cha dang / sol ba dang / thal ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du sleb nas nyi ma'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa bzhin du mi snang bar gyur nas 'di ltar bdud dgu po 'di rlung dang / char dang / rdo dang / mtshon cha dang / sol ba dang / thal ba dang /
translated: The nine demons rained down wind, rain, stones, weapons, charcoal, ashes,

original: bye ma dang / 'jim pa dang / mun pa ste /
analyzed: bye ma dang / 'jim pa dang / mun pa ste /
translated: sand, mud, and darkness.

original: de rnams char du 'babs nas byang chub sems dpa' 'bros par byed par ma nus so //
analyzed: de rnams char du 'babs nas byang chub sems dpa' 'bros par byed par ma nus so //
translated: They rained down on the Bodhisattva, but he was unable to flee.

original: cis brjod cing ci'i phyir sdod /
analyzed: cis brjod cing ci'i phyir sdod /
translated: “What are you saying? Why are you standing there?”

original: gzhon nu / 'di la zungs shig /
analyzed: gzhon nu / 'di la zungs shig /
translated: “Young man, seize him!

original: rgyob cig / thon cig /
analyzed: rgyob cig / thon cig /
translated: Strike him! Throw him out!”

original: ces 'khor rnams bos nas rang gis kyang ri'i 'og pag glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon nas 'khor lo'i mtshon cha bslangs te /
analyzed: ces 'khor rnams bos nas rang gis kyang ri'i 'og pag glang po che'i rgyab tu zhon nas 'khor lo'i mtshon cha bslangs te /
translated: Having called out to his retinue, he himself took up a weapon of a wheel and rode on the back of an elephant under a mountain.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du nye bar 'ongs nas don grub stan las longs shig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du nye bar 'ongs nas don grub stan las longs shig /
translated: Approaching the Bodhisattva, he said, “Siddharta, get up from your seat!

original: 'di khyod la rigs pa ma yin gyi nged la rigs pa yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di khyod la rigs pa ma yin gyi nged la rigs pa yin no zhes smras so //
translated: This is not right for you. It is right for me.”

original: sems dpa' chen pos @363a *//
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos @363a *//
translated: The great being

original: de'i tshig thos nas 'di ltar smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshig thos nas 'di ltar smras so //
translated: heard his words and said this:

original: bdud khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ma rdzogs pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma rdzogs pa dang / don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma rdzogs pa dang / chen po lnga yongs su gtong ba med pa dang /
analyzed: bdud khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ma rdzogs pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma rdzogs pa dang / don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma rdzogs pa dang / chen po lnga yongs su gtong ba med pa dang /
translated: “You, Māra, have not completed the ten perfections, have not completed the proximate perfections, have not completed the ultimate perfections, have not given up the five great things,

original: gnyen gyi don du spyod pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don gyi spyod pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas stan 'di khyod la rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen gyi don du spyod pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don gyi spyod pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas stan 'di khyod la rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: have not practiced for the sake of relatives, have not practiced for the sake of the world, and have not completed the practice of the Buddha. Therefore this seat is not suitable for you.

original: stan 'di bdag kho na la rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: stan 'di bdag kho na la rigs pa yin no //
translated: This seat is suitable only for me.”

original: bdud khros par gyur nas khros ba'i shugs bsran par ma nus te /
analyzed: bdud khros par gyur nas khros ba'i shugs bsran par ma nus te /
translated: Māra became angry and, unable to bear the force of his anger,

original: skyes bu chen po la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo 'phangs so //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po la mtshon cha'i 'khor lo 'phangs so //
translated: he hurled a wheel of weapons at the great being.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sems par byed cing bzhugs pa na steng gi char me tog gi phreng ba'i bla res bres pa bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sems par byed cing bzhugs pa na steng gi char me tog gi phreng ba'i bla res bres pa bzhin du gyur to //
translated: When he was sitting there, reflecting on the ten perfections, above him a canopy of flower garlands was spread out.

original: de'i 'khor lo'i mtshon cha gzhan yang de shin tu khros pas 'phangs te rdo ba mthug po'am /
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo'i mtshon cha gzhan yang de shin tu khros pas 'phangs te rdo ba mthug po'am /
translated: Then, with great anger, he hurled his other weapon, the discus, which penetrated a thick stone

original: rdo ba mthug po'i ka ba 'bugs shing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdo ba mthug po'i ka ba 'bugs shing 'gro ba'o //
translated: or a thick stone pillar and went through.🔽When he was sitting there, reflecting on the ten perfections of a great being, it became a canopy of flowers above him.

original: slar yang de ni de'i me tog gi bla res su gyur nas gnas pa na bdud kyi 'khor lhag ma rnams de nas stan las langs te 'gro bar bsams nas ches che ba'i ri'i phung po 'phangs so //
analyzed: slar yang de ni de'i me tog gi bla res su gyur nas gnas pa na bdud kyi 'khor lhag ma rnams de nas stan las langs te 'gro bar bsams nas ches che ba'i ri'i phung po 'phangs so //
translated: Then the remaining retinue of Māra, thinking to rise up from their seats and leave, hurled a huge mass of mountains.

original: de rnams kyang skyes bu chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sems zhing bzhugs pa na me tog gi chun por gyur nas sa la lhung ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang skyes bu chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sems zhing bzhugs pa na me tog gi chun por gyur nas sa la lhung ngo //
translated: When he was sitting there, reflecting on the ten perfections of a great being, they became flower garlands and fell to the ground.

original: lha rnams khor yug gi mthar 'khod pa rnams ske @363b bteg nas blta zhing /
analyzed: lha rnams khor yug gi mthar 'khod pa rnams ske @363b bteg nas blta zhing /
translated: The gods who were sitting at the edge of the world-system looked up and said:🔽“This is the sign of the bodhisattva’s enlightenment.

original: mgo bo bteg cing bteg nas don grub gzhon nu mchog gi sku'i bdag nyid nyams sam snyam nas ci byed na zhes bsams zhing blta'o //
analyzed: mgo bo bteg cing bteg nas don grub gzhon nu mchog gi sku'i bdag nyid nyams sam snyam nas ci byed na zhes bsams zhing blta'o //
translated: He raised his head and, thinking that the body of the Supreme Youthful Sage had disappeared, he thought, “What should I do?” and looked.

original: de nas skyes bu chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i nyin mo thob pa'i stan bdag la rigs pa yin no zhes bshad nas /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i nyin mo thob pa'i stan bdag la rigs pa yin no zhes bshad nas /
translated: Then the Great Being, the Bodhisattva who had perfected the perfections, said, “It is fitting for me to attain the seat of complete and perfect enlightenment on this very day.”

original: 'khod pa'i bdud la smras so //
analyzed: 'khod pa'i bdud la smras so //
translated: He spoke to the seated Mara.

original: bdud / khyod kyis sbyin pa btang ba'i dbang po su yod zhes smras so //
analyzed: bdud / khyod kyis sbyin pa btang ba'i dbang po su yod zhes smras so //
translated: “Mara, who are the lords of your generosity?”🔽“All these Maras are my lords,” and he extended his hand to the Mara armies.

original: bdud 'di rnams thams cad bdag gi dbang po yin no zhes bdud kyi dmag rnams la lag pa brkyang ngo; ;de ma thag par bdud kyi 'khor rnams nga yang dbang po yin zhes brjod pa'i sgras sa gzhi yang ral ba bzhin du brjod pa'i sgrar gyur to //
analyzed: bdud 'di rnams thams cad bdag gi dbang po yin no zhes bdud kyi dmag rnams la lag pa brkyang ngo; ;de ma thag par bdud kyi 'khor rnams nga yang dbang po yin zhes brjod pa'i sgras sa gzhi yang ral ba bzhin du brjod pa'i sgrar gyur to //
translated: Immediately, the Mara retinue exclaimed, “I am also a lord,” and the sound of that filled the earth as if it were splitting open.

original: de nas bdud kyis skyes bu chen po la smras pa; don grub /
analyzed: de nas bdud kyis skyes bu chen po la smras pa; don grub /
translated: Then Māra said to the Great Being, “Siddārtha,

original: khyod kyis sbyin pa gtang ba'i dngos po la dbang po su yod ces smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyis sbyin pa gtang ba'i dngos po la dbang po su yod ces smras so //
translated: who is the witness to the things you have given in generosity?”

original: skyes bu chen po khyod kyis re zhig sbyin pa byin pa'i dngos po la sems dang bcas pa rnams dpang po yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po khyod kyis re zhig sbyin pa byin pa'i dngos po la sems dang bcas pa rnams dpang po yin no //
translated: “The Great Being, you have witnesses who have minds to the things you have given in generosity.

original: slar yang bdag la gnas 'di na sems dang bcas pa'i dbang po su yang med pas bdag nyid kyis skye ba'i mthar sbyin pa gtang ba de srid gnas pa thams cad sgrol gyi lus kyi bdag nyid la gnas nas sbyin pa chen po bdun brgya pa bdun byin
analyzed: slar yang bdag la gnas 'di na sems dang bcas pa'i dbang po su yang med pas bdag nyid kyis skye ba'i mthar sbyin pa gtang ba de srid gnas pa thams cad sgrol gyi lus kyi bdag nyid la gnas nas sbyin pa chen po bdun brgya pa bdun byin
translated: But to me, in this place, there is no one who has a mind, so I myself will give in generosity to the end of my birth. All the beings who are liberated will dwell in the body of me, Dṛḍhavrata, and will give the seven hundred great gifts.

original: pa'i dngos po la sems med pa'i sa gzhi chen po mthug po 'di dpang po yin no zhes chos gos kyi nang @364a *//
analyzed: pa'i dngos po la sems med pa'i sa gzhi chen po mthug po 'di dpang po yin no zhes chos gos kyi nang @364a *//
translated: The great thick earth, which has no mind to the things that are given in generosity, is my witness.”

original: nas phyag g-yas pa bton te /
analyzed: nas phyag g-yas pa bton te /
translated: He extended his right hand from within his Dharma robes🔽and said to the earth, “Earth, are you my witness?”

original: thams cad sgrol gyi bdag nyid kyi lus su gnas nas bdag gis sbyin pa bdun brgya pa bdun byin pa'i dngos po de la khyod kyis dpang po yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad sgrol gyi bdag nyid kyi lus su gnas nas bdag gis sbyin pa bdun brgya pa bdun byin pa'i dngos po de la khyod kyis dpang po yin nam /
translated: He extended his hand toward the great earth and said, You are the witness to the fact that I have given away my seven hundred and seven gifts with the thought of benefiting all beings.

original: ma yin pa smros shig ces sa chen po la mngon du phyogs pas phyag brkyang ba na /
analyzed: ma yin pa smros shig ces sa chen po la mngon du phyogs pas phyag brkyang ba na /
translated: Are you or are you not?

original: sa chen pos bdag ni de'i tshe dpang po yin no zhes sgra sgrogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: sa chen pos bdag ni de'i tshe dpang po yin no zhes sgra sgrogs par gyur nas /
translated: The great earth replied, At that time I was the witness.

original: sgra chen po sgrogs pa brgya dang stong phrag gcig dang / sgra chen po 'bum phrag gcig po rnams kyis bdud kyi dmag gi sgra rnams zil gyis mnan pa bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: sgra chen po sgrogs pa brgya dang stong phrag gcig dang / sgra chen po 'bum phrag gcig po rnams kyis bdud kyi dmag gi sgra rnams zil gyis mnan pa bzhin du gyur to //
translated: The sound of the great earth's reply was a hundred thousand times louder than the sound of the demons' army.

original: de nas skyes bu chen po don grub kyi sbyin pa chen po byin ba ni mchog gi sbyin pa'o zhes thams cad sgrol gyi sbyin pa dran par byed cing dpag tshad phyed dang / nyis brgya'i ri'i 'og pag gi glang po che pus mo sa la btsugs nas 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas skyes bu chen po don grub kyi sbyin pa chen po byin ba ni mchog gi sbyin pa'o zhes thams cad sgrol gyi sbyin pa dran par byed cing dpag tshad phyed dang / nyis brgya'i ri'i 'og pag gi glang po che pus mo sa la btsugs nas 'khod do //
translated: Then the great man, having given the great gift of his own body, the supreme gift, remembered the gift of Viśvantara, and sat down on the ground, his knees planted on the earth, two hundred and fifty leagues below the mountain.

original: bdud kyi 'khor rnams phyogs dang / mtshams rnams su bros nas gnyis lam gcig la 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor rnams phyogs dang / mtshams rnams su bros nas gnyis lam gcig la 'gro ba med do //
translated: The retinue of Māra fled in all directions, and there was no one to accompany him on the road.

original: mgo yi rgyan nyid dang gyon pa'i gos dang por dor nas rang gi phyogs phyogs nyid du 'bros so //
analyzed: mgo yi rgyan nyid dang gyon pa'i gos dang por dor nas rang gi phyogs phyogs nyid du 'bros so //
translated: Having first cast off his head ornament and his clothes, he fled in all directions.

original: de nas lha'i tshogs rnams kyis bdud bros nas 'gro ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas lha'i tshogs rnams kyis bdud bros nas 'gro ba mthong ste /
translated: Then the hosts of gods saw Māra fleeing.

original: bdud rnams pham pas don grub gzhon nu rgyal bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdud rnams pham pas don grub gzhon nu rgyal bar gyur to //
translated: They thought, The young man Siddhārtha has won, since Māra has been defeated.

original: zhes rgyal ba'i mchod pa byed par sems so //🔽klu ni klu rnams la bskul lo //
analyzed: zhes rgyal ba'i mchod pa byed par sems so // klu ni klu rnams la bskul lo //
translated: They made offerings to the Victor.🔽The nāgas urged the nāgas.

original: 'dab bzang ni 'dab bzang rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dab bzang ni 'dab bzang rnams la'o //
translated: Suparṇa urged the Suparṇas.

original: lha ni lha rnams la'o /
analyzed: lha ni lha rnams la'o /
translated: The gods urged the gods.

original: @364b tshangs pas ni tshangs pa rnams la bskul lo //
analyzed: @364b tshangs pas ni tshangs pa rnams la bskul lo //
translated: Brahma exhorts the Brahmas.

original: spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa lag tu thogs nas byang chub shing gi drung du skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i skyes bu chen po dang nye bar 'ongs so //
analyzed: spos dang / me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa lag tu thogs nas byang chub shing gi drung du skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i skyes bu chen po dang nye bar 'ongs so //
translated: Holding in their hands incense, flower garlands, and so forth, they approach the great being who is seated cross-legged at the foot of the tree of enlightenment.

original: de ltar bdud rnams bros nas song ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bdud rnams bros nas song ngo //
translated: Thus the demons flee and depart.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
translated: The glorious Buddha is victorious!

original: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
analyzed: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
translated: The evil Mara is defeated!

original: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
analyzed: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
translated: The joy of enlightenment is proclaimed!

original: de tshe drang srong klu tshogs rgyal //
analyzed: de tshe drang srong klu tshogs rgyal //
translated: At that time, the assembly of sages and nagas is victorious!

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
translated: The glorious Buddha is victorious!

original: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
analyzed: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
translated: The evil Mara is defeated!

original: rab dga' byang chub snying po sgrogs //
analyzed: rab dga' byang chub snying po sgrogs //
translated: The joy of enlightenment is proclaimed!

original: 'dab bzang tshogs kyi drang srong rgyal //
analyzed: 'dab bzang tshogs kyi drang srong rgyal //
translated: The assembly of Suparna is victorious!

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: The glorious Buddha is victorious!

original: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
analyzed: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
translated: The evil Mara is defeated!🔽The joy of enlightenment is proclaimed!🔽The assembly of sages is victorious!🔽The glorious Buddha is victorious!🔽The evil Mara is defeated!

original: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
analyzed: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
translated: The joy of enlightenment is proclaimed!

original: sna tshogs de tshe drang srong rgyal //
analyzed: sna tshogs de tshe drang srong rgyal //
translated: At that time, the sage became the Victor.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas rgyal bar gyur //
translated: The glorious Buddha became the Victor.

original: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
analyzed: sdig can bdud ni pham par gyur //
translated: The evil Mara was defeated.

original: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
analyzed: rab dga' byang chub snying por sgrogs //
translated: The supreme joy was proclaimed at the site of enlightenment.

original: tshangs tshogs de tshe rgyal bar sgrogs //
analyzed: tshangs tshogs de tshe rgyal bar sgrogs //
translated: The assembly of Brahmas was proclaimed victorious at that time.

original: mthar stong phrag bcu'i khor yug gi lha rnams kyis me tog dang / spos dang / byug pa rnams kyis mchod par byed do //
analyzed: mthar stong phrag bcu'i khor yug gi lha rnams kyis me tog dang / spos dang / byug pa rnams kyis mchod par byed do //
translated: At the end, the gods of the ten thousand chiliocosms made offerings with flowers, incense, and ointments.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bstod pa byed cing 'khod do //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bstod pa byed cing 'khod do //
translated: They sat praising in various ways.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu chen po nyi ma nub pa'i tshe bdud rnam par bcom nas chos gos kyi steng du byang chub kyi shing gi 'dab ma myu gu lta bu lhung zhing byu ru dmar pos mchod par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu chen po nyi ma nub pa'i tshe bdud rnam par bcom nas chos gos kyi steng du byang chub kyi shing gi 'dab ma myu gu lta bu lhung zhing byu ru dmar pos mchod par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, when the great being defeated Mara at sunset, sprouts of Bodhi tree leaves fell on his Dharma robe, and he was offered red coral.

original: thun dang po la @365a *//
analyzed: thun dang po la @365a *//
translated: In the first watch,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ye shes kyi rtogs pa dang / thun bar pa la lha'i spyan rnam par dag pas ye shes thob pa dang / thun tha ma la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ye shes thob bo //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ye shes kyi rtogs pa dang / thun bar pa la lha'i spyan rnam par dag pas ye shes thob pa dang / thun tha ma la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ye shes thob bo //
translated: and in the last watch, the knowledge of dependent origination.

original: de nas rten 'brel bcu gnyis kyi rkyen gyis rnam par 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug pa'i lugs las byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dran par byed cing dran par byed do //
analyzed: de nas rten 'brel bcu gnyis kyi rkyen gyis rnam par 'jug pa dang / mi 'jug pa'i lugs las byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dran par byed cing dran par byed do //
translated: Then he contemplated and remembered the twelve links of dependent origination, the way of engagement and the way of non-engagement, the natural order and the reverse order.

original: stong phrag bcus 'jig rten gyi khams chu'i mthar thug par byas nas lan bcu gnyis su yang dag par g-yos so //
analyzed: stong phrag bcus 'jig rten gyi khams chu'i mthar thug par byas nas lan bcu gnyis su yang dag par g-yos so //
translated: With ten thousand worlds as far as the limit of water, he shook them twelve times.

original: slar yang skyes bu chen pos stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sgra chen po sgrogs shing skya rengs shar ba'i dus su thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor myong ngo //
analyzed: slar yang skyes bu chen pos stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sgra chen po sgrogs shing skya rengs shar ba'i dus su thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor myong ngo //
translated: Again, the Great Being proclaimed a great sound in ten thousand worlds and at dawn he experienced the knowledge of omniscience.

original: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad brgyan pa bzhin du rigs par gyur to //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad brgyan pa bzhin du rigs par gyur to //
translated: The entire world system of a billion worlds was adorned in the same way.🔽The streamers attached to the victory banners and flags on the eastern ring of mountains reached as far as the western ring of mountains.

original: shar phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus nub kyi khor yug gi steng du chags so; ;de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs kyi khor yug gi mtha'i steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus shar gyi khor yug gi steng du chags so //🔽byang gi phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus lho'i khor yug gi steng du chags so //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus nub kyi khor yug gi steng du chags so; ;de bzhin du nub kyi phyogs kyi khor yug gi mtha'i steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus shar gyi khor yug gi steng du chags so // byang gi phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan btsugs pa'i sham bus lho'i khor yug gi steng du chags so //
translated: The streamers attached to the victory banners and flags on the western ring of mountains reached as far as the eastern ring of mountains.🔽The streamers attached to the victory banners and flags on the northern ring of mountains reached as far as the southern ring of mountains.

original: lho'i phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba @365b dan btsugs pa'i sham bus byang gi khor yug gi steng du chags so //
analyzed: lho'i phyogs kyi khor yug gi steng du rgyal mtshan dang / ba @365b dan btsugs pa'i sham bus byang gi khor yug gi steng du chags so //
translated: The streamers attached to the victory banners and flags on the southern ring of mountains reached as far as the northern ring of mountains.

original: sa gzhi las langs pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan tshangs pa'i gnas su chags so //
analyzed: sa gzhi las langs pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan tshangs pa'i gnas su chags so //
translated: The victory banners and flags that rose up from the ground reached as far as the realm of Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi gnas su bcings pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sa gzhi'i steng du chags so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi gnas su bcings pa'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sa gzhi'i steng du chags so //
translated: The banners and flags bound to the abodes of the Brahma world fell to the ground.

original: stong phrag bcu'i khor yug la me tog gi shing la me tog kha bye'o //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i khor yug la me tog gi shing la me tog kha bye'o //
translated: In the ten thousand world systems, the flowers on the flower trees bloomed.

original: 'bras bu'i shing la 'bras bu mang por gyur to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shing la 'bras bu mang por gyur to //
translated: The fruit trees were laden with fruit.

original: sdong po rnams la sdong po'i padma'i me tog kha bye'o //🔽yal ga rnams la yal ga'i padma'i me tog go /
analyzed: sdong po rnams la sdong po'i padma'i me tog kha bye'o // yal ga rnams la yal ga'i padma'i me tog go /
translated: On the trunks of the trees, the trunks of the lotus flowers bloomed.🔽On the branches, the branches of the lotus flowers bloomed.

original: 'khri shing rnam la 'khri shing gi padma'i me tog go /
analyzed: 'khri shing rnam la 'khri shing gi padma'i me tog go /
translated: On the vines, the vines of the lotus flowers bloomed.

original: nam mkha' nas thur du padma'i me tog 'chang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' nas thur du padma'i me tog 'chang ngo //
translated: From the sky, the lotus flowers rained down.

original: thang dang / rdo'i steng brtol nas steng nas steng du bdun bdun du gyur te rgyun chags pa'i padma'i me tog zhes bya ba phyung ngo //
analyzed: thang dang / rdo'i steng brtol nas steng nas steng du bdun bdun du gyur te rgyun chags pa'i padma'i me tog zhes bya ba phyung ngo //
translated: From the ground and the rocks, the lotus flowers sprang up, one above the other, in succession, and were called the “continuous lotus flowers.”

original: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyad par du 'phags pa'i me tog gi gdan bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyad par du 'phags pa'i me tog gi gdan bzhin du gyur to //
translated: The ten thousand world systems became like the special flower seats.

original: khor yug gi bar dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad kyi 'jig rten gyi bar gyi dmyal ba nyi ma bdun gyi 'od kyis kyang snang bar byed pa med pas na dkon no //
analyzed: khor yug gi bar dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad kyi 'jig rten gyi bar gyi dmyal ba nyi ma bdun gyi 'od kyis kyang snang bar byed pa med pas na dkon no //
translated: The sun's rays do not shine there, nor the moon's light, nor fire's radiance.

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi dmyal ba pa de ma thag tu snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar gyi dmyal ba pa de ma thag tu snang bar gyur to //
translated: But when the beings of the hells appear there, the sun's rays do shine there, the moon's light and fire's radiance.

original: dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong tsam gyis zab pa'i rgya mtsho chen po'i chu dang por gyur to //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong tsam gyis zab pa'i rgya mtsho chen po'i chu dang por gyur to //
translated: The great ocean, deep by eighty-four thousand leagues, becomes shallow.

original: chu klung rnams ni 'gro ba gnas so //
analyzed: chu klung rnams ni 'gro ba gnas so //
translated: The rivers stop flowing.

original: dmus long rnams kyi mig gis gzugs mthong ngo //🔽'on ba rnams kyis rna bas @366a *//
analyzed: dmus long rnams kyi mig gis gzugs mthong ngo // 'on ba rnams kyis rna bas @366a *//
translated: The blind see forms.

original: sgra thos so //
analyzed: sgra thos so //
translated: The deaf hear sounds.

original: gong po rnams kyis 'gro shes par gyur to //
analyzed: gong po rnams kyis 'gro shes par gyur to //
translated: The crippled walk.

original: bcings pa'i sems can rnams ni rjes su bcings pa las grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcings pa'i sems can rnams ni rjes su bcings pa las grol bar gyur to //
translated: The fetters of beings in bondage are loosened.

original: 'di ltar tshad med pa'i dpal du gyur nas mchod pa dang ya mtshan pa'i chos rab tu skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad med pa'i dpal du gyur nas mchod pa dang ya mtshan pa'i chos rab tu skyes so //
translated: Such is the immeasurable glory that arises, the worship and the marvelous Dharma.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor rig go /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor rig go /
translated: He has realized omniscient wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bshad pa ched du brjod pa ched du brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bshad pa ched du brjod pa ched du brjod do //
translated: He has proclaimed the proclamations of all buddhas.

original: skye bo'i 'khor ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: skye bo'i 'khor ba ma lus pa //
translated: He has sought out the entire retinue of beings

original: dug med rnam par dug med tshol //
analyzed: dug med rnam par dug med tshol //
translated: without poison, without poison.

original: khyim med pa ni tshol ba na //
analyzed: khyim med pa ni tshol ba na //
translated: He has sought out the homeless

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal yang yang dang // khyim med pa ni mthong bar gyur //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal yang yang dang // khyim med pa ni mthong bar gyur //
translated: and seen the suffering of birth again and again.

original: slar yang khyim ni byed pa med //
analyzed: slar yang khyim ni byed pa med //
translated: He will not make a home again.

original: de yi sdug bsngal thams cad bcom //
analyzed: de yi sdug bsngal thams cad bcom //
translated: He has destroyed all suffering.

original: dug gi ming can khyim gyis phung //
analyzed: dug gi ming can khyim gyis phung //
translated: The home called poison has been destroyed.

original: sems ni 'du byed pa las grol //
analyzed: sems ni 'du byed pa las grol //
translated: The mind is liberated from formations.

original: sred pa zad nas med par gyur //
analyzed: sred pa zad nas med par gyur //
translated: Having exhausted craving, he has become nonexistent.

original: ces pa 'di ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du gnas pa nas bzung ste ji srid byang chub snying po 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa de rnams kyi gnas ni gleng gzhi bar ma zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces pa 'di ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du gnas pa nas bzung ste ji srid byang chub snying po 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa de rnams kyi gnas ni gleng gzhi bar ma zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the middle nidāna, from the time of abiding in the Tuṣita palace up to the time of attaining omniscience here in the Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: gzhan yang / nye ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nye ba'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: Furthermore, the proximate nidāna is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod rgyal byed tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba'i gnas su bzhugs pa dang / yangs pa can gyi nags tshal chen po khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas su bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod rgyal byed tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba'i gnas su bzhugs pa dang / yangs pa can gyi nags tshal chen po khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas su bzhugs so //
translated: and in the great forest of Vaiśālī, in the Kūṭāgāraśālā.

original: de ltar de dang de'i gnas rnams su bzhugs shing de dang de'i gnas nyid thob ces brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar de dang de'i gnas rnams su bzhugs shing de dang de'i gnas nyid thob ces brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that he dwelt in those places and attained those very places.

original: gang @366b ci yang 'di ltar brjod pa de nas yang de dang po nas bzung nas 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang @366b ci yang 'di ltar brjod pa de nas yang de dang po nas bzung nas 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is said in this way, from that very beginning, it should be understood in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs nas ched du brjod cing ched du brjod pa de lta bu'i sems skyes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs nas ched du brjod cing ched du brjod pa de lta bu'i sems skyes so //
translated: The Blessed One, having dwelt there, uttered a spontaneous utterance, and such a thought arose:🔽For the sake of this very cross-legged posture, for four incalculable eons and one hundred thousand eons more, from the time I began, I cut off and gave away my head ornaments, my well-adorned head,

original: bdag gis bskal pa grangs med pa bzhi dang / 'bum phrag gcig lhag pa nas skyil krung bcas pa 'di'i ched du dus 'di rnams la bdag gi mgo rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i mgrin pa nas bregs te sbyin par btang ba dang / spyan bzang po btang ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gis bskal pa grangs med pa bzhi dang / 'bum phrag gcig lhag pa nas skyil krung bcas pa 'di'i ched du dus 'di rnams la bdag gi mgo rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i mgrin pa nas bregs te sbyin par btang ba dang / spyan bzang po btang ba dang /
translated: and my excellent eyes.

original: snying gi sha bregs nas btang ba dang / gzhon nu dra ba 'dzin dang 'dra ba'i bu sbyin par btang ba dang / krishna dzi na'i gzhon nu ma dang mtshungs pa'i bu mo sbyin par btang ba dang / lha mo ma tri dang mtshungs pa'i chung ma rnams gzhan gyi bran gyi phyir sbyin par btang ngo //
analyzed: snying gi sha bregs nas btang ba dang / gzhon nu dra ba 'dzin dang 'dra ba'i bu sbyin par btang ba dang / krishna dzi na'i gzhon nu ma dang mtshungs pa'i bu mo sbyin par btang ba dang / lha mo ma tri dang mtshungs pa'i chung ma rnams gzhan gyi bran gyi phyir sbyin par btang ngo //
translated: and his wife, who was like the goddess Mātrī, as slaves to others.

original: 'di ni bdag gi 'dug stangs yin no //🔽rgyal ba'i 'dug stangs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi 'dug stangs yin no // rgyal ba'i 'dug stangs yin no //
translated: “This is my sitting posture.”🔽“This is the Victor’s sitting posture.”

original: mchog gi 'dug stangs yin no //
analyzed: mchog gi 'dug stangs yin no //
translated: “This is the supreme sitting posture.”

original: 'di la bdag bzhugs nas bsams pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'di la bdag bzhugs nas bsams pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: “Having sat here, I have fulfilled all my thoughts.”

original: re zhig stan 'di las bdag mi ldang ngo snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: re zhig stan 'di las bdag mi ldang ngo snyam du bsams nas /
translated: “For now, I will not rise from this seat.”

original: bye ba 'bum phrag du ma la snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par gnas te zhag bdun du de nyid du bzhugs so //
analyzed: bye ba 'bum phrag du ma la snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par gnas te zhag bdun du de nyid du bzhugs so //
translated: He entered into concentration on many hundreds of thousands of millions, remained in equipoise, and stayed there for seven days.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes brjod do; ;de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bdun du 'dug stangs gcig gis bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes brjod do; ;de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhag bdun du 'dug stangs gcig gis bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One remained seated in one position for seven days,

original: rnam par grol ba dang / bde ba so sor rig cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang / bde ba so sor rig cing bzhugs so //
translated: experiencing the bliss of liberation.

original: gzhan yang / lha gang dang @367a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / lha gang dang @367a *//
translated: Moreover, the gods

original: gang zhig da dung yang nges par don grub la bya ba yod dam /
analyzed: gang zhig da dung yang nges par don grub la bya ba yod dam /
translated: thought, “Is there still something to be done for the one who has accomplished his purpose?🔽Has he not abandoned attachment to this posture and given rise to conceptual thoughts?”

original: 'dug stangs 'di la zhen pa ma spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yongs su bskyed do zhes bsams nas ston pas lha rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mkhyen nas de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dug stangs 'di la zhen pa ma spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yongs su bskyed do zhes bsams nas ston pas lha rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa mkhyen nas de rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The Teacher, knowing the gods’ thoughts, in order to pacify their conceptual thoughts,

original: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug nas so sor cho 'phrul bstan no //
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug nas so sor cho 'phrul bstan no //
translated: rose up into the sky above and displayed his magical powers.

original: byang chub kyi snying por mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul dang / nye du dang 'dus pa'i dus su mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul dang / klog pa'i mdo dang 'dus par mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul thams cad aa smra srun pa dang / aa mra'i shing gi drung du mdzad pa'i so so'i cho 'phrul dang mtshungs par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying por mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul dang / nye du dang 'dus pa'i dus su mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul dang / klog pa'i mdo dang 'dus par mdzad pa'i cho 'phrul thams cad aa smra srun pa dang / aa mra'i shing gi drung du mdzad pa'i so so'i cho 'phrul dang mtshungs par gyur to //
translated: The miracles performed at the site of enlightenment, the miracles performed at the time of the assembly of relatives, and the miracles performed at the time of the assembly of the Sūtra of the Wise and the Foolish, all these were like the individual miracles performed at the foot of the mango tree.

original: 'di ltar ston pas 'di lta bu'i cho 'phrul mdzad nas lha rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ston pas 'di lta bu'i cho 'phrul mdzad nas lha rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the Teacher, having performed such miracles, pacified the conceptions of the gods.

original: 'dug stangs kyis byang shar gyi char 'khod de /
analyzed: 'dug stangs kyis byang shar gyi char 'khod de /
translated: By the sitting posture, they sat in the northeast.

original: 'di'i 'dug stangs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i 'dug stangs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: By this sitting posture, they discern the wisdom of omniscience.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa bzhi dang / 'bum phrag gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu lhag par rdzogs pa'i 'dug stangs kyis mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing zhag bdun du 'khod do //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa bzhi dang / 'bum phrag gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu lhag par rdzogs pa'i 'dug stangs kyis mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing zhag bdun du 'khod do //
translated: For four incalculable aeons and one hundred thousand aeons, he completed the perfections and attained the result. He sat in the posture of perfect completion and gazed without blinking for seven days.

original: de'i gnas su mig mi 'dzum pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i gnas su mig mi 'dzum pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba byung ngo //
translated: In that place, the stupa called Blinking Eyes appeared.

original: de nas 'dug stangs la 'khod pa'i gnas kyi bar du 'chag par byas @367b nas shar dang / nub tu rin po che la 'chag cing 'chag pas zhag bdun du 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas 'dug stangs la 'khod pa'i gnas kyi bar du 'chag par byas @367b nas shar dang / nub tu rin po che la 'chag cing 'chag pas zhag bdun du 'khod do //
translated: Then, he walked from the place of sitting in the posture to the east and west, walking on jewels for seven days.

original: gnas der rin po che la 'chag pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba byung ngo /
analyzed: gnas der rin po che la 'chag pa'i mchod rten zhes bya ba byung ngo /
translated: In that place, the stupa called Walking on Jewels appeared.

original: gzhan yang / zhag bdun pa bzhi pa la byang chub shing gi byang shar gyi char lha rnams kyis rin po che'i khang pa sprul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zhag bdun pa bzhi pa la byang chub shing gi byang shar gyi char lha rnams kyis rin po che'i khang pa sprul lo //
translated: On the fourth seventh day, the gods emanated a jeweled house in the northeast of the Bodhi tree.

original: der 'dug stangs kyis bzhugs nas chos mngon pa'i sde snod ma lus par 'di rnams mtha' yas pa'i tshul gyis kun gnas par sems shing zhag bdun bzhugs so //
analyzed: der 'dug stangs kyis bzhugs nas chos mngon pa'i sde snod ma lus par 'di rnams mtha' yas pa'i tshul gyis kun gnas par sems shing zhag bdun bzhugs so //
translated: He sat there in the cross-legged posture and for seven days he contemplated the entire Abhidharma Piṭaka, thinking, “All of this is established in the manner of infinity.”

original: chos mngon pa pa slar yang 'di skad smra'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa slar yang 'di skad smra'o //
translated: The Abhidharmikas say this:

original: rin po che'i khang pa zhes bya ba rin po che las byung ba'i khang pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i khang pa zhes bya ba rin po che las byung ba'i khang pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The “jewel house” is a house made of jewels.

original: sdud par byed pa po rnams slar yang 'di skad gsung ste /
analyzed: sdud par byed pa po rnams slar yang 'di skad gsung ste /
translated: The compilers say this:🔽The “jewel house” is the recollection of the Abhidharma in the seven chapters.

original: rab tu byed pa bdun gyi chos mngon par rjes su dran par byed pa'i rin po che'i khang pa yin zhes gsung ngo; ;gang gi phyir slar yang 'dir tshig gnyis ka yang 'thad do //
