analyzed: dus dang / dus ma min par bcom ldan 'das dang nye bar 'ong bar 'dod do //
translated: I wish to come to the Bhagavan at the right and wrong times.

original: shing dngar can gyi skyed mos tshal shin tu thag ring ngo //
analyzed: shing dngar can gyi skyed mos tshal shin tu thag ring ngo //
translated: The Bamboo Grove is too far away.

original: slar yang bdag cag @376a *//
analyzed: slar yang bdag cag @376a *//
translated: We also have a place called the Veṇuvana, which is very close.

original: gi 'od ma'i tshal zhes bya ba 'di shin tu nye bas gshegs pa dang / 'ong ba shin tu nye bas sangs rgyas la 'os pa'i gnas lags pas /
analyzed: gi 'od ma'i tshal zhes bya ba 'di shin tu nye bas gshegs pa dang / 'ong ba shin tu nye bas sangs rgyas la 'os pa'i gnas lags pas /
translated: Since it is very close to coming and going, and is a place suitable for the Buddha,

original: bzhes par zhu /
analyzed: bzhes par zhu /
translated: please accept it.

original: der gser gyi ril ba spyi blugs la me tog gi dris bsgos te /
analyzed: der gser gyi ril ba spyi blugs la me tog gi dris bsgos te /
translated: There, having perfumed a golden water pot with the scent of flowers,

original: nor bu'i kha dog can gyi chu blangs nas 'od ma'i tshal yongs su gtong zhing stobs bcu pa'i phyag tu chu bsgrengs nas der kun dga' ra pa bzhes nas sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i gzhi zhes brjod cing sa gzhi chen po g-yos so //
analyzed: nor bu'i kha dog can gyi chu blangs nas 'od ma'i tshal yongs su gtong zhing stobs bcu pa'i phyag tu chu bsgrengs nas der kun dga' ra pa bzhes nas sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i gzhi zhes brjod cing sa gzhi chen po g-yos so //
translated: He took water of the color of a jewel, sprinkled the Bamboo Grove, and held up the water to the hands of the one with ten powers. He accepted the feast there and said, “The basis of the Buddha’s teaching.” The great earth shook.

original: 'dzam bu gling gi nang nas 'od ma'i tshal spangs pa'i sa gzhi g-yos pa 'di bzhes te /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling gi nang nas 'od ma'i tshal spangs pa'i sa gzhi g-yos pa 'di bzhes te /
translated: “This shaking of the earth is accepted as the shaking of the earth that abandoned the Bamboo Grove in Jambudvīpa.

original: sde gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: sde gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other school.

original: sing gha gling gi gtsug lag khang chen po spangs nas sa gzhi g-yos pa 'di bzhes te /
analyzed: sing gha gling gi gtsug lag khang chen po spangs nas sa gzhi g-yos pa 'di bzhes te /
translated: “This shaking of the earth is accepted as the shaking of the earth that abandoned the great monastery in Siṅghala.

original: sde gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: sde gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other school.

original: ston pas 'od ma'i tshal gyi kun dga' ra ba bzhes nas rgyal po la rjes su yi rang bar mdzad cing stan la bzhengs te /
analyzed: ston pas 'od ma'i tshal gyi kun dga' ra ba bzhes nas rgyal po la rjes su yi rang bar mdzad cing stan la bzhengs te /
translated: The Teacher accepted the Bamboo Grove park and rejoiced in the king. He rose from his seat,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du byas nas 'od ma'i tshal du byon no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du byas nas 'od ma'i tshal du byon no //
translated: and having made the saṅgha of monks his retinue, he went to the Bamboo Grove.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na sh'a ri'i bu dang / moo dgal gyi bu kun tu rgyu gnyis po rgyal po'i khab la brten nas gnas shing /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na sh'a ri'i bu dang / moo dgal gyi bu kun tu rgyu gnyis po rgyal po'i khab la brten nas gnas shing /
translated: At that time, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana were wandering about, living near Rājagṛha.

original: bdud rtsi tshol bar sems so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi tshol bar sems so //
translated: They were thinking about how to find nectar.

original: de'i nang nas sh'a ri'i bus gnas brtan rta thul bsod snyoms la zhugs pa mthong bas sems rab tu dvangs par gyur te bza' ba byin nas /
analyzed: de'i nang nas sh'a ri'i bus gnas brtan rta thul bsod snyoms la zhugs pa mthong bas sems rab tu dvangs par gyur te bza' ba byin nas /
translated: Among them, Śāriputra saw the elder Aśvajit going for alms. His mind was refreshed, and he gave him food.

original: chos rnams gang dag rgyu las byung ba dang / zhes pa'i tshigs bcad @376b thos pas /
analyzed: chos rnams gang dag rgyu las byung ba dang / zhes pa'i tshigs bcad @376b thos pas /
translated: He heard the verse, “Those things that arise from a cause…”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur ro //
translated: and attained the fruit of stream entry.

original: rang gi grogs po kun tu rgyu moo dgal la yang tshigs su bcad pa de nyid smras so //
analyzed: rang gi grogs po kun tu rgyu moo dgal la yang tshigs su bcad pa de nyid smras so //
translated: He also spoke that very verse to his friend, the wanderer Maudgalyāyana.

original: des kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo; ;de gnyis kyis kyang rang nyid rgyal ba la bltas nas rang gi 'khor dang bcas pa ston pa'i drung du rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: des kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo; ;de gnyis kyis kyang rang nyid rgyal ba la bltas nas rang gi 'khor dang bcas pa ston pa'i drung du rab tu byung ngo //
translated: He too attained the fruit of stream entry. The two of them, looking to the Victor, went forth in the presence of the Teacher, together with their retinues.

original: de rnams las moo dgal gyi bu chen po zhag bdun nas dgra bcom pa thob bo //
analyzed: de rnams las moo dgal gyi bu chen po zhag bdun nas dgra bcom pa thob bo //
translated: Among them, the elder son of Maudgalyāyana attained arhatship after seven days.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zla ba phyed nas dgra bcom pa thob ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zla ba phyed nas dgra bcom pa thob ste /
translated: The elder Śāriputra attained arhatship after a fortnight.

original: de gnyis po yang ston pa'i nyan thos kyi mchog tu gnas par bzung ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis po yang ston pa'i nyan thos kyi mchog tu gnas par bzung ngo //
translated: Both of them were considered to be the foremost disciples of the Teacher.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dgra bcom pa thob pa'i nyin mo nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi 'dus pa dang por byas so //
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dgra bcom pa thob pa'i nyin mo nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi 'dus pa dang por byas so //
translated: On the very day that the elder Śāriputra attained arhatship, the Blessed One held his first assembly of disciples.

original: slar yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'od ma'i tshal de nyid du bzhugs so //
analyzed: slar yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'od ma'i tshal de nyid du bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Tathāgata again resided in the Veṇuvana.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gis bdag gi sras lo drug tu dka' ba spyad nas mchog gi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po zas gtsang gis bdag gi sras lo drug tu dka' ba spyad nas mchog gi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: At that time, the great king Śuddhodana heard that his son, after practicing austerities for six years, had attained supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas rgyal po'i khab kyi 'od ma'i tshal du bzhugs so zhes pa thos nas blon po phan tshun rnams bos te 'dir shog cig /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas rgyal po'i khab kyi 'od ma'i tshal du bzhugs so zhes pa thos nas blon po phan tshun rnams bos te 'dir shog cig /
translated: turned the wheel of the Dharma, and was residing in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha. He summoned his ministers and said, Come here!

original: skyes bu stong phrag gcig gi 'khor khrid de /
analyzed: skyes bu stong phrag gcig gi 'khor khrid de /
translated: He took with him a retinue of one thousand people.

original: de rgyal po'i khab du song la nga'i tshig gis khyed kyi yab rgyal po chen po zas gtsang khyed blta bar 'dod ces brjod pas bdag gi sras khrid la shog ces smras so //
analyzed: de rgyal po'i khab du song la nga'i tshig gis khyed kyi yab rgyal po chen po zas gtsang khyed blta bar 'dod ces brjod pas bdag gi sras khrid la shog ces smras so //
translated: He went to the capital city and said to the king, “Your father, the great king Śuddhodana, wishes to see you. Please come with your son.”

original: bron pos kyang /
analyzed: bron pos kyang /
translated: The messenger said,

original: lha; de bzhin bgyi'o zhes rgyal po'i @377a *//
analyzed: lha; de bzhin bgyi'o zhes rgyal po'i @377a *//
translated: “Your Majesty, I will do as you command.”

original: gsung spyi bos blangs nas /
analyzed: gsung spyi bos blangs nas /
translated: He took the king’s command to heart.

original: skyes bu stong phrag gcig gi 'khor de khrid de myur ba nyid du dpag tshad drug cu'i lam du song nas stobs bcu pa 'khor bzhi'i nang du bzhugs nas chos ston pa'i dus su gtsug lag khang du bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyes bu stong phrag gcig gi 'khor de khrid de myur ba nyid du dpag tshad drug cu'i lam du song nas stobs bcu pa 'khor bzhi'i nang du bzhugs nas chos ston pa'i dus su gtsug lag khang du bzhugs so //
translated: He took with him a retinue of one thousand people and quickly traveled sixty leagues. When the one with the ten powers was sitting in the midst of the fourfold retinue and teaching the Dharma, he was staying in the temple.

original: de rgyal pos btang ba'i don re zhig bzhag nas 'khor thams cad kyi mthar 'khod de ston pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas ji ltar 'khod pa nyid bzhin du skyes bu stong phrag gcig dang lhan cig tu dgra bcom pa thob nas rab tu 'byung bar zhus so
analyzed: de rgyal pos btang ba'i don re zhig bzhag nas 'khor thams cad kyi mthar 'khod de ston pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas ji ltar 'khod pa nyid bzhin du skyes bu stong phrag gcig dang lhan cig tu dgra bcom pa thob nas rab tu 'byung bar zhus so
translated: The king put aside the matter of his dispatch for the time being, and when the entire retinue was seated, he listened to the Teacher's Dharma teaching. Then, just as they were seated, he attained arhatship together with one thousand other men and requested ordination.

original: // bcom ldan 'das kyis btsun par? rnams 'dir shog ces phyag brkyang ngo //
analyzed: // bcom ldan 'das kyis btsun par? rnams 'dir shog ces phyag brkyang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One extended his hand, saying, Come, monks!

original: thams cad de nyid du rdzu 'phrul las byung ba'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos gsum bzung nas /
analyzed: thams cad de nyid du rdzu 'phrul las byung ba'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos gsum bzung nas /
translated: All of them took up the begging bowls and three Dharma robes that had arisen through their miraculous powers,🔽and they became like elder monks who had reached the age of a hundred.

original: lo brgya lon ba'i gnas brtan lta bur gyur to; ;dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lo brgya lon ba'i gnas brtan lta bur gyur to; ;dgra bcom pa thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: From the time they attained arhatship,

original: slar yang 'phags pa zhes bya ba re zhig par mar gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang 'phags pa zhes bya ba re zhig par mar gnas par gyur te /
translated: they became known as the noble ones and remained for a while.

original: rgyal pos btang ba'i spring yig stobs bcu pa lam brjod do; ;rgyal pos btang ba'i mi rnams las gcig kyang ma byung zhing spring yig kyang ma thos so //
analyzed: rgyal pos btang ba'i spring yig stobs bcu pa lam brjod do; ;rgyal pos btang ba'i mi rnams las gcig kyang ma byung zhing spring yig kyang ma thos so //
translated: Not a single man sent by the king returned, nor was a letter received.🔽Come here! Go there! With such certainty, another minister was sent.

original: 'dir shog la khyed song cig dang / de lta bu'i nges pas blon po gzhan gcig btang ngo; ;des song nas yang sngar bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa thob nas cang mi gsung bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir shog la khyed song cig dang / de lta bu'i nges pas blon po gzhan gcig btang ngo; ;des song nas yang sngar bzhin du 'khor dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa thob nas cang mi gsung bar gnas so //
translated: Having gone, as before, together with his retinue, he attained arhatship and remained silent.

original: rgyal pos de lta bur nges pas skyes bu stong phrag re re'i 'khor @377b dang bcas pa'i blon po dgu btang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal pos de lta bur nges pas skyes bu stong phrag re re'i 'khor @377b dang bcas pa'i blon po dgu btang ngo //
translated: The king, with such certainty, sent nine ministers, each with a retinue of a thousand men.

original: thams cad rang gi don rdzogs par byas nas cang mi smra bar gyur te de nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi don rdzogs par byas nas cang mi smra bar gyur te de nyid du gnas so //
translated: All of them, having accomplished their own goals, became silent and remained there.

original: rgyal pos spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus kyang ma thob bo zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: rgyal pos spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus kyang ma thob bo zhes bsams nas /
translated: The king thought, I have not even received a report about the mere letter.

original: mi 'di rnams nga la mi dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: mi 'di rnams nga la mi dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus kyang mi brjod do //
translated: Because of their dislike for me, they do not even mention the story of the letter.

original: su zhig nga'i tshig bzhin byed par sems /
analyzed: su zhig nga'i tshig bzhin byed par sems /
translated: Who would think that anyone would do what I say?

original: rgyal pos mi thams cad la brtags pas nag po 'char ka mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyal pos mi thams cad la brtags pas nag po 'char ka mthong ngo //
translated: The king examined all the people and saw that it was Kṛṣṇa Ālavana.

original: de yang rgyal po'i don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i blon po yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyal po'i don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i blon po yin no //
translated: He was the minister who accomplished all the king's goals.

original: nang mi yin no //
analyzed: nang mi yin no //
translated: He was a family member.

original: shin tu thugs ches pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu thugs ches pa yin no //
translated: He was a very trusted person.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig la nyin gcig tu skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig la nyin gcig tu skyes pa yin no //
translated: He was born on the same day as the Tathāgata.

original: de dang lhan cig tu rtse ba'i grogs po yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu rtse ba'i grogs po yin no //
translated: He was a friend who played with him.

original: de nas blon po rgyal pos pos te /
analyzed: de nas blon po rgyal pos pos te /
translated: Then the king summoned the minister.

original: bu nag po 'char ka /
analyzed: bu nag po 'char ka /
translated: Son Kṛṣṇa Ālavana,

original: bdag gi sras blta bar 'dod pas skyes bu stong phrag dgu btang ste mi gcig kyang ma 'ongs nas spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus ci yang ma byung /
analyzed: bdag gi sras blta bar 'dod pas skyes bu stong phrag dgu btang ste mi gcig kyang ma 'ongs nas spring yig tsam gyi lo rgyus ci yang ma byung /
translated: I want to see my son. I sent nine thousand men, but not a single one returned. I did not receive even a story about the letter.🔽 Did they all get sick?

original: slar yang thams cad nad kyis thebs pa yin nam /
analyzed: slar yang thams cad nad kyis thebs pa yin nam /
translated: 🔽Your Majesty, they did not get sick.

original: tshe'i bar chad du gyur pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe'i bar chad du gyur pa yin nam /
translated: Is it an obstacle to my life?

original: bdag 'tsho ba nyid kyi bar du sras po blta bar 'dod de /
analyzed: bdag 'tsho ba nyid kyi bar du sras po blta bar 'dod de /
translated: I want to see my son as long as I live.

original: bdag gi bu blta bar nus sam zhes smras so //
analyzed: bdag gi bu blta bar nus sam zhes smras so //
translated: Can I see my son?”

original: lha / nus lags so //
analyzed: lha / nus lags so //
translated: “ Your Majesty, I can.

original: gal te rab tu phyung yang blta bar nus so //
analyzed: gal te rab tu phyung yang blta bar nus so //
translated: If he has gone forth, I can see him.🔽If he has not gone forth, I can see him.”

original: bu khyod rab tu byung ba'am /
analyzed: bu khyod rab tu byung ba'am /
translated: “ Son, whether you have gone forth

original: ma byung yang /
analyzed: ma byung yang /
translated: or not,

original: nga sras po blta'o zhes smras so //🔽des lha legs so //
analyzed: nga sras po blta'o zhes smras so // des lha legs so //
translated: I want to see my son.”

original: zhes rgyal po'i gsung blangs nas rgyal po'i khab tu song ste /
analyzed: zhes rgyal po'i gsung blangs nas rgyal po'i khab tu song ste /
translated: “ Your Majesty, very well,” he said, and he went to Rājagṛha.

original: ston pa chos ston pa'i dus su 'khor rnams kyi @378a *//
analyzed: ston pa chos ston pa'i dus su 'khor rnams kyi @378a *//
translated: When the Teacher was teaching the Dharma,

original: mthar 'khod de /
analyzed: mthar 'khod de /
translated: he sat at the end of the assembly.

original: chos thos nas 'khor dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te dge slong gi dngos por so sor gnas so //
analyzed: chos thos nas 'khor dang bcas pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te dge slong gi dngos por so sor gnas so //
translated: After he heard the Dharma, he and his retinue attained the fruit of an arhat and remained as individual monks.

original: ston pa sangs rgyas su gyur nas dang po'i lo la drang srong lhung ba'i gnas su dbyar bzhugs te /
analyzed: ston pa sangs rgyas su gyur nas dang po'i lo la drang srong lhung ba'i gnas su dbyar bzhugs te /
translated: After the Teacher became a Buddha, in the first year he stayed for the rainy season at the place of the fallen sage.

original: dgag dbye byas nas lteng rgyas su gshegs shing der zla ba gsum bzhugs te /
analyzed: dgag dbye byas nas lteng rgyas su gshegs shing der zla ba gsum bzhugs te /
translated: After the lifting of the ban, he went to Rājagṛha and stayed there for three months.

original: ral pa can spun rnams brtul nas dge slong stong phrag gcig gi 'khor dang bcas pa dgun bla 'bring po'i nya la rgyal po'i khab du gshegs nas zla ba gnyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: ral pa can spun rnams brtul nas dge slong stong phrag gcig gi 'khor dang bcas pa dgun bla 'bring po'i nya la rgyal po'i khab du gshegs nas zla ba gnyis bzhugs so //
translated: After subduing the matted-hair ascetics, he went to Rājagṛha with a retinue of one thousand monks on the full moon of the middle winter month and stayed there for two months.

original: de rnams ni grong khyer w'a ra n'a si nas 'ongs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: de rnams ni grong khyer w'a ra n'a si nas 'ongs pa'i bar te /
translated: This is the period from when they came to the city of Vārāṇasī.

original: zla ba lnga song zhing dgun gyi dus thams cad 'das so //
analyzed: zla ba lnga song zhing dgun gyi dus thams cad 'das so //
translated: Five months have passed and all of winter has passed.

original: gnas brtan 'char ka 'ongs nas zhag bdun dang brgyad song ngo //
analyzed: gnas brtan 'char ka 'ongs nas zhag bdun dang brgyad song ngo //
translated: The elder Udayi came and seven or eight days have passed.

original: des dbyid zlar ba'i nya la bsams pa /
analyzed: des dbyid zlar ba'i nya la bsams pa /
translated: He thought on the full moon of the first spring month:

original: dgun gyi dus 'das nas dpyid ka'i dus su sleb pa dang / mi rnams kyis 'bru rnams blangs te /
analyzed: dgun gyi dus 'das nas dpyid ka'i dus su sleb pa dang / mi rnams kyis 'bru rnams blangs te /
translated: “Winter has passed and spring has arrived, and people have taken their grain

original: phyogs phyogs nas ldam? du byung bas rtsva rnams ljang gur gyur to //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs nas ldam? du byung bas rtsva rnams ljang gur gyur to //
translated: and have come from all directions, so the grass has turned green.”

original: sa gzhi dang / nags tshal gyi shing la sogs pa me tog shin tu mang ba kha bye ba ni lam du 'gro ba'i dus so //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang / nags tshal gyi shing la sogs pa me tog shin tu mang ba kha bye ba ni lam du 'gro ba'i dus so //
translated: The earth, the trees of the forest, and so on, are in full bloom. It is the time to go on the road.

original: stobs bcu ba'i nye du dang phrad par byed pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i dus yin no //
analyzed: stobs bcu ba'i nye du dang phrad par byed pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i dus yin no //
translated: It is the time to go on the road to meet the kinsman of the ten powers.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar song nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar song nas /
translated: Then, having approached the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa ljon shing de ni ljang gur gyur //
analyzed: btsun pa ljon shing de ni ljang gur gyur //
translated: the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, that tree is green.🔽The leaves of the tree are blue,

original: shing gi lo mas la dud pa dang // de rnams bar nas 'od zer 'gyed pa yin //
analyzed: shing gi lo mas la dud pa dang // de rnams bar nas 'od zer 'gyed pa yin //
translated: and from them light rays radiate.

original: dpa' bo chen po @378b gnyen gnas gshegs pa'i dus //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po @378b gnyen gnas gshegs pa'i dus //
translated: It is the time for the Great Hero to go to the abode of kinsmen.

original: ha cang mi dro mi brang? zhing /
analyzed: ha cang mi dro mi brang? zhing /
translated: It is not too hot, not too cold,

original: mu ge dang ni bkres pa med //
analyzed: mu ge dang ni bkres pa med //
translated: and there is no famine or hunger.

original: sa steng shing rnams ljang gur gyur //
analyzed: sa steng shing rnams ljang gur gyur //
translated: The trees on the earth are green.

original: thub ba chen po dus 'dir gyur //
analyzed: thub ba chen po dus 'dir gyur //
translated: This is the time for the Great Sage.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug cu tsam gyis stobs bcu pa la rigs kyi grong khyer du gshegs pa'i phyir bsngags par 'os ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug cu tsam gyis stobs bcu pa la rigs kyi grong khyer du gshegs pa'i phyir bsngags par 'os ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
translated: With about sixty verses, he praises the praiseworthy one, the one with ten powers, for going to the city of the Śākyas.

original: de nas ston pa la 'char kas dbyings snyan pos gshegs pa'i bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas ston pa la 'char kas dbyings snyan pos gshegs pa'i bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsungs so //
translated: Then Udayana praised the Teacher with sweet words.

original: btsun pa / khyod kyi yab rgyal po chen po zas gtsang blta bar 'dod pas nye du rnams rjes su 'dzin par zhu /
analyzed: btsun pa / khyod kyi yab rgyal po chen po zas gtsang blta bar 'dod pas nye du rnams rjes su 'dzin par zhu /
translated: “ Reverend, I wish to see your father, the great king Shuddhodana. Please take care of your relatives.”

original: legs so // 'char ka /
analyzed: legs so // 'char ka /
translated: “ Very well, Udayana.

original: nye du rnams rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o zhes dge slong gi dge 'dun la smros cig /
analyzed: nye du rnams rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o zhes dge slong gi dge 'dun la smros cig /
translated: Please tell the community of monks, ‘I will take care of my relatives.’

original: gshegs pa'i gnas thams cad la byi dor gyis shig ces smros shig /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i gnas thams cad la byi dor gyis shig ces smros shig /
translated: And please tell them, ‘Clean all the places where the Blessed One will go.’”

original: btsun pa / legs so zhes gnas brtan song nas smras //
analyzed: btsun pa / legs so zhes gnas brtan song nas smras //
translated: “ Very well, Reverend,” said the elder and went to tell them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yul aa gha dang / ma ga dha na gnas ba'i rigs kyi bu rnams stong phrag bcu dang bcas pa grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i stong phrag bcu po thams cad zag pa zad pa'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas rgyal po'i khab nas phyi rol tu 'thon te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yul aa gha dang / ma ga dha na gnas ba'i rigs kyi bu rnams stong phrag bcu dang bcas pa grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i stong phrag bcu po thams cad zag pa zad pa'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas rgyal po'i khab nas phyi rol tu 'thon te /
translated: The Blessed One, together with ten thousand sons of noble families from the land of Aḍa and Magadha, and all ten thousand from the city of Kapilavastu, who were monks with exhausted defilements, left Rājagṛha.

original: nyi ma re re la dpag tshad re re bgrod cing /
analyzed: nyi ma re re la dpag tshad re re bgrod cing /
translated: He thought, “Every day I will travel one yojana.

original: rgyal po'i khab nas dpag tshad drug cu'i grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir zla ba gnyis kyis sleb par dgongs shing bu nye? ba yang ma yin /🔽myur ba yang ma yin par 'bring por gshegs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab nas dpag tshad drug cu'i grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir zla ba gnyis kyis sleb par dgongs shing bu nye? ba yang ma yin / myur ba yang ma yin par 'bring por gshegs so //
translated: In two months I will arrive at the city of Kapila, sixty yojanas from Rajagriha.”

original: gnas brtan gyis kyang @379a *//
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis kyang @379a *//
translated: He went at a pace that was neither too fast nor too slow.🔽The elder thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das byon no zhes /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byon no zhes /
translated: “The Bhagavat has come.”

original: rgyal po'i drung du smra'o zhes bsams nas nam mkha' la song ste rgyal po'i gnas su sleb par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po'i drung du smra'o zhes bsams nas nam mkha' la song ste rgyal po'i gnas su sleb par gyur to //
translated: He went through the air and arrived at the king’s palace.

original: rgyal por gnas brtan gzigs nas thugs tshim par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal por gnas brtan gzigs nas thugs tshim par gyur te /
translated: The king was satisfied to see the elder.

original: gdan bshams pa la bzhugs su bcug go /
analyzed: gdan bshams pa la bzhugs su bcug go /
translated: He had him sit on a seat that was prepared and🔽filled his alms bowl with various kinds of food, as if he were serving himself.

original: rang la byed pa bzhin bcos nor sna tshogs pa'i bza' bas lhung bzed bkang nas phul lo; ;gnas brtan langs nas 'gro bar bsams ba dang / bu /
analyzed: rang la byed pa bzhin bcos nor sna tshogs pa'i bza' bas lhung bzed bkang nas phul lo; ;gnas brtan langs nas 'gro bar bsams ba dang / bu /
translated: When the elder stood up to leave, the king said, “Son,

original: bzhugs la gsol cig /
analyzed: bzhugs la gsol cig /
translated: please stay and eat.”

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great king,

original: ston pa dang nye bar song ste bza'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang nye bar song ste bza'o //
translated: I will eat after I have approached the Teacher.”

original: slar yang / bu /
analyzed: slar yang / bu /
translated: “Son,

original: ston pa ga na yod /
analyzed: ston pa ga na yod /
translated: where is the Teacher?”

original: stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas rgyal po chen po nyid blta ba'i phyir byon no //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas rgyal po chen po nyid blta ba'i phyir byon no //
translated: “He is in the city of Rājagṛha, surrounded by an assembly of twenty thousand monks.”

original: rgyal po thugs tshim par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po thugs tshim par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: The king was satisfied and said,

original: khyed 'di gsol la bdag gi sras grong khyer 'dir ma byon gyi bar la 'di nyid nas lhung bzed du bza' ba khyer la song zhig ces smras so //
analyzed: khyed 'di gsol la bdag gi sras grong khyer 'dir ma byon gyi bar la 'di nyid nas lhung bzed du bza' ba khyer la song zhig ces smras so //
translated: “You may eat this, but until my son returns to this city, take your alms bowl and go.”

original: gnas brtan gyi rgyal po'i gsung mnyan te rgyal pos gnas brtan gyis bza' ba gsol zin pa dang / lhung bzed bkrus nas /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyi rgyal po'i gsung mnyan te rgyal pos gnas brtan gyis bza' ba gsol zin pa dang / lhung bzed bkrus nas /
translated: The elder listened to the king’s words. When the king saw that the elder had finished eating, he washed the alms bowl,

original: dri bzang po'i phye mas byugs te bza' ba mchog gis gang bar byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phul cig zhes smras nas gnas brtan gyi lag par byin no //
analyzed: dri bzang po'i phye mas byugs te bza' ba mchog gis gang bar byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phul cig zhes smras nas gnas brtan gyi lag par byin no //
translated: rubbed it with fragrant powder, filled it with the best food, and said, “Offer this to the Tathāgata.” He gave it into the elder’s hand.

original: gnas brtan mi thams cad kyis mthong ba dang / lhung bzed nam mkha' @379b la 'phags so //
analyzed: gnas brtan mi thams cad kyis mthong ba dang / lhung bzed nam mkha' @379b la 'phags so //
translated: When all the people saw the elder, the alms bowl rose into the sky.

original: rang nyid kyang nam mkha' la gshegs nas bza' ba'i lhung bzed bzung ste /
analyzed: rang nyid kyang nam mkha' la gshegs nas bza' ba'i lhung bzed bzung ste /
translated: He himself would fly up into the sky, take the alms bowl,

original: ston pa'i phyag tu phul nas ston pas kyang der bza' ba la longs spyod do //
analyzed: ston pa'i phyag tu phul nas ston pas kyang der bza' ba la longs spyod do //
translated: and offer it to the Teacher. The Teacher would then partake of the food.

original: gnas brtan thabs 'dis nyi ma re re bzhin du bza' ba phul lo //
analyzed: gnas brtan thabs 'dis nyi ma re re bzhin du bza' ba phul lo //
translated: The elder would offer food in this way every day.

original: ston bas kyang lam gyi bar du rgyal po nyid kyis gdugs tshod la longs spyod do //
analyzed: ston bas kyang lam gyi bar du rgyal po nyid kyis gdugs tshod la longs spyod do //
translated: The Teacher would partake of the meal on the way, and the king himself would partake of the meal.

original: gnas brtan gyis kyang gdugs tshod la longs spyod pa'i mthar nyi ma re re bzhin du de ring 'di tsam nas bcom ldan 'das byon no //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis kyang gdugs tshod la longs spyod pa'i mthar nyi ma re re bzhin du de ring 'di tsam nas bcom ldan 'das byon no //
translated: The elder would partake of the meal and at the end of the meal every day he would say, “Today the Blessed One will arrive at this point,”

original: de ring 'di tsam du bcom ldan 'das byon zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang dag par ldan pa nyid brjod cing rgyal rigs thams cad ston pa ma mthong ba nyid kyis ston pa'i drung du rang nyid kyi sems dvangs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ring 'di tsam du bcom ldan 'das byon zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yang dag par ldan pa nyid brjod cing rgyal rigs thams cad ston pa ma mthong ba nyid kyis ston pa'i drung du rang nyid kyi sems dvangs par mdzad do //
translated: and he would also say, “Today the Blessed One has arrived at this point,” and he would also say, “The Blessed One has the qualities of a buddha,” and he would also say, “The king, who has not seen the Teacher, should go to the Teacher himself and clear his mind.”

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyis gnas brtan la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bdag gi nyan thos kyi nang nas rigs dad par byed pa rnams kyi mchog gang yin /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyis gnas brtan la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bdag gi nyan thos kyi nang nas rigs dad par byed pa rnams kyi mchog gang yin /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks, “Monks, who is the best of my disciples in making the faith of the Śākyas grow?

original: 'di ni 'char ka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'char ka zhes pa'o //
translated: It is this Udayi.”

original: 'di mchog tu bzung bas sh'akya pa rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su byon pa'i sdun la bdag cag gi nye du'i gtso bo blta'o zhes 'dus nas /
analyzed: 'di mchog tu bzung bas sh'akya pa rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su byon pa'i sdun la bdag cag gi nye du'i gtso bo blta'o zhes 'dus nas /
translated: Because he was considered the best, the Śākyas also gathered together and said, “First we will see the chief of our relatives who has come after the Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i gnas rtog cing sh'akya n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba? yid du 'ong ba sta gon byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i gnas rtog cing sh'akya n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba? yid du 'ong ba sta gon byas so //
translated: They prepared the delightful Nyagrodha Park of the Śākyas as a place for the Blessed One to stay.

original: der thams cad nyer bsdogs byas nas spos dang / me tog so so lag tu thogs te /
analyzed: der thams cad nyer bsdogs byas nas spos dang / me tog so so lag tu thogs te /
translated: There they all made preparations, holding incense and flowers in their hands.

original: bsu @380a *// ba byed cing rgyan thams cad kyis so sor brgyan nas /
analyzed: bsu @380a *// ba byed cing rgyan thams cad kyis so sor brgyan nas /
translated: They went to receive him, each adorned with all ornaments,

original: gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma /
analyzed: gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma /
translated: with young men and young women,🔽and with the Śākyas.

original: grong khyer gyi khye'u dang / bu mo sngar dang por btang ba rnams dang / de nas rgyal po'i gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma dag de rnams kyi bar rang rang gis spos dang / me tog dang / phye ma la sogs pas mchod ba byed cing /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi khye'u dang / bu mo sngar dang por btang ba rnams dang / de nas rgyal po'i gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma dag de rnams kyi bar rang rang gis spos dang / me tog dang / phye ma la sogs pas mchod ba byed cing /
translated: The young men and maidens of the city, who had been sent out first, and then the princes and princesses, all of them, with their incense, flowers, and powders, made offerings to the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes nas n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' rab nyid du byon no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes nas n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' rab nyid du byon no //
translated: The Blessed One accepted them and then went to the Nyagrodha Grove.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis stong phrag nyi shu'i zag ba zad ba'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas gdan bshams pa mchog la sangs rgyas bzhugs so //
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis stong phrag nyi shu'i zag ba zad ba'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas gdan bshams pa mchog la sangs rgyas bzhugs so //
translated: There, the Blessed One, surrounded by twenty thousand monks whose defilements had ceased, sat on the prepared seat.

original: sh'akya'i rigs ni nga rgyal dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs ni nga rgyal dang ldan pa yin //
translated: The Śākya clan is proud.🔽Their minds are rough.

original: sems rtsub pa yin pas 'di ni don grub gzhon nu /🔽nged dang lhan cig gzhon nu yin no //🔽nged ni phu bo yin no //
analyzed: sems rtsub pa yin pas 'di ni don grub gzhon nu / nged dang lhan cig gzhon nu yin no // nged ni phu bo yin no //
translated: “This Siddhārtha is a young man.🔽He is our cousin.

original: 'di ni sring mo'i bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sring mo'i bu yin no //
translated: He is the son of our sister.

original: 'di ni tsha bo yin zhes bsams nas khye'u dang / rgyal po'i gzhon nu zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'di ni tsha bo yin zhes bsams nas khye'u dang / rgyal po'i gzhon nu zhes smras te /
translated: Thinking, This is my nephew, he said, Child, and prince,

original: khyed kyi phyag gis bdag khyod kyi rgyab tu sdod do zhes bsams so //
analyzed: khyed kyi phyag gis bdag khyod kyi rgyab tu sdod do zhes bsams so //
translated: I will sit behind you with my hands folded.

original: de rnams de bzhin du gnas nas /
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin du gnas nas /
translated: They all sat down as they had been told.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa gzigs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa gzigs nas /
translated: The Blessed One, seeing their thoughts,

original: gnyen rnams bdag la phyag mi byed bar 'dod kyang da lta phyag byed du gzhug dgos te /
analyzed: gnyen rnams bdag la phyag mi byed bar 'dod kyang da lta phyag byed du gzhug dgos te /
translated: thought, I want them to bow to me, but they do not want to bow to me. I must make them bow now.

original: mngon par shes pa'i gzhi dang / ye shes dang / bsam gtan dang ldan par 'jug @380b pa bskyed dgos snyam ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i gzhi dang / ye shes dang / bsam gtan dang ldan par 'jug @380b pa bskyed dgos snyam ste /
translated: I must generate the basis of superknowledge, knowledge, and concentration.

original: bzhengs nas nam mkha' la gshegs so //
analyzed: bzhengs nas nam mkha' la gshegs so //
translated: He rose up into the sky.

original: de rnams kyi mgo la zhabs kyi rdul lhung ba bzhin du aa mra bsrung ba'i aa mra'i shing gi drung du so so'i cho 'phrul dang mtshungs par cho 'phrul mdzad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mgo la zhabs kyi rdul lhung ba bzhin du aa mra bsrung ba'i aa mra'i shing gi drung du so so'i cho 'phrul dang mtshungs par cho 'phrul mdzad do //
translated: Like dust falling on their heads, they each performed miracles in front of the mango tree that guarded the mango grove.

original: rgyal pos de ya mtshan che ba mthong ngo zhes smras so //
analyzed: rgyal pos de ya mtshan che ba mthong ngo zhes smras so //
translated: The king said, I see this as a great wonder.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyed 'khrungs pa'i nyin mo dka' thub pa nag po lha len gyis phyag byed cing nye bar gnas pas khyed kyis zhabs bskyod pa bram ze'i spyi bo la nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyed 'khrungs pa'i nyin mo dka' thub pa nag po lha len gyis phyag byed cing nye bar gnas pas khyed kyis zhabs bskyod pa bram ze'i spyi bo la nye bar gnas so //
translated: On the day of your birth, O Blessed One, the ascetic Kāla, the son of Deva, paid homage to you and stood by your side. Your foot came close to the head of the brahmin.

original: de mthong nas bdag gis kyang khyed la phyag byas so //
analyzed: de mthong nas bdag gis kyang khyed la phyag byas so //
translated: Seeing this, I also paid homage to you.

original: 'di ni bdag gi phyag dang po yin no; ;bkra shis pa'i 'bru 'debs pa'i nyin mo dzam bu'i shing gi grib ma'i dpal gyi mal stan la khyed bzhugs pa na shing dzambu'i grib mas ma btang bar mthong ba'i tshe yang zhabs la phyag byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi phyag dang po yin no; ;bkra shis pa'i 'bru 'debs pa'i nyin mo dzam bu'i shing gi grib ma'i dpal gyi mal stan la khyed bzhugs pa na shing dzambu'i grib mas ma btang bar mthong ba'i tshe yang zhabs la phyag byas so //
translated: This was my first homage. On the day of the auspicious planting of the seeds, when you were sitting on a bed of glory in the shade of the Jambu tree, I saw that the shade of the Jambu tree did not leave you, and I paid homage at your feet.

original: 'di ni bdag gis phyag gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis phyag gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This was my second homage.

original: da lta ni bdag gis sngar ma mthong ba'i cho 'phrul yang mthong bas khyed kyi zhabs la phyag bgyid do //
analyzed: da lta ni bdag gis sngar ma mthong ba'i cho 'phrul yang mthong bas khyed kyi zhabs la phyag bgyid do //
translated: Now, I see a miracle that I have never seen before, and I pay homage at your feet.

original: 'di ni bdag gi phyag gsum ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi phyag gsum ba yin no //
translated: This is my third homage.

original: slar yang rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed cing /
analyzed: slar yang rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed cing /
translated: Again, the king paid homage to the Blessed One,🔽and said:

original: phyag byed bar mi nus pa'i sh'akya'i rigs gcig kyang med do //
analyzed: phyag byed bar mi nus pa'i sh'akya'i rigs gcig kyang med do //
translated: There was not a single Śākya who was not able to pay homage.

original: thams cad kyis kyang phyag byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang phyag byed pa nyid do //
translated: All of them paid homage.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la nye du rnams kyis phyag byed cing nam mkha' las babs nas gdan bshams pa'i mchog gi gung la bzhugs so /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la nye du rnams kyis phyag byed cing nam mkha' las babs nas gdan bshams pa'i mchog gi gung la bzhugs so /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having been paid homage by his relatives, descended from the sky and sat on the best prepared seat in the middle.

original: @381a *// bcom ldan 'das bzhugs nas nye du rnams dang 'dus par gyur pa thams cad sems gcig tu gnas so //
analyzed: @381a *// bcom ldan 'das bzhugs nas nye du rnams dang 'dus par gyur pa thams cad sems gcig tu gnas so //
translated: When the Blessed One sat down, all the assembled relatives became one-pointed in mind.

original: de nas sprin chen po las padma'i 'dab ma la chu mi 'chags pa lta bu'i char 'bebs so //
analyzed: de nas sprin chen po las padma'i 'dab ma la chu mi 'chags pa lta bu'i char 'bebs so //
translated: Then a rain fell like the petals of a great cloud, with no water adhering.

original: chu zangs gyi mdog can sa la sgra sgrogs shing 'bab bo //
analyzed: chu zangs gyi mdog can sa la sgra sgrogs shing 'bab bo //
translated: The copper-colored water fell to the ground with a roaring sound.

original: 'bang bar 'dod ba rnams 'bang ngo //
analyzed: 'bang bar 'dod ba rnams 'bang ngo //
translated: Those who wanted to be slaves became slaves.

original: 'bang bar mi 'dod pa rnams mi 'bang ngo //
analyzed: 'bang bar mi 'dod pa rnams mi 'bang ngo //
translated: Those who did not want to be slaves did not become slaves.

original: thigs pa tsam yang mi ltung ngo //🔽de mthong nas thams cad du ya mtshan pa dang / rmad du byung ba skyes so //
analyzed: thigs pa tsam yang mi ltung ngo // de mthong nas thams cad du ya mtshan pa dang / rmad du byung ba skyes so //
translated: Not even a drop fell.

original: ae ma ho /
analyzed: ae ma ho /
translated: Seeing that, everyone was amazed and gave rise to the marvelous thought, Emaho!

original: ngo mtshar che /
analyzed: ngo mtshar che /
translated: How wonderful!

original: ae ma ho /
analyzed: ae ma ho /
translated: They exclaimed, Oh, how wonderful!

original: rmad du byung ngo zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: rmad du byung ngo zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: How marvelous!

original: ston pas 'di kho na ma yin gyi bdag gi nye du dang phrad pa na padma'i 'dab ma la chu mi 'chags pa lta bu'i char 'bebs shing 'das pa'i dus su'ang ngas phab po //
analyzed: ston pas 'di kho na ma yin gyi bdag gi nye du dang phrad pa na padma'i 'dab ma la chu mi 'chags pa lta bu'i char 'bebs shing 'das pa'i dus su'ang ngas phab po //
translated: The Teacher said, Not only now, but in the past as well I caused rain to fall like drops of water on lotus leaves when my relatives were suffering from drought.

original: 'di'i don byung ba ni thams cad sgrol gyi skye rabs su bshad do //
analyzed: 'di'i don byung ba ni thams cad sgrol gyi skye rabs su bshad do //
translated: The story of this event is explained in the Jataka of Visvantara.

original: chos ston pa thos nas thams cad langs te phyag byas nas song ngo //
analyzed: chos ston pa thos nas thams cad langs te phyag byas nas song ngo //
translated: Having heard the teaching of the Dharma, all of them rose, made prostrations, and departed.

original: gcig gis kyang rgyal po dang / rgyal tshab dang / blon po rnams sang bdag gi gnas su bsod snyoms khyer 'ong ngo zhes smra ba de rnams las gcig kyang ma byung ngo //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang rgyal po dang / rgyal tshab dang / blon po rnams sang bdag gi gnas su bsod snyoms khyer 'ong ngo zhes smra ba de rnams las gcig kyang ma byung ngo //
translated: Not a single one of them said, Tomorrow, the king, the crown prince, and the ministers will come to my house to take their alms.

original: ston pas slar nyi ma gnyis pa la stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir bsod snyoms la bzhud do //
analyzed: ston pas slar nyi ma gnyis pa la stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor du byas nas grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir bsod snyoms la bzhud do //
translated: On the second day, the Teacher, accompanied by a retinue of twenty thousand monks, went to the city of Kapilavastu to receive alms.

original: gang zhig mgron du gnyer ba dang / gang zhig mgron @381b du gnyer ba dang / lhung bzed khyer ba su yang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig mgron du gnyer ba dang / gang zhig mgron @381b du gnyer ba dang / lhung bzed khyer ba su yang med do //
translated: No one was invited as a guest, nor was anyone carrying a begging bowl.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgo drung du 'khod de rnam par brtags pas ji ltar sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs kyi grong khyer du byon nas bsod snyoms mdzad pa bzhin du gang ji ltar rigs par mi chen po'i khyim du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgo drung du 'khod de rnam par brtags pas ji ltar sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs kyi grong khyer du byon nas bsod snyoms mdzad pa bzhin du gang ji ltar rigs par mi chen po'i khyim du 'gro zhing /
translated: The Blessed One stood at the door and observed how the previous Buddhas had entered the city of the noble clan and taken alms as appropriate.

original: yang na go rim bzhin du bsod snyoms spyod do //
analyzed: yang na go rim bzhin du bsod snyoms spyod do //
translated: He then proceeded to take alms in the proper order.

original: de nas sangs rgyas gcig gis kyang ji ltar rigs par gshegs bam mthong bas bdag gis kyang da ni 'di'i rigs so //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas gcig gis kyang ji ltar rigs par gshegs bam mthong bas bdag gis kyang da ni 'di'i rigs so //
translated: Then, seeing that one Buddha had gone as appropriate, he thought, Now it is my turn.

original: 'di sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs bzhin du bdag gis kyang rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs bzhin du bdag gis kyang rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it was the clan of the previous Buddhas, it is also my turn.

original: bdag gi nyan thos kyang bdag nyid bzhin rjes su slob cing bsod snyoms la rdzogs par byon no //
analyzed: bdag gi nyan thos kyang bdag nyid bzhin rjes su slob cing bsod snyoms la rdzogs par byon no //
translated: My disciples also follow my example and proceed to take alms in the proper order.

original: 'khod pa'i khyim nas bzung nas go rim bzhin du bsod snyoms la spyod do //
analyzed: 'khod pa'i khyim nas bzung nas go rim bzhin du bsod snyoms la spyod do //
translated: He then went on his alms round in the order in which the houses were arranged.

original: 'phags pa gzhon nu don grub bsod snyoms la gshegs so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa gzhon nu don grub bsod snyoms la gshegs so zhes brjod do //
translated: The people said, The noble Siddhārtha has come for alms.

original: nyis thog dang / sum thog la sogs pa'i khang bzang rnams su steng gi sgo chung phye nas mi thams cad blta bar gyur te /
analyzed: nyis thog dang / sum thog la sogs pa'i khang bzang rnams su steng gi sgo chung phye nas mi thams cad blta bar gyur te /
translated: In the mansions with their two and three stories, they opened the upper windows and all the people looked out.

original: lha mo sgra gcan 'dzin gyi yum yang 'phags pa'i bu /
analyzed: lha mo sgra gcan 'dzin gyi yum yang 'phags pa'i bu /
translated: Even Yaśodharā, Rāhula's mother, said, Noble son!

original: grong khyer 'di nyid du rgyal po chen po'i mthus gser gyi do li la sogs pa la zhon te de ring nas skra dang / kha spu bregs shing dur smrig gi gos byon nas /🔽snod lag tu khyer te /🔽bsod snyoms la 'gro ba mdzes sam mi mdzes zhes steng gi sgo chung phye nas blta'o //
analyzed: grong khyer 'di nyid du rgyal po chen po'i mthus gser gyi do li la sogs pa la zhon te de ring nas skra dang / kha spu bregs shing dur smrig gi gos byon nas / snod lag tu khyer te / bsod snyoms la 'gro ba mdzes sam mi mdzes zhes steng gi sgo chung phye nas blta'o //
translated: Today, by the power of the great king, you have shaved your hair and beard, put on saffron robes, and gone forth on a golden palanquin.🔽She opened the upper window and looked out, saying, Is it beautiful to carry a bowl in your hand and go for alms?

original: sna tshogs ba'i 'dod chags @382a *//
analyzed: sna tshogs ba'i 'dod chags @382a *//
translated: Is it beautiful?

original: dang bral ba yang dag par 'bar zhing sku lus kyi 'od kyi grong khyer gyi steng thams cad snang bar mdzad de /
analyzed: dang bral ba yang dag par 'bar zhing sku lus kyi 'od kyi grong khyer gyi steng thams cad snang bar mdzad de /
translated: He was completely ablaze with the splendor of the major and minor marks, and the light from his body illuminated the entire city.

original: 'dom gang pa'i 'od kun nas bskor zhing rab tu gsal ba dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dom gang pa'i 'od kun nas bskor zhing rab tu gsal ba dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa /
translated: He was surrounded by an aura of light a fathom wide, and he was radiant.

original: skyes bu chen bo'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen bo'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dpal dpe med par rnam par gsal ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dpal dpe med par rnam par gsal ba mthong ngo //
translated: He was the splendor of the buddhas, shining with incomparable brilliance.

original: gtsug tor nas bzung nas zhabs kyi mthil gyi bar de srid do //
analyzed: gtsug tor nas bzung nas zhabs kyi mthil gyi bar de srid do //
translated: From his crown protuberance down to the soles of his feet,🔽his hair curls to the right, is soft, black, and shiny,

original: dbu skra g-yas 'khyil 'jam nag snum pa dang // dpral ba dri med nyi ma'i mthil bzhin no //
analyzed: dbu skra g-yas 'khyil 'jam nag snum pa dang // dpral ba dri med nyi ma'i mthil bzhin no //
translated: and his forehead is spotless, like the surface of the sun.🔽His nose is prominent, in proportion to his body,

original: sku dang 'tshams pa'i shangs ni mtho ba dang // mi yi seng ge 'od zer gsal bar mdzad //
analyzed: sku dang 'tshams pa'i shangs ni mtho ba dang // mi yi seng ge 'od zer gsal bar mdzad //
translated: and the Lion of Men shines with light rays.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i mi'i seng ge la tshigs su bcad bas mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i mi'i seng ge la tshigs su bcad bas mngon par bstod do //
translated: He praised the Lion of Men with verses such as these.

original: khyed kyi sras ngo bsod snyoms la spyod do //
analyzed: khyed kyi sras ngo bsod snyoms la spyod do //
translated: Your son is practicing mendicancy.

original: zhes rgyal po la smras so //
analyzed: zhes rgyal po la smras so //
translated: He said this to the king.

original: rgyal po'i sems sdug bsngal bas gos nas bzung ste myur zhing myur bar phyir 'thon ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i sems sdug bsngal bas gos nas bzung ste myur zhing myur bar phyir 'thon ste /
translated: The king, his mind troubled, quickly got up from his seat

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du 'khod nas smras pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du 'khod nas smras pa /
translated: and went to where the Blessed One was. He said,

original: ci btsun pa /
analyzed: ci btsun pa /
translated: “Venerable!

original: bdag cag ngo tsha bas ci'i don du bsod snyoms mdzad /
analyzed: bdag cag ngo tsha bas ci'i don du bsod snyoms mdzad /
translated: Why did you take alms for us out of shame?

original: dge slong 'di rnams kyi bza' ba bdag gis ster bar mi shes bsam pa yin nam /
analyzed: dge slong 'di rnams kyi bza' ba bdag gis ster bar mi shes bsam pa yin nam /
translated: Do you think I don’t know how to provide food for these monks?”

original: ci lags / rgyal po chen po'i rigs kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci lags / rgyal po chen po'i rigs kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Is it the custom of the great royal family?”

original: btsun pa / bdag cag sh'akya'i rigs zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag sh'akya'i rigs zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: “Venerable! We are the Śākya family.”

original: de la rgyal rigs gcig kyang @382b bsod snyoms byed pa'i ming tsam yang med do //
analyzed: de la rgyal rigs gcig kyang @382b bsod snyoms byed pa'i ming tsam yang med do //
translated: “There is not even a name for a Śākya who takes alms.”

original: rgyal po chen po'i rigs zhas bya ba ni khyod kyi rigs 'di yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'i rigs zhas bya ba ni khyod kyi rigs 'di yin no //
translated: “The great royal family is your family.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King!

original: mi dgyes pa ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: mi dgyes pa ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be displeased.

original: slar yang bdag cag gis mar me mdzad dang / koonda n+yi dang / 'od srung zhes bya ba 'di sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no //
analyzed: slar yang bdag cag gis mar me mdzad dang / koonda n+yi dang / 'od srung zhes bya ba 'di sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no //
translated: “Again, we have the families of the Buddhas, namely, Dīpaṃkara, Koṇḍañña, and Kāśyapa.

original: 'di rnams dang / gzhan sangs rgyas stong phrag du mas kyang bsod snyoms spyod cing 'tsho bar mdzad la /
analyzed: 'di rnams dang / gzhan sangs rgyas stong phrag du mas kyang bsod snyoms spyod cing 'tsho bar mdzad la /
translated: These and many thousands of other Buddhas have lived on almsfood.

original: srang gi dbus su 'khod pa nyid do //
analyzed: srang gi dbus su 'khod pa nyid do //
translated: They have sat down in the middle of the street.

original: bag med lhag mar byed pa med //
analyzed: bag med lhag mar byed pa med //
translated: They have not left any remainder for the careless.

original: chos la spyod cing legs par spyod //
analyzed: chos la spyod cing legs par spyod //
translated: They have practiced the Dharma and have practiced well.

original: chos la spyad na bde ba 'byung //
analyzed: chos la spyad na bde ba 'byung //
translated: When one practices the Dharma, happiness arises.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang phyi mar bde //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang phyi mar bde //
translated: It is happy in this world and the next.

original: chos kyi rkang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di bstan cing bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rkang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di bstan cing bshad do //
translated: This verse on the feet of Dharma has been taught and explained.🔽At the end of the verse, the king attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i mthar rgyal pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo; ;chos spyod pa ni legs par spyod //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i mthar rgyal pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo; ;chos spyod pa ni legs par spyod //
translated: One should practice the Dharma well.

original: nyes par spyod pa mi bya zhing //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa mi bya zhing //
translated: One should not practice what is wrong.

original: chos spyad pa yis bde ba 'byung //
analyzed: chos spyad pa yis bde ba 'byung //
translated: When one practices the Dharma, happiness arises.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu'o //
translated: It is happy in this world and the next.

original: slar yang chos kyi rkang pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di thos nas lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang chos kyi rkang pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di thos nas lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: Then, hearing this verse of the Dharma, he attained the fruit of the Once-Returner.

original: chos skyong ba'i skyes rabs thos nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: chos skyong ba'i skyes rabs thos nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: Having heard the Jataka of the Dharma-protector, he attained the fruit of the Non-Returner.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su gdugs dkar po'i 'og tu dpal gyi mal stan gyi steng du gzims pa nyid na dgra bcom pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su gdugs dkar po'i 'og tu dpal gyi mal stan gyi steng du gzims pa nyid na dgra bcom pa thob par gyur to //
translated: At the time of his death, he attained the state of Arhatship while lying on a glorious bed under a white parasol.

original: dgon par gnas nas dka' thub spyod pa @383a *//
analyzed: dgon par gnas nas dka' thub spyod pa @383a *//
translated: He practiced austerities while living in the wilderness.

original: rgyal po la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: rgyal po la dgos pa med do //
translated: The king had no need of him.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas nas /
translated: Having actualized the fruit of the Stream-Enterer,

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bzung ste /
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bzung ste /
translated: he again held the Blessed One's begging bowl.

original: 'khor dang bcas ba khang bzang chen bo'i steng du sbyan drangs nas gya nom ba'i bza' ba dang bcas ba rnams drangs so //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas ba khang bzang chen bo'i steng du sbyan drangs nas gya nom ba'i bza' ba dang bcas ba rnams drangs so //
translated: Together with his retinue, he invited the Blessed One to the top of the great palace and served them delicious food.

original: gdugs tshod zin pa'i mthar sgra gcan 'dzin gyi ma ma gtogs ba'i btsun mo 'khor dang bcas ba thams cad 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas so //
analyzed: gdugs tshod zin pa'i mthar sgra gcan 'dzin gyi ma ma gtogs ba'i btsun mo 'khor dang bcas ba thams cad 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas so //
translated: At the end of the meal, all the queens and their retinue came, except for the nurse of Rahula. They all bowed down to the Lord.

original: gzhan yang / des 'khor gyi mi rnams la 'phags pa'i bu la phyag gyis zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang / des 'khor gyi mi rnams la 'phags pa'i bu la phyag gyis zhes brjod nas /
translated: She said to the people in the retinue, “Bow down to the noble son.”

original: gal te kho mo la yon tan yod na 'phags ba'i bu rang nyid kyi gnas su 'byon no //
analyzed: gal te kho mo la yon tan yod na 'phags ba'i bu rang nyid kyi gnas su 'byon no //
translated: “If I have any virtue, the noble son will come to his own place.

analyzed: byon ba nyid na de la phyag byed do zhes brjod nas ma 'ongs so //
translated: When he comes, I will bow down to him.” But she did not come.

original: rgyal pos lhung bzed bzung nas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos mchog gnyis dang bcas pa rgyal po'i bu mo'i khang bzang du gshegs te /
analyzed: rgyal pos lhung bzed bzung nas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos mchog gnyis dang bcas pa rgyal po'i bu mo'i khang bzang du gshegs te /
translated: The king took the begging bowl and the Lord, together with the two supreme disciples, went to the palace of the king’s daughter.

original: rgyal bo'i bu mo rang nyid ji ltar mos pa'i phyag byed cing gzhan dang 'gal ba cung zad kyang ma byed ces nas gdan bshams ba mchog gi gung la bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal bo'i bu mo rang nyid ji ltar mos pa'i phyag byed cing gzhan dang 'gal ba cung zad kyang ma byed ces nas gdan bshams ba mchog gi gung la bzhugs so //
translated: The king’s daughter herself bowed down in whatever way she wished and said, “Do not contradict anyone else.” Then she sat down on the best seat that had been prepared.

original: de myur du 'ongs nas byin pa bzung ste /
analyzed: de myur du 'ongs nas byin pa bzung ste /
translated: She quickly came and took hold of the hem of his robe.

original: zhabs kyi steng du mgo bo bzhag nas ji ltar 'dod ba'i phyag byas so //
analyzed: zhabs kyi steng du mgo bo bzhag nas ji ltar 'dod ba'i phyag byas so //
translated: She placed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and made obeisance as she wished.

original: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i bu mos bcom ldan 'das la dga' ba mang bos yon tan la sogs pas /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i bu mos bcom ldan 'das la dga' ba mang bos yon tan la sogs pas /
translated: The king and his daughter, with great joy toward the Blessed One,

original: yon tan dang @383b ldan par brjod nas /
analyzed: yon tan dang @383b ldan par brjod nas /
translated: spoke of his qualities and so forth.

original: btsun pa / bdag gi bu mos nyid kyis gos ngur smrig gyon pa thos nas /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag gi bu mos nyid kyis gos ngur smrig gyon pa thos nas /
translated: “Noble One, my daughter, having heard that you yourself wear saffron robes,

analyzed: de nas bzung ste deng gi bar du gos dur smrig gyon no //
translated: has worn saffron robes ever since.

original: nyid kyis gdugs tshod lan gcig gsol ba thos nas bu mos kyang bza' ba lan gcig zos so //
analyzed: nyid kyis gdugs tshod lan gcig gsol ba thos nas bu mos kyang bza' ba lan gcig zos so //
translated: Having heard that you take a single meal a day, my daughter has also eaten a single meal.

original: nyid gyis mal stan chen po spangs pa thos nas /
analyzed: nyid gyis mal stan chen po spangs pa thos nas /
translated: Having heard that you have abandoned a large bed,

original: nyal khri chung ba la nyal lo //
analyzed: nyal khri chung ba la nyal lo //
translated: she sleeps on a small bed.

original: nyid kyis me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos la sogs pa la sred pa med pa thos nas /
analyzed: nyid kyis me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos la sogs pa la sred pa med pa thos nas /
translated: Having heard that you have no craving for flower garlands, incense, and so forth,

analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dang / spos la sogs pa la chags ba med ba skyes so //
translated: she has given rise to non-attachment to flower garlands, incense, and so forth.

original: rang gi nye du rnams bdag gis gso'o zhes 'phrin bskur nas /
analyzed: rang gi nye du rnams bdag gis gso'o zhes 'phrin bskur nas /
translated: She sends a message saying, ‘I will support my relatives myself.’

original: gnyen gcig la yang lta ba mi 'dug go /
analyzed: gnyen gcig la yang lta ba mi 'dug go /
translated: I do not see any other relative.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni bdag gi bu mo yin no zhes gsol to //
translated: my daughter has such qualities.”

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King,

original: ya mtshan mi che'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan mi che'o //
translated: it is not surprising.

analyzed: 'di da lta khyed srung bar byed pa'i rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes yongs su smin par rang gis bsrung ngo //
translated: This is the princess who now protects you. She protects herself with the ripening of wisdom.

original: sngar bsrung ba med cing ri la sogs pa la 'gro ba na /
analyzed: sngar bsrung ba med cing ri la sogs pa la 'gro ba na /
translated: Previously, when she went to the mountains and so on without protection,

original: ye shes yongs su ma rdzogs par rang gis bsrungs so zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: ye shes yongs su ma rdzogs par rang gis bsrungs so zhes gsungs nas /
translated: she protected herself with incomplete wisdom.”

original: mi'am ci zla ba'i skyes rabs gsungs te /
analyzed: mi'am ci zla ba'i skyes rabs gsungs te /
translated: Then he told the story of the kinnara Candra.🔽After rising from his seat, he departed.

original: gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs so; ;nyi ma gnyis pa la rgyal bu gzhon nu dga' bo rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / khang pa gsar ba'i nang du zhugs te bkra shis pa'i bag ma blangs nas nye bar gnas @384a *//
analyzed: gdan las bzhengs nas gshegs so; ;nyi ma gnyis pa la rgyal bu gzhon nu dga' bo rgyal por dbang bskur ba dang / khang pa gsar ba'i nang du zhugs te bkra shis pa'i bag ma blangs nas nye bar gnas @384a *//
translated: On the second day, Prince Nanda was consecrated as king, entered the new palace, took a virtuous wife, and remained there.🔽He went to his house

original: so; ;de'i khyim du gshegs nas /
analyzed: so; ;de'i khyim du gshegs nas /
translated: and said,🔽“I have obtained a wife.”

original: gzhon nu / lhung bzed gzung zhig ces rab tu dbyung bar dgongs nas bkra shis brjod de /
analyzed: gzhon nu / lhung bzed gzung zhig ces rab tu dbyung bar dgongs nas bkra shis brjod de /
translated: The Blessed One thought, Young man, take the bowl, and, having pronounced the benediction,

original: gdan la bzhengs nas gshegs so //
analyzed: gdan la bzhengs nas gshegs so //
translated: he rose from his seat and departed.

original: ljongs kyi dge ba'i bu mos 'gro ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: ljongs kyi dge ba'i bu mos 'gro ba mthong ngo //
translated: The virtuous women of the country saw him going.

original: 'phags pa'i bu myur du shog ces brjod nas blta'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bu myur du shog ces brjod nas blta'o //
translated: They said, Noble one, come quickly! and looked.

analyzed: des kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed de bzung bar ma nus nas gtsug lag khang nyid du gshegs so //
translated: He too was unable to lift the Blessed One's bowl, and so he went to the monastery.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la 'dod pa med pa nyid kyang rab tu 'byung ba byed do //
translated: The Blessed One, who had no desire for it, performed the going-forth.

analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das grong khyer ser skyar gshegs shing nyi ma gsum pa la dga' bo rab tu byung bar byas so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One went to the city of Kapilavastu, and on the third day he caused Nanda to go forth.

original: nyi ma bdun ba la sgra gcan 'dzin gyi mas /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun ba la sgra gcan 'dzin gyi mas /
translated: On the seventh day, Rāhula's mother

original: gzhon nu rgyan gyis brgyan nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu rgyan gyis brgyan nas /
translated: adorned the young man with ornaments

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du btang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du btang ngo //
translated: and sent him into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bu; stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor dang bcas pa 'di rnams ltos /
analyzed: bu; stong phrag nyi shu'i dge slong 'khor dang bcas pa 'di rnams ltos /
translated: Son, look at these twenty thousand monks with their retinues.

original: gser gyi kha dog can gyi tshangs pa'i gzugs kyi mdog can /
analyzed: gser gyi kha dog can gyi tshangs pa'i gzugs kyi mdog can /

original: mgon med zas sbyin gyis nyi ma gnyis pa nas bzung nas sbyin pa gtong ba'i mgo brtsams so; ;sa khams byas pa'i khang bzang ni zla ba bzhis grub bo //
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin gyis nyi ma gnyis pa nas bzung nas sbyin pa gtong ba'i mgo brtsams so; ;sa khams byas pa'i khang bzang ni zla ba bzhis grub bo //
translated: Anāthapiṇḍada began giving on the second day. The palace made of earth elements was completed in four months.

analyzed: slar yang mgon med zas sbyin gyi gtsug lag khang chen po zla ba dgus grub bo //
translated: Again, Anāthapiṇḍada's great monastery was completed in nine months.

analyzed: gtsug lag khang chen po la yang bye ba stong phrag bco brgyad nyid song ngo //

analyzed: 'di la gtsug lag khang chen po 'di nyid la bye ba phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'i nor yongs su btang ngo //
translated: For this, he gave away the wealth of 540 million.

original: slar yang 'das pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs kyi dus su tshong dpon kun gyi grogs zhes bya bas gser gyi glang bo'i rkang ba'i rmig rjes lta bu'i sa gzhi nyos nas /

translated: Again, in the time of the past Bhagavat Vipaśyin, a merchant called Sarvasuhṛdaya bought a piece of land the size of an elephant’s footprint in gold,

translated: In the time of the Bhagavat Śikhin,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad skyob kyi dus su tshong dpon bkra shis zhes bya bas gser gyis gzhi gser gyi rkang pa'i rjes lta bu'i sa gzhi nyos nas gnas de nyid du dpag tshad phyed kyi dge 'dun gyi kun dga' rab byas so // bcom ldan 'das log par dad sel gyi dus su tshong dpon 'pho ba med pa zhes bya bas gser gyi pha gu lta bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sa gzhi nyos nas gnas de nyid du rgyang grags bzhi'i tshad kyi dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba byas so

original: // bcom ldan 'das gser thub kyi dus su tshong dpon drag po zhes bya bas gser gyi rus sbal rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu'i sa gzhi nyos nas gnas de nyid du rgyang grags gnyis kyi tshad kyi kun dga' ra ba byas so //
analyzed: // bcom ldan 'das gser thub kyi dus su tshong dpon drag po zhes bya bas gser gyi rus sbal rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu'i sa gzhi nyos nas gnas de nyid du rgyang grags gnyis kyi tshad kyi kun dga' ra ba byas so //
translated: At the time of the Lord Kanakamuni, a merchant called Rudra bought a piece of ground like a golden tortoise without interruption and built a monastery of two kṣoṇḍukas there.

translated: In the time of the Blessed Kaśyapa, the merchant Bhadraśrī bought the ground with an uninterrupted stream of gold coins and built a monastery there, one league in size.

original: kun dga' rab byas so //🔽gnas 'di sangs @388a *//
analyzed: kun dga' rab byas so // gnas 'di sangs @388a *//
translated: Again, in the time of our Blessed One, the merchant Anāthapiṇḍada bought the ground with eighteen million gold coins, and built a monastery there, one league in size.

original: rgyas thams cad kyis ma spangs pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: rgyas thams cad kyis ma spangs pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: This place is not abandoned by all the Buddhas.

original: 'di ltar byang chub chen po'i snying po'i drung du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa ji srid pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa de srid du gang dang gang gi gnas su bcom ldan 'das bdag bzhugs pa 'di ni nye ba'i
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub chen po'i snying po'i drung du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa ji srid pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa de srid du gang dang gang gi gnas su bcom ldan 'das bdag bzhugs pa 'di ni nye ba'i
translated: In this way, from the time of attaining omniscient wisdom in the presence of the essence of great enlightenment until the final point of passing into parinirvana, wherever the Bhagavat resides, this is the closest🔽

original: gleng gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, for as long as the Blessed One remains in any place, from the time of attaining omniscient wisdom in the presence of the essence of great enlightenment until the final parinirvāṇa, this is called the nidāna.

original: de'i lus kyis skyes rabs thams cad du bsngags par mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i lus kyis skyes rabs thams cad du bsngags par mdzad de /

analyzed: skyes ba rabs kyi gleng gzhi'i bshad pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The explanation of the nidāna of the Jātakas is complete.

analyzed: pandi ta a'a nanda shr'i'i zhal snga nas dang / mang du thos pa'i lo tstsha ba sh'a kya'i dge slong nyi ma rgyal mtshan dpal bzang pos /
translated: By the paṇḍita Ānandaśrī and the learned Tibetan monk Nyima Gyaltsen Pal Zangpo,

analyzed: skad gnyis smra ba rnams kyi gdan sa gtsug lag khang chen po dpal thar pa gling du bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: this was translated, revised, and finalized at the great temple of the seat of the bilinguals, the glorious Tarpaling.
